loans.name: Chhoen's Group

texts.en:
Originally in a village of the Battambang province’s Thmor Koul district, Chhoen is a 55-year-old mother of nine children. One of her children is dependent on her and helps the family’s business. Chhoen has farmed rice on 1.5 hectares of farmland for 20 years to make a living. She is able to earn about KHR 30,000 per day and save about KHR 10,000 each day for her future needs. Insufficient water supply and fertilizer for supporting her paddy field are still the main challenges for her business.

Chhoen’s group consists of two members who have been with VisionFund for one cycle. Chhoen fully repaid the past loan, which helped her relieve her family’s burden and improve their livelihood. Now, she and her group member are requesting a loan of KHR 600,000 and KHR 1,000,000, respectively. As the leader, Chhoen will use her portion to buy fertilizer for her farmland and to pay for labor fees in plowing the field. She hopes this loan will help her grow healthy and fruitful rice so as to improve her family’s lifestyle.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer for her farmland

loans.name: Rahamatou

texts.fr: Jeune dame de 28ans, Rahamatou est célibataire et n’a pas d’enfants en charge. Elle est revendeuse des produits d’alimentation générale depuis 2005 dans un marché de la place. Avec son troisième crédit qu’elle sollicite à WAGES, elle va acheter des produits d’alimentation générale, revendre,tirer des profits pour pouvoir assurer son bien être et se marier plus tard.
texts.en:
A young 28-year-old woman, Rahamatou is single and does not have any children under her care. 

She has been selling general food products in a local market since 2005. 

With her third loan from WAGES, she is going to buy general food products, resell them, and make profits in order to ensure her well-being and to get married later.

loans.use: to buy general food products

loans.name: Josephine

texts.fr: Joséphine a 43ans et son conjoint est retraité. Pour pouvoir joindre les deux bouts, elle vend il y a 01an des produits céréaliers et des tubercules dans un marché de la place. Son approvisionnement se fait soit à Lomé ou dans les villes environnantes du pays. Pour augmenter son stock de marchandises, elle sollicite de WAGES un premier crédit pour s’acheter des produits céréaliers et des tubercules. Avec les profits qu’elle réalisera, elle va augmenter son chiffre d’affaire et assurer le bien être de la famille.
texts.en:
Joséphine is 43 years old and her husband is retired. To make ends meet, she has been selling grains and tubers in a local market for the past year. She gets her supplies in Lomé or in neighboring towns of the country. 

To increase her stock, she is asking WAGES for a first loan to buy grains and tubers. With the profits that she will make, she is going to increase her income and ensure the well-being of her family.

loans.use: to buy grains and tubers

loans.name: Shefqet

texts.en:
Shefqet is in his early sixties and lives in a rural village in central Albania. He lives with a married son and his children. A couple of years back, his wife passed away. Since then, he has been looking after his grandniece, who he very much adores. He is also shifting his focus to animal husbandry and agriculture. His progress in this activity looks good, and he makes a good income from it, should he work hard.

Shefqet wants to buy fodder for his animals, and this is the reason he is applying for a loan through VisionFund Albania.

His dream is to add some more goats and sheep in the near future and make and save enough money to educate his grandniece (the one he has been photographed with for this profile).

loans.use: To stock up on winter fodder for his animals

loans.name: Bellavista  (Cuenca) Group

texts.es:
El banco comunal Bellavista está conformado por 7 socias y 1 socio quienes son vecinos y amigos, viven por una comunidad que  pertenece a la parroquia  Victoria del Portete en Cuenca, lugar de extensas llanuras y hermosos paisajes, su clima es frió. Su gente trabaja en la ganadería, cría de animales pequeños, agricultura y muchos trabajan en la ciudad en diferentes actividades, se caracterizan también por ser personas que aun mantienen viva la cultura y tradiciones de sus pueblos.

Una de las socias de este grupo es la Señora. Ligia, tiene 24 años, es casada y ha concebido 2 hijos  de 4 y 2 años de edad. Su esposo labora prestando sus servicios en una compañía privada, la casa en la que viven no es propia.

La Señora. Ligia pasa la mayor parte de su tiempo al cuidado de sus hijos que son pequeños, como tiene terreno se dedica a la crianza de ganado desde hace 4 años, trabaja cuidando su ganado de domingo a domingo sin un horario fijo, la leche que obtiene la vende en su comunidad.
 
Su crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de ganado para continuar creciendo en la cría de estos animales.
 
Su meta es tener un trabajo en una entidad financiera, para así tener dos ingresos para ayudar un poco más en la economía de su hogar.,
texts.en:
The Bellavista community bank is made up of seven women and one man who are friends and neighbors.  They live in a community in Victoria del Portete parish, in Cuenca.  This area has vast plains and beautiful landscapes.  It has a cold climate.  The local people work in cattle farming, livestock raising and agriculture.  Many work in the city in different jobs.  They are noted for keeping alive the culture and traditions of their ancestors.

One of the members of this group is Ligia.  Ligia is 24 years old, married, and has two children who are 4 and 2 years old.  Her husband works for a private company.  They do not own the house in which they live.

Ligia spends most of her time caring for her children who are still young.  As she has land available, she has been raising cattle for four years.  She take cares of her cows from Sunday to Sunday.  She does not work fixed hours and sells the milk in her community.

Ligia will invest her loan in buying more cattle so that she can continue expanding her business.

Ligia's goal is to get a job working for a financial company so that she will have two incomes and be able to help a little more in improving her family's financial situation.

loans.use: to buy cattle

loans.name: Lolita

texts.en:
Lolita is 64 years old and married with five children.

Lolita works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional products to sell in her general store.

Lolita has borrowed and paid 16 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 40 years and also earns an income from raising livestock and gasoline.

Lolita aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional products to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for the maintenance of his motorcycle.

loans.name: Villa De Oro  (Montecristi) Group

texts.es:
EL Banco Comunal Villa De Oro se reúne cada quince días en el Cantón Montecristi, conocido por su rica cultura pre colonial y por su artesanía que es reconocida a nivel nacional e internacional. Lugar de los famosos sombreros de paja toquilla.

Este es un grupo de 12 mujeres y 2 hombres que decidieron unirse y formar este Grupo De Crédito que les ha servido  de mucho ya que con los créditos ellos han podido mejorar sus pequeños negocios. Ellos se dedican a diversas actividades tales como agricultura, comercio en general, servicios, entre otras actividades.

Uno de los socios de este grupo es el señor Hermes, tiene 47 años de edad, está separado pero de esta relación tienen tres hijos, dos mayores de edad y uno de 9 años que estudia en escuela y vive con la mamá a pesar de que es él que se hace cargo de los gastos de su hijo.

Don Hermes se dedica al comercio, es proveedor al por mayor de pescado, él viaja hasta otras ciudades costeras a comprar el mejor pescado para luego trasladarlo a la ciudad de Manta lugar en el cual entrega a varias empresas que procesan el pescado, lleva 29 años dedicada a esta actividad la cual le ha dado muy buenos beneficios. 

Este crédito es para comprar pescado, este es su primer ciclo en el Banco Comunal y le gusta por la rapidez con que salen los créditos. 

Sus metas son seguir adelante en su negocio y su vida personal.

Las dos fotos pequeñas son de un socio y una socia que no pudieron estar presentes cuando se tomo la foto del grupo.
texts.en:
The Villa De Oro community bank meets every two weeks in Montecristi canton.  This area is noted for its rich pre-colonial culture and for its handicrafts which are well known both at home and abroad.  It is home to the famous Panama hat.

This is a group of 12 women and 2 men who decided to come together and form a loan group.  The group has been very useful to them as they have been able to improve their small businesses through their loans.  The members work in different areas such as farming, general commerce, services, etc.

One of the members of this group is 47-year-old Hermes.  Hermes is separated but has three children from his relationship.  Two of his children are adults whilst the youngest is 9 years old and attending school.  He lives with his mom in spite of the fact that Hermes is the one who provides for him financially.

Hermes works in commerce.  He is a wholesale supplier of fish.  He travels to other coastal towns to buy the best fish available.  He then transports it to the city of Manta where he delivers it to a number of companies who process fish.  He has been in this business for 29 years and it has made him very good profits.

Hermes will use this loan to buy fish.  This is his first loan cycle as a member of his community bank and he likes it for the speed with which loans are disbursed.

Hermes' goals are to continue making progress in his business and also in his personal life.

The two small photos are of group members who could not be present when the group photo was taken.

loans.use: to buy fish

loans.name: Luzviminda

texts.en:
Luzminda is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a pig raising business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 30,000 through NWTF to buy additional feed and vitamins for her pig raising business.

Luzminda has been in this business for 11 years. Luzminda earns more income from her general store.

Luzminda has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough money so she could afford to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy additional feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Las Profesoras Group

texts.es:
Grupo formada por tres socias emprendedoras que se dedican a brindar servicios de sala de belleza, corte de pelo, permanentes, tinte.
Esta actividad la viene realizando desde hace 18 años, además de su actividad como microempresaria es trabajadora como directora de un centro educativo.

El crédito lo utilizara para compra de tintes, permanentes, queratina, pinturas de uñas, cosméticos etc.
Doña Janeth su negocio es de bisutería y una pequeña pulpería, además es profesora de un centro educativo. Doña Thelma  su negocio es de bisutería y una pequeña pulpería además trabaja como docente en un centro educativo.
texts.en:
This group is made up of three entrepreneurial women.  Julieta provides beauty salon services:hair cutting, perms and dyes. She has been in this business for 18 years.  In addition to her work as a micro businesswoman, she also works as a school principal.  She will use her loan to buy dyes, perm materials, keratin treatments, nail polish, cosmetics, etc.

Janeth's business is selling costume jewelry.  In addition, she has a grocery store and works as a teacher.  Thelma's business is selling costume jewelry.  She also has a small grocery store and works as a school teacher.

loans.use: to buy keratin treatments, nail polish, cosmetics, etc.

loans.name: Malo

texts.en:
Malo is 29 years old and married with one child.

Malo works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 29,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stock of soft drinks to sell.

Malo has been in this business for nine years and has previously received funds through Kiva.

Malo aspires to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more stock of soft drinks to sell.

loans.name: Tawakalatou

texts.fr: Agée de 38ans, Tawakalatou est mère de 04 enfants tous sur les bancs de l’école. Ils sont âgés de 13, 11,08 et 06ans. Son conjoint est revendeur et madame tawakalatou exerce aussi le commerce. Elle vend des produits d’alimentation générale dans une boutique et s’approvisionne à Lomé. Ce prêt qu’elle sollicite à WAGES lui servira à s’approvisionner en produits d’alimentation générale. Elle voudrait assurer le bien être de la famille et rendre pérenne son activité.
texts.en:
Tawakalatou is 38 years old and mother of four children, all of whom go to school. Her children are 6, 8, 11, and 13 years old. Her husband is a retailer, and she too works in commerce.

She sells general foodstuffs in a shop and stocks up in Lomé.

The loan that she is seeking from WAGES will allow her to stock up in general foodstuffs. She would like to ensure her family's well-being and the long-term viability of her business.

loans.use: to buy general foodstuffs

loans.name: Virgen

texts.es:
EL  Banco Comunal Los Tamarindos se reúne cada quince días en la hermosa ciudad de Portoviejo capital manabita conocida como la Ciudad del Valle, ciudad de clima cálido de hermosas mujeres y con una gran variedad en su gastronomía.

La señora Virgen tiene 52 años de edad, está separada y de esta relación tienen seis hijos, cuatro mayores de edad y dos de 17 y 15 años los mismos que estudian en colegio,  tres de sus hijos aun viven con ella.

Ella es una mujer muy luchadora que siempre le ha gustado trabajar y con su esfuerzo sacar adelante a sus hijos, ella tiene un restaurante en su casa, allí  prepara deliciosos desayunos y almuerzos, todos los días ella varia el menú con la finalidad de darles a sus clientes lo que ellos prefieren y es por esta razón por la cual cada dia llegan más personas a comer en su local, trabaja todos los días y sus hijos le ayudan en su negocio, lleva más de 15 años con su local el cual le da lo necesario para salir adelante.

Este crédito es para comprar  víveres para preparar los alimentos, esta desde el inicio en el Banco Comunal y le gusta por la ayuda que siempre le han brindado a través de los créditos.

Su sueño es seguir adelante en su negocio.
texts.en:
The Tamarindos community bank meets once every two weeks in the beautiful city of Portoviejo, the capital of Manabí.  It is known as the Valley City.  It has a hot climate and is home to beautiful women.  The local cuisine is wide ranging.  

Virgen is 52 years old, separated, and has six children from her relationship.  Four of her children are adults.  The other two are 17 and 15 years old and attending school.  Three of her children still live with her.

Virgen is a very hard-working woman who has always enjoyed working.  Through her efforts she has managed to provide for her children.  She has a restaurant in her home where she prepares delicious breakfasts and lunches.  Every day she varies the menu so that she can provide her customers with what they most want.  For this reason, her number of customers increases every day.  Virgen works every day and her children help her in the business.  She has owned her restaurant for more than 15 years and her business provides her with what she needs to keep making progress.

Virgen will use this loan to buy supplies for preparing her food.  She has been a member of her community bank since the beginning and she likes it because of the help that she has always received through loans.

Virgen's dream is to make further progress in her business.

loans.use: to buy supplies

loans.name: Besart

texts.en:
Besart is 21 years old and is recently married. He lives in a village in Kosovo. As part of family tradition, Besart sells milk and cheese produced from goats. He sells approximately 20 liters per day at 1 euro per liter. He also sells the goat cheese at 5 euros per kg. He sells 25 kg a week in his area.  

This agricultural business has had much success and profit as he has been doing it for a long time, and it has been going very well due to the great effort that he puts into his business every day. 

In addition to the goat products, in order to generate more income, he also works in a car wash. He is asking for a loan to buy food for the upcoming winter season for his goat. This loan will ensure that he is able to sustain his goat during the rough season. His goal is to raise the number of goats that he has. 

Besart is very thankful to Kiva lenders for the support!

loans.use: To buy food for the upcoming winter season for his goat.

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en:
Marilyn works hard to support her family. Marilyn is married and has a manicure/pedicure business in the Philippines.

Marilyn requested a 10,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) loan through NWTF to buy a manicure set and other new tools for her business.

Marilyn has been in this business for 27 years now, and also earns additional income from food vending.

In the future, Marilyn would like to save enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy a manicure set and other new tools for her business.

loans.name: Ndejje Tusubira Group

texts.en:
John  has been in the group since 2003.

He joined the group when he was jobless and depended on riding other people's motorcycles to earn a living. With the help of loans John was able to buy his own motorcycle and is now building a house where he can reside with his family so that he saves on the high cost of renting in the city. 

John will use the money to finish his incomplete house and a portion of it to pay school fees for his children. His hard work and dedication have earned him the post of secretary in the group.

loans.use: To complete his house

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
As a married parent of 7 children, Erlinda works hard to support her family.

She has a motorcycle transport business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from her general store. Erlinda is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF to buy spare parts for her motorcycle transport business.

Erlinda has been sustaining her business activities through her past 17 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business further.

loans.use: to buy spare parts for her business

loans.name: Anathalie

texts.en: Anathalie is 54 years old. She is married and has seven children. She sells different items in her shop. With the loan, she wishes to add more items for sale such as cooking oil, soap, and sugar. The profits from the business will be used to reinvest in the business. She is very proud of her business and the sky is the limit for her.

loans.use: To buy more items such as cooking oil, soap and sugar for sale.

loans.name: Donathile

texts.en: Donathile is 66 years old. She is a widow who has three children. She is requesting a loan to buy more sorghum to make local juice. She has been making this local juice for 32 years. The profits from the business will be used to renovate her house.

loans.use: To buy sorghum for making more local juice for sale.

loans.name: Angelique

texts.en: Angelique is aged 24. She is married with one child. She sells fruit and she is requesting the loan to buy more fruits such as tree tomatoes (tamarillos) and oranges for sale. The profits from the business will be used to reinvest in a similar business.

loans.use: To buy more fruit such as tree tomatoes (tamarillos) and oranges for sale.

loans.name: Norma

texts.en:
As a married mother of five children, Norma works hard to support her family.

Norma has a tailoring business in the Philippines. She also earns additional income from an internet cafe. Norma  is borrowing PHP 29,000 through NWTF to buy fabrics for her tailoring business.

Norma has been sustaining her business activities through her past eight loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream, which is to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fabrics for her tailoring business.

loans.name: Pophie

texts.en:
Pophie is 29 years old. She is married and has two children. She sells goat hides and cow hides. She has spent four years in the business. 

With the loan, she wants to add more hides for sale because the shoe and bag making industries need them so much. She plans to use the profits from the business to buy a small truck, which will help her with transportation for those hides.

loans.use: To buy more hides for making clothes for sale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy textiles used in making school and office uniforms

loans.name: Dzame

texts.en:
Dzame is a married woman with seven children. For the last 15 years, she has been selling goats at the market assisted by her children who are grown-ups. Besides this, she is a farmer selling her farm products at the market and at home. 

Dzame is asking a loan in the amount of Ksh 50,000 to invest it in her business. With this loan she will be able to buy more goats to sell. She wants to take advantage of this festive season where most people consume meat. Dzame says that it has been a profitable business and thus she has not regretted since she started it.

loans.use: to buy more goats to sell.

loans.name: Generose

texts.en: Generose is 55 years old. She sells sorghum and has been selling that for the period of five years. With the loan, she wants to add more beans and sorghum for sale. The profits from the business will be used to put aside savings.

loans.use: To buy more sorghum and beans for sale.

loans.name: Gina

texts.en:
Gina is 40 years old and married. She has three children.

Gina works hard to provide for her family. She runs a junk shop in the Philippines and requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional scrap to sell.

Gina has borrowed and paid 20 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the junk shop for 16 years and also earns an income from manufacturing candles.

Gina aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional scrap to sell.

loans.name: Angelique

texts.en: Angelique is 29 years old. She is married to a businessman. They have two children. She sells seeds and fertilizers of different kinds. With the profits, she wants to reinvest in the business.

loans.use: To buy more seeds and fertilizers for sale.

loans.name: José Lougures

texts.es:
Don José tiene 40 años de edad, es casado y tiene 7 hijos. Él se dedica a la elaboración de pan desde que tenía 9 años de edad, fueron sus padres los que le enseñaron. Para comprar los materiales que necesita, se traslada a la ciudad en su vehiculo.

El préstamo que esta solicitando a Fundación Campo, es para reconstruir la galera que protege su horno artesanal de su vivienda, cancelara un crédito con otra institución y para instalar la energía eléctrica en su casa. Con la inversión él ya no tendrá que buscar prestadas las instalaciones para hornear el pan y para tener su maquinaria. Así, producirá su propio pan para la venta y recibir buenas ganancias que le permitan brindar a su familia todo lo necesario. Su objetivo es adquirir un terreno para construir su casa.
texts.en:
José, age 40, is married and has seven children.  He has been making bread since he was nine years old.  It was his parents who taught him how to do this.  In order to buy the materials that he needs, he travels in his vehicle to the city.

The loan that he is requesting from the Fundación Campo is to rebuild the galley that protects the handcrafted oven at his house, to pay off a loan with another institution, and to install electricity in his house.  With the investment he will not have to look to borrow equipment to bake the bread and to have machinery.  

This way he will produce his own bread to sell.  He will get good income, which will allow him to provide his family with everything they need.  His objective is to get a piece of land in order to build a house.

loans.use: to rebuild the galley that protects the handcrafted oven at his house, to pay off a loan with another institution, and to install electricity in his house.

loans.name: Susan

texts.en: Susan is an active micro-finance member of PMPC.  She is 49 years old, married with two adult-aged children and one school-aged child.  She lives in Olo, Siquijor, Siquijor.  She has been selling fish for 12 years with average monthly earnings of Php 2,000.  She took out a loan in PMPC to purchase more fish to sell.  She plans to use the profit from business to support the daily needs of her family.  She hopes that someday the living conditions of the family will improve.

loans.use: to purchase more fish to sell

loans.name: Antoine

texts.en:
Antoine is a 62-year-old married man, father of three children. He has worked as a blacksmith since 2000, and this long experience provided him with a very good reputation in the region. He also works as a math teacher to cover his family's expenses. Antoine is applying for a loan from Kiva's partner Al Majmoua for the first time, in order to buy a power generator that is very important for his business development, since electricity is a major problem in Lebanon with no clue that it will be solved soon.

Antoine is working hard on expanding his business as much as he can to keep on providing his family the necessary living needs.

loans.use: To buy a power generator

loans.name: Lirisia Monserrate

texts.es:
EL  Banco Comunal Los Tamarindos se reúne cada quince días en la hermosa ciudad de Portoviejo capital manabita conocida como la Ciudad del Valle, ciudad de clima cálido de hermosas mujeres y con una gran variedad en su gastronomía.

La señora Lirisia tiene 45 años de edad, está casada pero aun no ha podido tener  hijos. Su esposo es maestro.
 
Ella una mujer muy luchadora que le gusta trabajar con la finalidad de ayudar a su esposo con los gastos del hogar, ella es maestra y trabaja en las mañanas en un jardín de infantes y en la tarde en un colegio de la localidad pero también se dedica al comercio, vende productos Yanbal (productos de belleza, cosméticos, perfumería y accesorios para damas). Su forma de venta es puerta a puerta, sale en las noches cuando puede y también vende en los lugares donde ella labora, deja sus productos a crédito y cobra cada ocho días. Tiene más de 14 años que se dedica a esta actividad y le va muy bien, lo que más vende son los perfumes y cosméticos ya que según dice son muy buenos.

Este crédito es para comprar perfumes, cremas, cosméticos, entre otros productos. Lleva más de 15 años  en el Banco Comunal y le gusta porque los pagos son fáciles de hacer.
 
Su sueño es tener un bebe algún dia.
texts.en:
Los Tamarindos Communal Bank meets every two weeks in the beautiful city of Portoviejo, the capital of Manabí, known as the City of the Valley, a city of warm climate, pretty women, and great variety in its cuisine.

Lirisia, 45, is married but hasn't been able to have a baby yet.  Her husband is a teacher.  She's determined and likes to work, with the goal of helping her husband with the household expenses.  She's a teacher and works in a kindergarten in the morning and a school in the town in the afternoon.

She also works in business selling Yanbal products (beauty products, cosmetics, perfume, and women's accessories).  She sells door-to-door at night when she can, and also in her workplace.  She leaves the products on credit and collects weekly.  She has been doing this work for more than 14 years and it's going very well for her.  What she sells most are perfumes and cosmetics because they say they're very good.

This loan is to buy perfume, cream, cosmetics, and other products.  She has been with the community bank for more than 15 years and she likes it because the payments are easy to make.

Her dream is to have a baby one day.

loans.use: to buy perfume, cream, cosmetics, etc.

loans.name: Josefa

texts.es:
La socia es la señora Josefa, ella tiene  68 años de edad, es viuda y tuvo 5 hijos los cuales son personas adultas y de provecho, ella se dedica  al  comercio de verduras y hortalizas en general, granos como maíz, y los comercializa de forma directa a sus clientes en los diferentes mercados de su comunidad. 
Josefa está solicitando el préstamo para comprar mercadería como maíz y verduras para capitalizar su comercio. La Socia está muy agradecida con la ayuda de KIVA, por ayudarla a fortalecer  y hacer crecer su actividad económica. La socia pertenece al banco comunal “Patrón Salvador del Mundo”; del distrito de San Salvador de la provincia de Calca del Cusco – Perú.
texts.en:
Josefa is 68 years old.  She is widowed and had five children who are now hard-working adults.  Josefa sells greens, vegetables in general, and grains such as corn.  She sells these products directly to her customers in different markets in her community. 

Josefa is requesting a loan to buy merchandise such as corn and vegetables to capitalize her business.  She is very grateful for Kiva's help which will enable her to strengthen and grow her business.  Josefa belongs to the 'Patrón Salvador del Mundo' community bank which is located in San Salvador district, in Calca province, Cusco, Peru.

loans.use: to buy corn and vegetables

loans.name: Charles

texts.en:
Charles  is a married man. He has three children with ages ranging from 9 months to 8 years. He describes himself to be honest. He operates a motorcycle and he provides transportation services to customers. He has been involved in this business for one year. His business is located within a potential business area and his primary customers are daily customers from environs.  In addition, Charles runs a charcoal sales business which adds  to his business income.

Charles describes his biggest business challenge to be lack of funds for improving his motorcycle business. He will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy charcoal for resale. His business goal is to improve his motorcycle  transportation business within 5 years. He hopes that in the future, he will be a distributor of charcoal.

loans.use: to buy charcoal to sell

loans.name: Lelia

texts.en:
Lelia has been an active micro-finance member of PMPC since 2010. She is 54 years old, widowed and has four children.  

She has been engaged in making and selling homemade bread for three years, earning a monthly average of PHP 2,000.  

She took another loan from PMPC to purchase additional ingredients to make homemade bread for sale. She will use the profit to support the daily needs of her children.

loans.use: to purchase additional ingredients to make bread.

loans.name: Elsa

texts.en:
Elsa lives at Lalog 1 with her spouse and children. 

To make a living, her spouse provides daily motorcycle transport services to the people in their village. This way, the family earns about PHP 300 each day and has just enough for meals and daily expenses. 

Elsa would like to make improvements on their business so that their income will increase. She would like to ask for a loan of PHP 15,000 to pay for franchise renewal and buy tires and crude oil for the motorcycle. She would like to ensure safe travel for the passengers and for her husband as well. Elsa is also praying for good health and a happy family.

loans.use: to pay for franchise renewal and buy tires and crude oil for the motorcycle.

loans.name: Daisy Mae

texts.en: Daisy Mae is an active micro-finance member of PMPC since 2011. She is 39 years of age and is married with 2 adult-age and 2 school-age children. She lives in Olang, Maria, Siquijor. She has been selling ready-to-wear clothes for the past 2 years and earns an income every month of PHP 3,000.  She requested another loan from PMPC in the amount of PHP 14,000 to purchase additional ready-to-wear stock for sale. She plans to use the profit to save and provide for the daily needs of her family.

loans.use: to purchase addtional ready-to-wear stock for sale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy raw ingredients in baking breads

loans.name: Yakob

texts.en:
Yakob is 18 years old; he is still very young and eager to advance in life. He lives in a small village called Batu Aji, Batam bordering Malaysia and Singapore. He is the first child of four brothers, and all three siblings are still in school. His parents have a desire for all children to get an education and for their future to be better. His parents can give him only the provision of education to senior high school level, because only his father works as a painter. Income is uncertain, depending on the presence or absence of  projects that he can work on. 

To gain employment because of the conditions of his parents, Yakob is motivated to quickly complete college. Yakob hopes for a loan from Kiva, to help ease the burden on his parents. Yakob also hopes that with this loan, he can quickly get a job as a clerk at a port or shipping company, after graduation.

loans.use: To pay education fees for three years

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks and beverages

loans.name: Liberathe

texts.en: Liberathe is 32 years old. She sells local beer made out of bananas. She wants the loan to buy more bananas to make more local beer. The profits from the business will be used to reinvest in the business.

loans.use: To buy more bananas for sale.

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en:
Joyce is 26 years old, married to Evans, and blessed with two children. She sells Meko gas cylinders--a business she started two years ago and through which she earns a monthly income of KES 40,000. 

She has requested a second loan of KES 40,000 to purchase more Meko gas cylinders for sale. The profit earned will be put back into her business. 

She hopes to buy a piece of land and build a house.

loans.use: To purchase meko gas cylinders for sale.

loans.name: Populares Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “POPULARES”  iniciará el ciclo segundo ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Panamericana, está compuesta por once integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Jenny es la Secretaria. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos tenemos: venta de polleras, costura de edredones, macramé de mantas, tejido de prendas, venta de ropa, venta de comida, venta de hamburguezas.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Jenny es integrante, ella indica que hace tres ciclos que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por invitación de una promotora de la institución que fue a su casa a visitarla. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio venta de edredones; cuenta que este negocio lo emprendió hace años aprendiendo de su hermana quien le enseño la costura de estos accesorios para el hogar.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de tela) que adquirirá de las ferias de la ciudad de El Alto y posteriormente lo instalará en su espacio de comercialización. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar en lo posible a su hogar.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta las capacitaciones en salud y crédito.

En la fotografía no se encuentra la señora Justina, ya que la misma tuvo que ir a consulta médica.
texts.en:
The “POPULARES” community bank are beginning their second loan cycle with Pro Mujer, as part of the Panamericana regional office.  The group has eleven members and is run by a board of directors which has Jenny as its secretary.  The businesses that the members of the group are engaged in are varied and include: selling traditional skirts, sewing comforters, knotting blankets, weaving garments, selling clothes, selling food and selling burgers.

This loan will benefit small micro-businesswomen including Jenny.  Jenny says that she has been a member of Pro Mujer for three loan cycles.  She joined through an invitation from a loan officer who went to her house to visit her.  She currently has a business selling comforters.  She says that she started her business after her sister taught her how to sew these household accessories.

The loan that Jenny is taking out will be used to increase her capital (buying fabric).  She will acquire her fabric in the street markets in the city of El Alto and then sell the finished goods from her sales location.  This work allows her to make income with which to support her household as well as she can.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, Jenny replied that she likes the health training and the loans.

n.b. Justina is missing from the photograph because she had to attend a doctor's appointment.

loans.use: to buy fabric

loans.name: Charity

texts.en:
Running a small store is what occupies Charity's daily schedule from 6 a.m. to 6 p.m. She is 33 years old, married and has three children. 

She has been operating her store for eight years and gains about PHP 500 each day. She wants to increase her sales but has insufficient funds now, so she is borrowing a loan of PHP 15,000 to buy soft drinks, canned goods, eggs, soap and shampoo to sell. Additional merchandise will help improve sales capacity and income as well. 

With enough funds, Charity would like to also offer school supplies and keep diversifying her business for additional income. This will improve the overall welfare of the family.

loans.use: to buy soft drinks, canned goods, eggs, soap and shampoo to sell.

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en: Sarah is 34. She sells foodstuffs and has spent 2 years in the business. This loan for her business will be used to buy more foodstuffs such as beans and sorghum for sale. The profits from the business will be used to build a home for her business in the future.

loans.use: To buy more beans and sorghum for sale.

loans.name: Mupa

texts.en:
For the last 10 years, Mupa has been operating a meat goat business, which she testifies has been earning her good income. She is married and lives with her spouse in the town of Tiribe, in the Coast Province, Kenya. Her husband is a farmer and together they share ideas on how they can move forward. 

Demand for more goats from her regular customers has increased but she does not have enough capital to satisfy the needs. For this reason, she went to Yehu offices to ask for a loan so as to buy more goats for sale. This way she is sure to increase her income.

loans.use: to buy more goats for sale.

loans.name: Josefina

texts.en:
Josefina is a 48-year-old, hardworking mother of four. She is married to Jacinto, a tricycle (motorcycle) driver. Together they earn income for the sustenance of the family. 

Josefina has run her talipapa (vegetable stall) for over five years now. She sells vegetables, fruits, and grocery items too. She would like to keep gaining more income, so she is now asking additional capital of PHP 35,000 to buy more merchandise. She will buy more vegetables (cabbages, tomatoes, beans) cooking oil, vinegar, and canned goods to sell. 

Josefina will be very happy and proud to see all her children become professionals in their chosen careers and obtain good employment some day. This will help lift their family out of poverty.

loans.use: to buy more vegetables (cabbages, tomatoes,beans) cooking oil, vinegar, and canned goods to sell.

loans.name: Swzan

texts.en:
Due to cultural reasons, Swzan prefers that her photo is not on the Internet; thus the above photo is of her husband. Swzan is a 26-year-old married woman from Al Koorah Jordan who has one family member. She is requesting a loan of 300 JD to pay for her home improvements; she would like to buy new electronics. In the future she is planning on adding another guest room.

Since Swzan is under 30 year old, her loan is considered a youth loan.

loans.use: to pay for new electronics

loans.name: Jeanne D'arc

texts.en:
Jeannne D’Arc is 37 years old. She sells peas and beans. 

She has requested the loan for buying more beans for sale. 

The profits from the business will be used for savings for her children.

loans.use: To buy more beans for sale.

loans.name: Henry

texts.en:
Henry is a responsible father who aims to become successful and financially stable in the future. He is 28 years old and has two infant-aged children. They live happily in a rural community where they can plant rice, vegetables, and fruit and raise livestock for sale. These are the main source of their living and Henry wants to improve them in order to generate sufficient income for his family. 

Henry plans to improve his citrus plantation to increase his production. Due to financial constraints, he is requesting an additional capital of P 35,000 to buy fertilizers and insecticides needed for the maintenance of his citrus plantation. Through this loan, he believes that he will improve his plantation and hopes that he will have a high production.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and insecticides needed for the maintenance of his citrus plantation

loans.name: Gregoria

texts.en:
Gregoria works hard to support her family. She is married and has a sari-sari (variety) store business in the Philippines.

Gregoria requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy items like shampoo and groceries to sell in her sari-sari store.

Gregoria has been in this business for five years.

In the future, Gregoria would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items like shampoo and groceries to sell in her sari-sari store.

loans.name: Juan Carlos

texts.es:
Don Juan tiene 34 años de edad, es soltero. Es una persona trabajadora que se dedica a la agricultura desde hace 20 años, fue su padre quien le enseño todo sobre el trabajo agrícola y lo que necesita para hacer producir. Juan cultiva, maíz y hortalizas. Actualmente solo vive con su mamá quien se encarga de realizar los oficios en casa.  Los insumos agrícolas los adquiere en una ciudad, que esta a cuarenta y cinco minutos de su casa en autobús, ahí los consigue a buen precio.

El préstamo que esta solicitando a Fundación Campo, es para comprar 4 animales para repasto y posteriormente venderlos para obtener buenas ganancias y pagar el préstamo. Su objetivo, es continuar trabajando en la agricultura y con ganado, a fin de ir incrementando su negocio para que sus ingresos mejoren y pueda realizarle mejoras a  su vivienda.
texts.en:
Juan is 34 years old and single.  He is a hard-working person who has been farming for 20 years.  It was his father who taught him how to farm and taught him everything he needed to do in order to grow crops successfully.  Juan grows corn and vegetables.  He currently lives with just his mom who takes care of the housework.  Juan buys his farming supplies in a city which is located 45 minutes from his house by bus.  He is able to buy at a good price there.

The loan that Juan is requesting from Fundación Campo will be used to buy four animals to fatten and then sell in order to make good profits and repay his loan.  His goal is to continue farming and raising animals.  He will continue growing his business so that he can improve his income and make some improvements to his house.

loans.use: to buy four animals to fatten

loans.name: Emmy

texts.en:
Emmy is a faithful mother. She is 48 years old, married and has two children who attend school. Her husband is a fireman.

To supplement his income, she manages a small store, selling grocery items to the people in her village. She is now borrowing a loan of PHP 50,000 to buy more biscuits, eggs, breads, canned goods, cases of soft drinks and sugars to sell. This will increase sales capacity and improve her income as well. 

She promises to pay back her loan and keep extending good products and friendly services to all her customers. 

In the future, Emmy would like to continuously grow as a successful vendor and provide good education to her children as the best legacy she can pass on to them.

loans.use: to buy more biscuits, eggs, breads, canned goods, cases of soft drinks and sugars to sell in her store.

loans.name: Estella

texts.en:
Estella is 44 years old and single. She is in the agricultural business, farming vegetables in the Philippines. 

Estella has been farming vegetables for eight years now, and she has borrowed 12 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

Estella requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

In the future, Estella would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Kamielah

texts.en:
Kamielah is a 55-year-old married woman from Jarash, Jordan. 

She is requesting a loan of 500 JOD to pay for her home improvements. She would like to buy new furniture and she wants to repaint her home. 

In the future, she hopes to improve her living standard.

loans.use: to pay for her home improvements.

loans.name: Saxavat

texts.ru: Saxavat is 45 years old . She is married and has 2 children. She is an IDP( Internally Displaced Person) from the city of Fuzuli, but currently he and his family live in the greater Baku region. Saxavat has been in this cooking business for nine years. Saxavat is cooking Azerbaijan national cuisines very tasty. She loves her work and enjoys spending his time thinking of ways to improve her business. Saxavat now needs a loan of 2,000 AZN(Azerbaijani New Manat) in order to buy new devices for cooking.
texts.en:
Saxavat is 45 years old. She is married and has two children. She is an IDP (Internally Displaced Person) from the city of Fuzuli, but currently she and her family live in the greater Baku region. 

Saxavat has been in this cooking business for nine years. Saxavat cooks very tasty Azerbaijan national dishes. She loves her work and enjoys spending her time thinking of ways to improve her business. Saxavat now needs a loan of 2,000 AZN (Azerbaijani New Manat) in order to buy new cooking implements.

loans.use: to buy new cooking implements

loans.name: Evangeline

texts.en:
Evangeline is from the town of Luna and has been engaged in a hog-raising business for 5 years. Evangeline is married to Madel, a father who is busy managing their farmland. The couple both work hard to provide for the needs of their children. 

According to them, raising large numbers of piglets requires more capital because of the livestock feed that they will consume each day. With this in mind, Evangeline is asking for a loan amount of 10,000 PHP which will be used to buy livestock feed and vaccines. She expects that the requested loan amount will be granted so that she can save some for her children's education and improve their living condition. She usually acquires a loan of 2,500 PHP per piglet she sold.

loans.use: to buy livestock feed and vaccines

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is a hog raiser from Nangalisan. She raises hogs to re-sell and gain profits from it. She was able to acquire 3,000 PHP for each hog disposed. Josephine is now 61 years old, a widower and has six children. She is still strong enough to manage a small business. She would like to ensure good nutrition to her hogs but has insufficient funds, so she is borrowing a loan of 10,000 PHP to buy feed, vaccines and medicines for hog sustainability.

In the future, Josephine hopes to achieve a more profitable business and keep growing as a successful entrepreneur.

loans.use: to buy feed, vaccines and medicines for hogs

loans.name: Melva Ines

texts.es:
Melba inició la actividad de la confección hace bastantes años cuando trabajaba por temporadas. Con sus ahorros se compró una máquina plana e inició el servicio de sastrería; luego compró una fileteadora e inició el servicio de confección a terceros, y así poco a poco ha venido creciendo en su propio taller de confección donde genera los ingresos para su hogar. La dificultad que presenta ahora es que hace un tiempo su esposo murió y por tanto ha quedado como madre soltera cabeza de hogar de sus 4 hijos, donde actualmente todos estudian y les debe garantizar todas sus necesidades. Es por esto que Melba requiere aumentar su capacidad de producción y para esto busca un préstamo para comprar una máquina plana y una fileteadora y así aumentar su capacidad de producción para aumentar sus ventas.

Su sueño es tener su propia línea de ropa con la cual pueda mejorar sus ingresos y así sus 4 hijos puedan tener una mejor calidad de vida y mejores oportunidades económicas para progresar.
texts.en:
When Melba was doing seasonal work some years ago, she began to sew. She bought a tabletop sewing machine with her savings and started working as a seamstress; then she bought a serger and offered third party service. She was able to slowly grow her business until she had her own workshop from which she generates her household income. 

The problem Melba faces now is that her husband died recently. So she is a single mother, head-of-household with four children whom she must educate and support. Therefore, Melba has to increase her production and is seeking a loan to buy a tabletop sewing machine and serger to increase production and sales. Her dream is to create her own clothing line to increase her income and give her children a higher standard of living and better economic opportunities.

loans.use: to buy a tabletop sewing machine and serger to increase production and sales.

loans.name: Margarita

texts.es:
La socia es la señora Margarita, ella tiene  52 años y está casada, ella se dedica  a la venta de chicha de jora y cerveza, actividad que realiza desde toda su vida y con la cual ha sacado adelante a su familia  y educado a sus  4 hijos que ahora son profesionales y viven en la capital del Cusco. 
Margarita está solicitando el préstamo para comprar como maíz y cerveza para capitalizar su comercio. La Socia está muy agradecida con la ayuda de KIVA, por ayudarla a fortalecer  su actividad económica. La socia pertenece al banco comunal “Patrón Salvador del Mundo”; del distrito de San Salvador de la provincia de Calca del Cusco – Perú.
texts.en:
The member, Margarita, is 52 years old and married.  She makes a living selling "chicha de jora" [corn liquor] and beer, a job she has been doing her whole life and with which she has gotten her family ahead and educated her four children, who are now professionals living in the city of Cusco.

Margarita is requesting the loan to buy corn and beer to invest in her business.

She's very grateful for the help from Kiva in strengthening her business.  She belongs to Patrón Salvador del Mundo Communal Bank in the San Salvador district of the province of Calca, Cusco, Peru.

loans.use: to buy corn to make corn liquor and beer

loans.name: C1266 Nzamura Group

texts.en:
Jacqueline is 37 years old and is married with six children, ages between 10 and 17 years old and she has eight dependents. Jacqueline owns a business selling various goods such as sorghum, maize, etc.. She is the leader of the group, which is called "C1266 NZAMURA" in the local language. She is the one who is raising her hand. 

Jacqueline has requested a loan from Kiva lenders, via Vision Finance Company, in order to buy various goods such as sorghum, maize, etc. for resale. With the profit, she expects to save money for her future and to pay her children's school fees.

loans.use: To buy various goods such as sorghum, maize, etc. for resale.

loans.name: Muhayo

texts.ru: Мухайё очень трудолюбивая и целеустремлённая женщина, она замужем. Она родилась в сельской местности, поэтому она имеет достаточный опыт по животноводству и выращивания сельхоз культуры. Условия жизни у них были очень тяжелые. Самых ранних лет она  пасла скот. После занятий в школе работала на поле, чтобы заработать деньги.   После замужества она опять работала на поле. Её муж уехал в  Россию на заработки, и там проработал 2 года. В основном Мухайё выращивает пшеницу, кукурузу, горох и другие сельхозпродукты. Уже более 5 месяцев она самостоятельно занимается этим бизнесом. Муж помогает ей в ведении бизнеса. Она планирует организовать новый бизнес скотоводством и поэтому прошла тренинг «Добейся успеха» организованный Ассоциации Деловых Женщин и получила сертификат. Она запрашивает займ на сумму 5000 сомони для покупки скота. Мухайё хочет получить больше дохода и улучшить свое домохозяйства. Она ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en:
Muhayo is a very hardworking and ambitious woman. She is married. 

She was born in rural areas, so she has experience in raising animals and crop cultivation. Living conditions for them were very heavy. She herded cattle at a very early age. After school, she worked in the fields to earn money. After her marriage, she again worked in the fields. Her husband left for Russia and worked there for two years. 

In general, Muhayo grows wheat, corn, peas, and other agricultural products. For more than five months, she has been in this business on her own. Her husband helps her in doing the business. She plans to start a new livestock herding business and therefore went to training "Bring It On" organized by the Association of Business Women and received a certificate. 

She is asking for a loan of 5,000 Somoni to buy livestock. Muhayo wants to earn more income and to improve her household. She awaits your kindness.

loans.use: To buy cattle for organizing new business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks and beverages

loans.name: Lorna

texts.en:
Lorna is 57 years old, widowed and has seven children, two in school. Lorna is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. Lorna requested a PHP 10000 loan through NWTF to buy medicine and vaccines for her pigs.

Lorna has been raising pigs for nine years now, and has borrowed nine times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

In the future, Lorna would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy medicinesand vaccines for her pigs.

loans.name: Benjamin

texts.es:
Benjamín,  es soltero y no tiene hijos, vive en la casa de sus padres ocupando una habitación con paredes de ladrillo y el piso de cemento, la casa se encuentra ubicada en la zona Miraflores de la ciudad de La Paz.
Actualmente percibe ingresos ya que trabaja por las noches todos los fines de semana atendiendo varios acontecimientos ya que cuenta con servicio de amplificación para fiestas.
El crédito lo requiere para la compra de un amplificador ya que desea mejorar sus ingresos y brindar mejor servicio en sus acontecimientos para el cual lo contratan.
El sueño de Benjamín, es poder independizarse y mejorar su calidad de vida.
Es la primera vez que solicita crédito junto a IMPRO y la primera vez con KIVA.
texts.en:
Benjamín is single, and he does not have children.  He lives in his parents’ house, occupying one room with brick walls and a cement floor.  The house is in the Miraflores area of the city of La Paz.

He currently gets income working at various events at night during every week-end.  He has an amplification service for celebrations.

He needs the loan to buy an amplifier because he wants to improve his income and provide better service at events so that they will hire him.

Benjamín’s dream is to be able to become independent and to improve his quality of life.

This is the first time that he has requested a loan with IMPRO and the first time with Kiva.

loans.use: to buy an amplifier in order to improve his services at events.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more stock of fruits and vegetables needed in her business.

loans.name: Mio Group

texts.en: Hesti is married, has five children and lives in Lubang Buaya in the east of Jakarta, Her husband's occupation is driver and his income can't fulfill the daily family needs. So Hesti decided to start her grocery store business and it's been running well for 23 years, growing little by little. From this business she can pay school fees and can pay the loan installment on time. There are many competitors but her business still survives. She enjoy the convenience of her business being located in her house. Hesti is the leader of this group,which is a solid group because they are neighbors.

loans.use: to increase capital to buy oil, rice, gas holders, refill water.

loans.name: Firuza

texts.ru: Фируза очень целеустремленная женщина. Ей 43 года. Она замужем и на воспитании имеет 1 ребенка. Она всегда реализует свои цели и сейчас она в процессе реализации новой цели. Она планирует организовать свой бизнес купле продажей женской одежды. С такой целью она обучилась в курсе «Добейся успеха» организованный Ассоциация Деловых Женщин и получила сертификат. От полученного дохода она планирует обеспечить семью с хорошими условиями жизни.  Она запрашивает займ на сумму  4500 сомони для покупки товара, чтобы организовать новый бизнес. Она ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en:
Firuza is a very purposeful woman. She is 43 years old, married and is raising one child. 

She always realizes her goals and is now in the process of implementing a new target. She plans to start a business buying and selling women's clothing. To that end, she took a course "Bring It On" organized by the Association of Business Women and received a certificate. 

From the revenue of her business, she plans to provide her family with good living conditions. She is asking for a loan of 4,500 Somoni to purchase stock for establishing her new business. She awaits your kindness.

loans.use: To buy women’s clothes for organizing a new business

loans.name: Faustina

texts.es: Faustina de 30 años, vive en su propia casa junto a su pareja y sus 03 queridos hijos, a quienes desea una buena estadía. Faustina, una mujer de provecho dedicada a su trabajo en los campos de cultivo donde le dedica suficiente cuidado a su siembra de café; ya que su familia depende de la obtención de sus frutos. Lo que mas le gusta de trabajo es poder realizar junto a su esposo e hijos quienes le dan moción para seguir adelante con la obtención de las  plantas de café, a la vez considera difícil sobre las breñas que llegan crecen en medio de las plantas de sus sembradíos. Hasta ahora cuenta con el apoyo de los financistas de MFP ya que ellos apoyan la manera como trabaja Faustina en su campo de cultivo. Este es su crédito número 04, y será muy responsable como siempre, además está conforme con el trabajo de su banco comunal porque son personas responsables. Con los 1,000 nuevos soles, comprará abono para cuidar sus plantaciones.
texts.en:
Faustina, 30 years old, lives in her own house with her partner and three dear children, for whom she wants a good life. She is a good woman who is dedicated to her work in the fields, where she carefully cultivates coffee, a crop her family depends on. What she most likes about her work is being able to engage in it with her husband and children, who motivate her to continue going forward toward the harvest. At the same time, she considers clearing the chaparral, which grows in the midst of the coffee plants in her fields, difficult to deal with.  

So far, Faustina has received loans from MFP because they support the way she works in her fields. This is loan number four and she will be very responsible, as always. She is also satisfied with the work done by her communal bank because they are responsible people. With the S/. 1,000, she will purchase fertilizer to take care of her coffee plantation.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of fertilizer.

loans.name: Ricardo

texts.es:
El señor Ricardo, es soltero, tiene tres hijos, vive en anticrético ocupando dos habitaciones, la casa esta ubicada en la zona San Martín de la ciudad de La Paz.

Trabaja como chofer de taxi independientemente, por más de 8 horas diarias de los cuales el percibe sus ingresos para mantener a su familia cubriendo los gastos de educación, alimentación y pago de servicios básicos.

El crédito lo requiere para mantenimiento del motor de su vehículo que ya necesita reparación por su antigüedad (es un motor que lo compró usado anteriormente), y así prestar un buen servicio a sus pasajeros ya que es la única fuente de ingresos.

El sueño de Ricardo es dejar de vivir en anticrético y tener una casa propia para mejorar su calidad de vida tanto de él como de sus hijos y así poder vivir cómodamente en habitaciones separadas.

Ricardo tiene dieciséis créditos con IMPRO y con KIVA es la sexta vez.
texts.en:
Ricardo is single, and he has three children.  His living arrangement is an "anticrético" (lump-sum loan provided in exchange for housing tenure, where the loan must be paid back to the lender/occupant at the end of a specified period), and he occupies two rooms.  The house is in the San Martín area of the city of La Paz.

He works as an independent taxi driver for over eight hours a day.  That is how he gets income to support his family and cover the expenses for education, food, and basic services.

The loan that he needs is for maintenance on the motor in his vehicle.  It needs repair because it is old (he bought a previously used motor).  This way he will give his passengers good service.  It is his only source of income.

Ricardo’s dream is to stop living in anticrético and to have his own house.  He wants to do this to improve his quality of life and that of his children.  This way they would be able to live comfortably in separate rooms.

Ricardo has had 16 loans with IMPRO, and this his the sixth loan with Kiva.

loans.use: to pay for maintenance on the motor in his taxi.

loans.name: Feruza

texts.ru: Феруза женщина в возрасте  29 лет. У нее  двое детей.   Муж  находится в России на заработках,так как на Родине он не мог найти работу с хорошей заработной платой.  У этой семьи новый дом и супруги хотят построить новые комнаты, отремонтировать и обставить их.  Поэтому она  обратилась в нашу организацию за финансовой поддержкой.  Хотя муж присылает ей денег на проживание, у Ферузы много расходов в плане нового дома. Сама  она подрабатывает пошивом женских платьев на дому и у неё много клиентов.  Потому что спрос на национальные платья большой  у таджикских женщин и девушек.  На полученный  кредит Феруза хочет приобрести бытовую технику точнее холодильник.
texts.en:
Feruza is an 29-year-old woman with two children. Her husband is in Russia for work because he could not find work with a good salary in his homeland. 

The family has a new home and the couple wants to build new rooms, renovate and furnish them. Therefore, she turned to the Arvand organization for financial support. Though her husband sends her money for accommodation, Feruza has many expenses in the plan for the new home. She herself earns money from sewing women's dresses from her home and she has many customers because the large demand for traditional dresses for Tajik women and girls. 

With the loan received, Feruza wants to buy home appliances, more specifically a refrigerator.

loans.use: to buy a refrigerator

loans.name: Angelique

texts.en: Angelique is 32 years old. She sells spare parts for bicycles. The loan will be used to add more spare parts for sale. The profits from the business will be used to buy a cow which will provide milk for the family.

loans.use: to buy more spare bicycle parts for sale.

loans.name: Mamoun

texts.en:
Mamoun is a 29-year-old married man who supports two family members and is from Jarash Jordan. He is requesting a loan of 400 JD to pay for home improvements. He would like to repaint his home. In the future, he hopes to improve his socioeconomic status. 
Since Mamoun is under 30 years old, his loan is considered a youth loan.

loans.use: to pay for his home improvements.

loans.name: Tursunbubu

texts.ru:
Турсунбубу замужем, имеет 4 детей. Турсунбубу в качестве основного источника дохода для своей семьи, занимается животноводством, начав этот бизнес 24 года назад с суммы в 15,000 сом (KGS). Благодаря упорному труду Турсунбубу в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний  день имеется 2 дойные коровы с приплодом, 10 коз, ежемесячная прибыль от хозяйства составляет около 5,000 сом (KGS). Благодаря доходам от бизнеса, Турсунбубу смогла дать образование детям и провести свадьбу.  
В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Турсунбубу обратилась в компанию «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS)  на покупку скота для откорма и перепродажи.  Доходы от кредита Турсунбубу планирует вкладывать в развитие бизнеса посредством увеличения поголовья племенного скота.
texts.en:
Tursunbubu is married with four children. As the main source of income for her family, she is involved in raising animals, starting 24 years ago with the sum of 15,000 Som (KGS). Through hard work, Tursunbubu has in her farm today two dairy cows with offspring and ten goats. Monthly income from the farm is about 5,000 Som (KGS). Thanks to income from the business, Tursunbubu was able to educate her children and to hold a wedding. 

In order to further develop her businss, Tursunbubu asked Bai-Tushum and Partners for a loan of 100,000 Som (KGS) to buy cattle for fattening and resale. Tursunbubu plans to invest income from the loan to increase the number of breeding stock.

loans.use: to purchase livestock

loans.name: Gervasio

texts.es:
Gervasio, de 48 años, vive en su propia casa junto a su esposa, Silvestre de 42 años y sus 03 queridos hijos; Tulio de 20 años, Karina de 15 años y Lucy de 07 años, quienes apoyan a sus padres por el gran esfuerzo que hacen por salir adelante. Gervasio, es un hombre de bien, se dedica al cultivo de café, cuyos frutos le brindan buenas ganancias en los tiempos de cosecha, Gervasio, comenta que gracias al esfuerzo que día a día esta desempeñando, hoy tiene varias hectáreas de café cultivado. Sin embargo le resulta difícil transportar sus sacos de cosecha desde la chacra hasta  los centros de acopio. Pero ahora lo mas prevalece es comprar plantas de café para ampliar la siembra y de esa manera aumentar su producción y por ende obtener una buena estabilidad económica. Este es su crédito número 09, esta dispuesto a pagar todas sus cuotas puntualmente, ya que desea acceder a otro crédito mas adelante. En su banco comunal es un socio muy puntual.
Con los 500 nuevos soles, contratará jornaleros para que le apoyen a sacar las malezas que aquejan sus plantas.
texts.en:
Gervasio, 48 years old, lives in his own home with his wife, Silvestre, 42, and his three dear children: Tulio, 20 years old, Karina, 15 years old, and Lucy, 7 years old. The children all support their parents in the great effort they are making to get ahead.

Gervasio is a good man who is dedicated to growing coffee, a crop that provides him with good profits at harvest time. He notes that, thanks to his hard work day after day, he now has several hectares of coffee under cultivation. Nevertheless it is difficult for him to transport his crops from the farm to the collection centers. However his most important task now is to purchase coffee plants in order to expand his fields and, in this way, increase production and achieve economic stability.

This is Gervaisio’s ninth loan and he is ready to make all of his payments punctually because he wants to be able to access other loans in the future. He is a very attentive member of his communal bank. With the S/. 500, he will contract day laborers to help him remove weeds from his fields.

loans.use: to contract day laborers.

loans.name: Luisa

texts.es: Luisa, de 45 años, es una mujer laboriosa, vive en su propia casa junto a su esposo Víctor, de 47 años y sus 05 amados hijos, quienes apoyan a su linda madre por seguir adelante. Hace 20 años que la señora Luisa, se dedica a la siembra de plantas de café; actividad que realiza con mucho esfuerzo y de este modo pueda tener buena producción en los tiempos de cosecha; Luisa junto a sus esposo y sus hijos se dirigen desde tempranas horas a ver el crecimiento de sus plantas como también realizan el mantenimiento. Por otra parte, lo que más anhela es incrementar su siembra ya que son muy rentables al vender sus frutos. Es por ello que acude a MFP para solicitar un préstamo que le brinde la ayuda de poder mantener productivas su siembra. Este es su crédito número 05, esta dispuesta a ser puntual con sus cuotas de pago; asimismo, en su banco comunal es una socia solidaria y responsable. Con los 1,000 nuevos soles, podrá comprar abono, para realizar el mantenimiento de sus plantas de café.
texts.en:
Luisa, 45, is an industrious woman.  She lives in her own house with her husband Víctor, 47, and her five beloved children, who support their beautiful mother in getting ahead.  For 20 years Luisa has made a living growing coffee plants, a job she does with great effort so she can have a good harvest.

Luisa and her husband and children go out very early to check the growth of their plants and to do the maintenance.  What she most wants is to increase her crop because selling the fruit is very profitable.  This is why she's coming to MFP to request a loan to help her have more productive crops.

This is her fifth loan.  She's willing to be punctual with her payments.  Also, in her communal bank she's a supportive and responsible member.

With the 1,000 nuevos soles [PEN] she'll be able to buy fertilizer to maintain her coffee plants.

loans.use: to buy bags of fertilizer

loans.name: Ofarin

texts.ru: Офарин  женщина трудолюбивая, она замужем и на воспитании у нее  3-е детей. Она работает в школе учительницей. Ее старший сын окончил школу.  Младший сын и дочка учатся в школе. Её муж Ашурали  имеет доход от строительных работ на частных стройках в близлежащих кишлаках. После занятий в школе она работает на поле, чтобы заработать деньги для  содержания семьи. Офарин считает что, этим путем они не могут, улучшит  своё благосостояние. Условия жизни у них очень тяжелые.  Она запланировала организовать новый бизнес и купить КРС для дальнейшей реализации. Она запрашивает займ на сумму 1000 сомони для покупки скота. Она ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en:
Ofarin is a hardworking woman. She is married and is raising three children. She work as a teacher in school. Her eldest son graduated from high school. Her younger son and daughter are still studying in school. Her husband Ashurali has income from construction work in private projects in the surrounding villages. 

After school, she works in the fields to make money to support the family. Ofarin believes that in this way they can improve their well-being. Their living conditions are very challenging. 

She plans to start a new business and to buy cattle for further distribution. She is requesting a loan of 1,000 Somoni to purchase livestock. She awaits your kindness.

loans.use: To buy cattle for organizing a new business

loans.name: Luisa

texts.en:
Luisa works hard to support her family. Luisa is married and has a food vending business in the Philippines.

Luisa requested a PHP 12000 loan through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business.

Luisa has been in this business for 2 years.

In the future, Luisa would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business.

loans.name: Gs Brisas Del Eden Group

texts.es:
El señor José tiene 54 años, vive en la zona sur de Honduras junto con el vive sus esposa quien también es comerciante y la apoya en cada uno de sus compromisos, su actividad es restaurante, trabajo que realiza desde hace 12 años en la comunidad donde vive. Su negocio se encuentra en un punto muy estratégico donde la fluidez es en grandes cantidades ya que esta ubicado en un lugar exclusivo y de mucha afluencia de personas.
Don José el crédito lo necesita para compra de producto como ser: camarones, pescado, refrescos, curiles, verduras, pollo, plátano verde etc. el impacto esperado con el financiamiento, es que sus ventas se incremente, ya que comprara bastante producto, de esta manera podrá ofrecer una variedad de platillos a sus clientes los cuales lo visitan a diario, ya que por la calidad de sus producto tiene mucha demanda.
Los planes a futuro de Don José es seguir creciendo día a día en su actividad comercial, como también generarse mejores ingreso, para tener una mejor calidad de vida.
María de Jesús se dedica a atender su negocio que es un Restaurante
Rosaly se dedica a la venta de ropa usada y la venta de curiles
Choluteca, Honduras - Agosto del 2012
texts.en:
José, 54, lives in the south of Honduras with his wife.  She's also a merchant and she helps him in every one of his commitments.  He has had a restaurant for 12 years in the community where he lives.  His business is located in a strategic place where there's a lot of traffic flow because it's in an exclusive area where the people are affluent.

José needs the loan to buy products such as shrimp, fish, soft drinks, guinea pigs, vegetables, chicken, plantains, etc.  The desired impact of the loan is to increase his sales because he'll buy a lot of products.  This way he'll be able to offer his daily customers a variety of dishes, which are in demand for their quality.

José's plan for the future is to continue growing every day in his business and to generate more income to have a better quality of life.

María de Jesús has a restaurant and Rosaly sells used clothing and guinea pigs.

Choluteca, Honduras, August 2012

loans.use: to buy shrimp, fish, soft drinks, guinea pigs, vegetables, chicken, plantains, etc.

loans.name: Herbert

texts.en: Herbert is a twenty-seven-year-old, hardworking, man living in Kasese, Uganda. He is a banker and has been working for two years. He has always admired the banking profession and, when the opportunity came along, he felt it was a dream come true. During this time in service, he has been able to buy land on which he intends to build a family residential house. His major challenge is that the work is time consuming, as he reports to work at 8:00 AM and goes home at 9:00 PM and thus has limited time to go into business to earn extra income. Herbert is requesting a loan to buy building materials such as cement and bricks for his house.

loans.use: to buy building materials such as cement and bricks for his house.

loans.name: Julia

texts.es:
La socia se sigue dedicando al negocio de venta de golosinas,la socia vende chupetes,galletas,caramelos y chicles,la socia vende en forma ambulatoria en las diferentes calles de la ciudad del Cusco,la socia tambien vende comida llevando a lugares como a los maestros de construccion donde realizan obras,la socia por medio de estos negocios la socia saca adelante a sus hijos,el sueño de la socia es tener una tienda de abarrotes.La socia solicita el credito para comprar caramelos,chicles,galletas y chupetes y tambien la socia compra productos para cocinar como arroz,carne,pollo y verduras.

La socia esta contenta con el credito y se compremete a cumplir con los pagos.
texts.en:
This member sells snacks such as lollypops, cookies, caramels, and gum.  She sells on foot through the streets of the city of Cusco and also sells food and takes it to places like construction sites.  She gets her children ahead through this business and hopes to set up a grocery store one day.  She will use the money from this loan to buy caramels, gum, cookies, lollypops, and also ingredients such as rice, meat, poultry, and vegetables.

She is grateful for this loan and promises to make her payments.

loans.use: to buy snacks and ingredients.

loans.name: Santos Cesar

texts.es:
Santos tiene 35 años de edad, es casado y tiene tres hijos. Es una persona trabajadora que se dedica a la agricultura desde hace 22 años, fue su padre quien le enseño todo sobre el trabajo agrícola. Desde pequeño se dedica a esta actividad y a la crianza de ganado. Para comprar los insumos agrícolas, tiene que viajar en autobús durante veinte minutos, hacer sus compras y regresar a su vivienda. 

El préstamo que esta solicitando a Fundación Campo, es para comprar 4 sacos de abonos y fertilizantes para 14,000 metros cuadrados de maíz que tiene cultivados. De esta manera, proporcionara a su cultivo los nutrientes que requiere para su óptimo desarrollo, con el fin de obtener una buena producción. Para que las ganancias se incrementen y le permitan continuar trabajando y ayudándoles a sus hijos con la educación.
texts.en:
Santos, 35, is married and has three children.  He's a hardworking person who has made a living in agriculture for 22 years.  His father taught him everything about agricultural work.  Since he was little he has made a living in this job and raising livestock.  To buy the agricultural inputs he has to travel by bus for 20 minutes, make his purchases, and return home.

The loan he's requesting from Fundación Campo is to buy four sacks of manure and fertilizer for 14,000 square meters of corn he's growing.  This way he'll give his crop the nutrients necessary for optimal development.

His goal is to have a good harvest to increase his earnings so he can continue working and helping his children with their education.

loans.use: to buy four sacks of manure and fertilizer for 14,000 square meters of corn

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy beauty products

loans.name: Alan Oswaldo

texts.es: Alan Oswaldo, tiene 32 años de edad, es soltero. Es un estudiante muy aplicado con mucho deseo de superación y apoyar a sus padres. Hace poco terminó su carrera técnica de administración bancaria en un Instituto , gracias al apoyo de sus padres y a su perseverancia y esfuerzo valores que le inculcaron sus padres. Como su meta es llegar a ser un profesional a nivel universitario actualmente está iniciando sus estudios en la carrera de Economía para lo cual solicitó el crédito para cubrir los gastos de convalidación de cursos y continuar con su siguiente meta obtener su titulo profesional universitario en la carrera de Economía y poder trabajar en una empresa reconocida.
texts.en:
Alan Oswaldo, 32, is single.  He's a diligent student who wants to improve himself and help his parents.  Recently he finished his studies in banking administration in an institute, thanks to the support of his parents and to his perseverance and effort, values his parents instilled in him.  His goal is to be a professional at the university level, so currently he's beginning his studies in economics.

This is why he's requesting a loan to cover the expenses to validate his coursework and continue with his next goal, to get his university degree in economics and be able to work for a well-known company.

loans.use: to pay to have his coursework validated

loans.name: Mwanasiti

texts.en:
Mwanasiti is 38 years old and has four children, two of whom are in school.  She buys and sells goats at the market, a business she has done for the last 10 years. In addition to this business, she does farming in her small garden in her compound and sells vegetables to the neighborhood.

She notes that both of her businesses provide a good income because she is a very hardworking woman. Formerly she was a housewife taking care of the  home. She and her husband together maintain the household and pay the day-to-day expenses.

She is requesting this loan to purchase three goats to sell.

loans.use: to purchase three goats to sell.

loans.name: Flor Group

texts.es:
