La A.C. “FLOR” iniciará el  primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Villa Adela, está compuesta por ocho integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Eldy es la Presidenta Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos tenemos: venta de madera, venta de colchones, venta de frazadas, tapetes y chompas, venta de material de reciclaje, tienda de barrio, venta de chatarra.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Eldy es una integrante, ella indica que es la primera vez que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por invitación de su amiga que es socias de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio venta de madera, ella cuenta que este negocio lo aprendió de sus padres hace años atrás y posteriormente para su independencia ella inicio su propio negocio. 

El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de madera) que comprará de las comunidades del departamento de La Paz y posteriormente lo comercializará en su espacio de comercialización en la ciudad de El Alto. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar en lo posible a su familia, pues ella es vive en concubinato y tiene dos hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta los préstamos, la capacitación y el área de salud.
texts.en:
The “Flower” Communal Bank is initiating its 1st loan cycle with Pro Mujer, affiliated with the Local Office in Villa Adela. The bank is composed of 8 members and is led by a governing board with Mrs. Eldy as President. The businesses that the communal association's members carry forward are varied. Among them are selling wood, mattresses, blankets, rugs, sweaters, recycled materials, scrap iron, and, also, operating a neighborhood store.

The loan they request will benefit the small micro-enterprises of Eldy's bank colleagues. She says this is the 1st time they have joined Pro Mujer, entering at the invitation of her friend who is a member of the institution. At present, she has a business selling wood. She relates that she learned the business from her parents many years ago, and later, to become independent, she began her own business.

The loan she now seeks is to increase her capital for buying wood, which she will purchase in communities of the department of La Paz and, later, sell from her commercial space in the city of El Alto. This type of work permits her to generate resources to help her family as much as possible. She lives in a common law union with 2 children. 

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, Eldy responded that she likes the loans, the training, and the health care.

loans.use: buy wood to sell.

loans.name: María Luisa

texts.es:
María tiene 44 años de edad, es casada y tiene dos hijos que están estudiando. Es una persona trabajadora que desde hace 5 años se dedica a la elaboración y venta de tortillas. Este trabajo lo aprendió poco a poco; ella dice que es un trabajo fácil pero cansado porque esta elaborando tortillas de dos a tres horas y el esfuerzo del cuerpo por el calor es cansado. Fue su madre quien le enseño todo lo que tiene que ver con los oficios domésticos. El producto principal que necesita es el maíz, lo compra de 2 a 3 veces por semana y se tarda veinte minutos en llegar al lugar donde lo adquiere en autobús. 

El préstamo que esta solicitando a Fundación Campo, es para comprar 2 sacos de maíz para elaborar las tortillas. Con la inversión ella dispondrá de materia prima para continuar con su negocio, que es a través del cual recibe los ingresos que utiliza para el sostenimiento de su familia. Ella desea construir su propia casa ya que en la que viven es alquilada y tiene miedo que en cualquier momento les pidan que la desalojen.
texts.en:
María, 44, is married and has two children in school.  She's a hardworking person who has made a living for five years making and selling tortillas.  She learned this job little by little.  She says it's an easy but tiring job, because she's making tortillas for two or three hours and the effort of her body in the heat is tiring.  Her mother taught her everything about domestic chores.

The main product she needs is corn.  She buys it two or three times a week and it takes her 20 minutes on the bus to get to the place where she gets it.

The loan she's requesting from Fundación Campo is to buy two sacks of corn to make tortillas.  With the investment she'll have the ingredients to continue with her business, from which she receives the income to support her family.

She wants to build her own house because the one they live in is rented and she's afraid that she could be asked to leave at any time.

loans.use: to buy two sacks of corn

loans.name: Saltanat

texts.ru:
Салтанат 48 лет, воспитала 3 детей. Салтанат в качестве основного источника дохода для своей семьи, занимается полеводством  и животноводством, начав этот бизнес после развала Советского Союза, повлекшего безработицу и расформирование колхозов. Начав с 5 овец, благодаря упорному труду Салтанат на сегодняшний  день в ее хозяйстве имеется 6 дойных коров с приплодом, 10 овец, ежемесячная прибыль от хозяйства составляет около 2,700 сом (KGS). 
В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Салтанат обратилась в компанию «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS)  на покупку овец для откорма и перепродажи.  Доходы от кредита Салтанат планирует вкладывать в развитие бизнеса, чтобы накопить сумму для оплаты обучения для младшего ребенка.
texts.en:
Saltanat is 48 years old and is raising three children. As the main source of income for her family, Saltanat is engaged in raising crops and livestock, having started this business after the collapse of the Soviet Union that caused unemployment and the dissolution of collective farms. Starting with five sheep, Saltanat through hard work today has in her farm six dairy cows with offspring and ten sheep. Monthly income from the farm is around 2,700 Som (KGS). 

With the goal of further developing her business, Saltanat requested a loan from Bai-Tushum and Partners in the amount of 100,000 Som (KGS) to buy sheep for fattening and resale. She plans to invest income from the loan in business development, in order to accumulate the sum needed to pay for tuition fees for her younger child.

loans.use: to purchase livestock

loans.name: Gulipa

texts.ru:
Гулипа  - лидер группы «Гулипа», ей  42 года, имеет 4 детей. Гулипа в качестве основного источника дохода для своей семьи, занимается полеводством  и животноводством, начав этот бизнес в 1988 году. Стартовав еще в советских денег в 600 рублей, благодаря упорному труду Гулипы на сегодняшний  день в ее хозяйстве имеется 2 дойные коровы с приплодом, 10 овец, 1 лошадь, ежемесячная прибыль от хозяйства составляет около 5,000 сом (KGS). 
В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Гулипа обратилась в компанию «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 50,000 сом (KGS)  на покупку 10 овец для откорма и перепродажи.  Доходы от кредита Гулипа планирует вкладывать в развитие бизнеса.
texts.en:
Gulipa is the leader of the Gulipa Group. She is 42 years old and has four children. As the main source of income for her family, Gulipa is engaged in raising crops and livestock, having started the business in 1988. Starting back with 600 rubles of Soviet money, Gulipa through hard work today has in her farm two dairy cows with offspring, ten sheep, and one horse. Monthly income from the farm brings about 5,000 Som (KGS). 

With the aim of further developing her business, Gulipa requested a loan of 50,000 Som (KGS) from Bai-Tushum and Partners to buy ten sheep for fattening and resale. Gulipa plans to invest income from the loan into business development.

loans.use: to purchase ten sheep

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es:
La socia se sigue dedicando al negocio de venta de ropa,la socia vende pantalones,casacas,chompas,blusas y polos,la socia tiene una tienda donde vende ropas para mujeres y varones,la socia trabaja desde las 9:00 a.m hasta las 8:00 p.m,por medio de este negocio la socia quiere salir adelante,el sueño de la socia es ampliar el negocio de venta de ropa.La socia solicita el credito para comprar pantalones,casacas,chompas y blusas al por mayor.

La socia esta contenta con el credito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de su cuota.
texts.en:
Rosa continues selling clothing.  She sells pants, jackets, sweaters, blouses, and polo shirts in a clothing store for women and men from 9 a.m. until 8 p.m.  She wants to get ahead with this business.  Her dream is to expand her clothing business.

She's requesting the loan to buy pants, jackets, sweaters, and blouses wholesale.

She's happy about her loan and pledges to make her payments punctually.

loans.use: to buy pants, jackets, sweaters, and blouses wholesale

loans.name: Marpat

texts.ru:
Марпат  - участник группы «Гулипа», ей  57 лет. Марпат в качестве основного источника дохода для своей семьи, занимается полеводством  и животноводством, начав этот бизнес в 1983 году с покупки нетели. Благодаря упорному труду Марпат на сегодняшний  день в ее хозяйстве имеется 2 дойные коровы с приплодом, 16 овец, 1 лошадь, ежемесячная прибыль от хозяйства составляет около 5,000 сом (KGS). 
В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Марпат обратилась в компанию «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 40,000 сом (KGS)  на покупку мелкого рогатого скота на откорм и перепродажу.  Доходы от кредита Марпат планирует вкладывать в развитие бизнеса.
texts.en:
Marpat is a member of the Gulipa Group. She is 57 years old. As the main source of income for her family, Marpat is engaged in raising crops and livestock, having started this business in 1983 with the purchase of heifers. 

Thanks to her hard work, Marpat today has on her farm two dairy cows with offspring, 16 sheep, and one horse. Monthly income from the farm is about 5,000 Som (KGS). 

With the goal of further developing her business, Marpat requested a loan of 40,000 Som (KGS) from Bai-Tushum and Partners to buy livestock for fattening and resale. Marpat plans to invest income from the loan in business development.

loans.use: to purchase livestock

loans.name: Sahak

texts.en: Sahak lives in the town of Yeghegnadzor with his wife and son. Sahak works at the local emergency service. In addition, he is involved in beekeeping. Currently Sahak keeps 15 beehives. Sahak wants to increase the number of beehives, for which he needs sufficient financial means. He also needs to buy special medicine for the beehives to prevent diseases. This loan will help Sahak receive more honey from the beehives, earn additional income from its sale, and purchase more colonies of bees in the future.

loans.use: to pay for colonies of bees and medicine

loans.name: Murzaim

texts.ru:
Мурзаим  - участник группы «Гулипа», ей  56 лет. Мурзаим в качестве основного источника дохода для своей семьи, занимается полеводством  и животноводством, начав этот бизнес в 1985 году с покупки коровы за 500 советских рублей. Благодаря упорному труду Мурзаим на сегодняшний  день в ее хозяйстве имеется 2 дойные коровы с приплодом, 10 овец, 2 лошади, ежемесячная прибыль от хозяйства составляет около 6,000 сом (KGS). 
В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Мурзаим обратилась в компанию «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 60,000 сом (KGS)  на покупку дойной коровы в целях увеличения прибыли от продажи молока.  Доходы от кредита Мурзаим планирует вкладывать в развитие бизнеса.
texts.en:
Murzaim is a member of the Gulipa Group. She is 56 years old. As the main source of income for her family, Murzaim is engaged in raising crops and livestock, having started this business in 1985 with the purchase of a cow for 500 Soviet Rubles. 

Through hard work, Murzaim today has in her farm two dairy cows with offspring, ten sheep, and two horses. Monthly income from the farm reaches about 6,000 Som (KGS).
 
With the goal of further developing her business, Murzaim requested a loan of 60,000 Som (KGS) from Bai-Tushum and Partners for the purchase of a dairy cow to increase her income from the sale of milk. Murzaim plans to invest income from the loan in business development.

loans.use: to purchase a milk cow

loans.name: San Cristobal De Aparquilla Group

texts.es:
La socia es la señora Cirila, ella tiene  50 años, está casada y tiene 3 hijos, ella como la mayoría de los compañeros de su grupo, se dedica a la crianza de animales menores, venta de verduras y hortalizas,  y también tiene una tienda de abarrotes en la cual expende productos de primera necesidad y aprovecha su tienda para vender chicha de jora también.  En este grupo de socios hay 2 señoras con el mismo nombre (Cirila), y nuestra socia en esta oportunidad es la que tiene a una niña en brazos.
Los socios de este grupo estan solicitando sus respectivos prestamos para capitalizar cada uno sus actividades comerciales y en su gran mayoria abastecerse de mercaderia como verduras y tambien comprar animales menores como cuyes y gallinas.
Cirila es una persona muy simpática y comunicativa, ella está orgullosa por sacar adelante a sus 3 hijos los cuales están estudiando, uno de ellos en la universidad, el segundo en un instituto superior y el ultimo preparándose en una academia pre universitaria.  Cirila está muy agradecida con la ayuda de KIVA, por ayudarla a fortalecer  su actividad económica y ayudarla con la educación de sus 3 hijos para procurarles un mejor futuro. La socia pertenece al banco comunal “Patrón Salvador del Mundo”; del distrito de San Salvador de la provincia de Calca del Cusco – Perú.
texts.en:
The member is Sra. Cirila, who is 50 years old, married and has three children. She, like most of the members in her communal bank, raises small animals, sells vegetables and also has a small store where she sells basic supplies. She also uses her store to sell “chicha de jora” (corn liquor).

There are two members of this communal bank with the same name (Cirila). Our featured member is the one in the photo who has her arms around a little girl.

The members of this group are requesting their respective loans to capitalize their businesses and, in most cases, to stock merchandise, such as vegetables and purchase small animals, such as guinea pigs and chickens.

Cirila is a very kind person who is always ready to help others. She is proud of helping her three children to get ahead. All of them are in school; one is attending the university, the second is at an institute of higher learning and the last is at an academy preparing for the university. 

Cirilia is very grateful for the help from KIVA because it is enabling her to strengthen her businesses and to provide for her three children’s education so they can secure a better future.

She belongs to the “Patrón Salvador del Mundo” Communal Bank in San Salvador District in Calca Province in Cusco Department, Perú.

loans.use: to purchase vegetables  and chickens and guinea pigs in order to capitalize her commercial activities.

loans.name: Venerande

texts.en: Venerande, a 62-year-old married mother of eight children between 22 and 44 years of age, has been selling beans for the past 10 years. Now requesting a loan to buy more beans to resell, she will use the additional business profits to buy a cow.

loans.use: to buy more beans to resell.

loans.name: Santiago

texts.es: Durante toda su vida Santiago se ha dedicado a trabajar en el campo. Comenzó desde muy joven al lado de su padre y sus hermanos quienes le enseñaron todo lo necesario para que se pudiera convertir con el paso del tiempo en un productor de café. A la edad de veinte años se casó con Guadalupe y juntos se dedicaban a trabajar en las fincas de otras personas como jornaleros hasta que poco a poco fueron adquiriendo sus propios terrenos en los cuales producen café al lado de sus hijos. Toda la producción de la familia es de café orgánicos desde hace ya algunos años pues no utilizan productos químicos para fertilizar y limpiar sus fincas. Para mantener la buena calidad de su café Santiago necesita preparar sus terrenos para la siembra de nueva planta pues algunas de las que tiene ya han cumplido su ciclo de vida productiva y deben ser renovadas. También necesita hacer labores de limpieza y para eso solicita un crédito el cuál pagará al final de la cosecha. Además del café Santiago y su familia también producen caña ya que la zona en donde viven es ideal también para este cultivo. Después de la cosecha a Santiago le gustaría arreglar la entrada de su casa para que pueda meter su camioneta.
texts.en: Throughout his life Santiago has worked in the fields for a living. He began at a young age along side his father and his brothers who taught him everything necessary to over time become a coffee producer. At the age of 20 he married Guadalupe and together they worked in the other people's farms as laborers until little by little they were acquiring their own land on which they produce coffee along side their children. The production of the family is all organic coffee for some years now, as they do not use chemical products to fertilize or clean their farm. To maintain a high quality coffee Santiago needs to prepare his land for harvest as some have completed their cycle of productive life and must be restarted. He also needs to do cleaning tasks and for that he is requesting a loan which will pay for the end of the harvest. In addition to coffee, Santiago and his family also produce sugar cane since the area where they live is ideal also for this crop. After harvest Santiago would like to fix driveway so that he can park his truck.

loans.use: to renovate his coffee farms.

loans.name: Mohiniso

texts.ru: Мохинисо женщина в возрасте  42 лет, замужем, имеет троих детей.  Она обратилась в Арванд за поддержкой, хочет заранее подготовиться к зиме и запастись углем так как зимой она топит печь.  Ее вид деятельности заключается в то, что она   дома на заказ шьёт женские национальные платья.  Все что она зарабатывает уходит на семейные нужды и на крупные расходы не хватает.   Муж Мохинисо третий год находится на заработках в Российской Федерации.  Она кредитуется с 2011 года.   Кредит получает во второй раз. На полученный кредит хочет закупить уголь на зиму,так как  пока цены на уголь приемлемые.   Это единственный выход обогревать дом зимой.  Она заранее благодарит за финансовую поддержку.
texts.en: Mohiniso is a 42 year-old woman, who is married and has three children.  She came to Arvand for support and wants to prepare for the winter in advance by stocking up on coal because she has to use heating in the winter.  Her business is sewing women's national dresses to-order.  Everything that she earns goes toward the family needs, and nothing is left for major expenses.  Mohiniso's husband has been working in the Russian Federation for the third year now.  She has been obtaining financing since 2011.  This is her second loan.  Mohiniso wants to use this loan to purchase coal for the winter while the coal prices are reasonable.  This is the only way to heat her house in the winter.  She is grateful in advance for the financial support.

loans.use: to purchase coal for the winter while the coal prices are reasonable

loans.name: Nasiba

texts.ru: Насибе 35 лет. Она замужем и на воспитании имеет 3 детей. Насиба с отличием закончила Худжандский Государственный Университет факультет Иностранных языков. Она в совершенстве обладает английском языком. С целью усовершенствования своих знаний она поступила в Таджикский Государственный Университет Коммерции, но не имеет средства, чтобы оплатить годовой договор. Она запрашивает займ для оплаты учебы в университете. Она ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en: Nasiba is 35 years old, married and raising three children.  She completed her studies of foreign languages at the Khujand State University with excellence.  She is fluent in English.  In order to advance her knowledge, she was accepted to the Tajikistan State Commerce University, but does not have means to pay for the annual education contract.  Nasiba is requesting this loan to pay for her education at the university.  She relies on your kindness.

loans.use: to pay for her education at the university

loans.name: Bilhah

texts.en:
Bilhah is 44 years old, married to Simeon, and blessed with four children aged 20, 18, 16 and 13 years respectively. She sells grocery goods--a business she started six years ago--and earns a monthly income of KES 10,000. 

She has requested a second loan of KES 40,000 to purchase more onions, bananas, vegetables, and pineapples to sell. 

The profit from her business will be ploughed back into her business. She hopes to own a big supermarket in the future.

loans.use: To purchase more onions, bananas, vegetables, and pineapples for sale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks, and beverages

loans.name: Jamieleh

texts.en: Jamieleh is a 30-year-old married woman from Jarash Jordan. She is requesting a loan of 400 JOD to buy children's and women's clothes to resell in the same area. In the future she hopes to expand her project to increase her family's income.

loans.use: to buy clothes to resell

loans.name: Natherine

texts.en:
Natherine is 39 years old and lives in Masindi, Uganda.  She is is charged with the responsibility of looking after four children.

For 18 years Natherine has been trading in second-hand shoes.   She started with SHS 200,000, but now she has more than SHS 3,000,000 as working capital.   Inadequate capital to purchase stock and unpredictable customer tastes hinder her business. 

Natherine intends to use the loan to buy more second-hand shoes to sell.  Educating her children and moving her business to town are her goals.

loans.use: to buy second-hand shoes to sell.

loans.name: Ester

texts.en: Ester is 34 years old, and married with two school-age children. She lives in Sandugan, Larena, Siquijor.  Her primary economic activity has been making and selling snacks for three years, providing her with an income of PHP 3,600 a month. She also engages in raising pigs to have another source of income. She took a loan from PMPC in the amount of PHP 13,000 to purchase raw ingredients to make snacks, and to buy piglets to raise and feed. She plans to use the profit to provide for the needs of her family and to save for the future.

loans.use: to purchase raw ingredients to make snacks, as well as piglets and feeds

loans.name: Jacqueline

texts.en: Jacqueline is 40 years old and married to a farmer. She sells goats, and she has spent five years in the business.  The proceeds of her loan will be used to buy more goats for sale.  She plans to use the profits from the business to buy a plot of land for cultivating.

loans.use: To buy more goats for sale.

loans.name: Aloysius

texts.en: Aloysius needs the loan facility to pay school fees for himself. He is a 28-year-old ambitious man living in Kasese, Uganda. He is a banker and with the salary he earns, he has been able to upgrade in his studies. He would like to buy land and build a house before he can get married and have children. His offices are located on the main street and this helps him to reduce costs of transport since he rents in town.

loans.use: to pay school fees for himself

loans.name: Roose Belt

texts.en:
Roosebelt is 32 years old and still single. He lives with his parents in a rural community. He aims to earn and save more income to invest in his business the future. 

For lack of job opportunities, he cultivates their farm land by planting citrus and bananas for sale. He planned to expand his plantation of the said fruits to ensure a high production. 

Because of inadequate capital, he is asking for an additional of PHP 30,000 to buy fertilizers and insecticides for the maintenance of his citrus plantation. He said that this loan will allow him to expand his plantation, and he is hoping that he will be successful and financially stable in the future.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and insecticides for his citrus plantation

loans.name: Jared

texts.en:
Jared lives in the town of Masindi, Uganda, where he operates a bar business selling soft drinks and beers.  He is charged with the responsibility of  looking after three children, all of whom are his biological children.  

Jared needs the loan facility to buy drinks to sell.  Theft and customers not paying on time hinder his business, while his dreams are to build a permanent home and buy land to grow crops.

loans.use: To buy more drinks to sell.

loans.name: Nadira

texts.ru:
Надире 35 лет, замужем, воспитывает 3 детей. Надира работает преподавателем начальных классов в местной школе и известна как главный организатор конкурсов и различных развлекательных мероприятий в школе. Также, в качестве дополнительного источника дохода для своей семьи, Надира занимается земледелием, начав этот бизнес в 1995 году с суммы в 5,000 сом. Благодаря упорному труду Надиры на сегодняшний  день в ее хозяйстве имеется сад с черешней, персиками, яблоками, а также земля с картошкой и кукурузой, ежемесячная прибыль от хозяйства составляет около 6,000 сом (KGS). 
В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Надира обратилась в компанию «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 135,000 сом (KGS)  на покупку семян лука  и картофеля для посадки, удобрений для земли.  Доходы от кредита Надира планирует вкладывать в развитие бизнеса, чтобы иметь возможность заплатить за обучение детей.
texts.en: Nadira is 35 years old, married and raising three children.  She works as an elementary school teacher at the local school and is known as the main organizer for competitions and various entertainment events at the school.  Also, to provide an additional source of income for her family, Nadira is involved in farming, having started this business in 1995 with a sum of 5,000 som.  Thanks to her hard work, today her business contains an orchard with cherries, peaches, apples and also land with potatoes and corn, and the monthly profit from the business amounts to about 6,000 som (KGS).  In order to further develop her business, Nadira requested a loan in the amount of 135,000 som (KGS) from the "Bai-Tushum and Partners" company to purchase onion seeds and potatoes for planting, and fertilizers for the soil.  She plans to invest the earnings from the loan into business development in order to have the ability to pay for her children's education.

loans.use: to purchase onion seeds and potatoes for planting, and fertilizers for the soil

loans.name: Cupertino

texts.es:
El señor Cupertino es casado, tiene tres hijos, vive en casa propia, pero no tiene documentos saneados de la misma, ocupando dos habitaciones, la casa esta ubicada en la zona Villa Ingenio de la ciudad de El Alto.

Cupertino trabaja como chofer realizando viajes interprovinciales del departamento de La Paz, ingresos con los que mantiene a su familia.

El crédito lo requiere para pagar el costo de terminar una habitación más en su casa para dar mayor comodidad a su familia.

El sueño del señor Cupertino es el de construir su vivienda las habitaciones suficientes para que sus hijos tengan las comodidades suficientes.

Cupertino tiene un crédito con Impro y con kiva es la primera vez.
texts.en:
Cupertino is married and has three children.  He lives in a house of his own but hasn’t cleared property title yet.  It has two bedrooms and is located in the city of El Alto’s Villa Ingenio zone.  Cupertino works as a driver making interprovincial trips in La Paz Department.  He supports his family with income he earns.

He needs the loan to pay to finish adding a bedroom to his house to provide more comfort for his family.  Cupertino’s wish is to build enough bedrooms at home so that his children will have enough comfort.  He’s had one previous loan with Impro and this is his first with Kiva.

loans.use: to finish adding a bedroom for more comfort at home.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to replant coffee and clear weeds.

loans.name: Hector

texts.es:
El socio se sigue dedicando al negocio de transporte,el socio presta servicio de turismo a lugares como valle sagrado,el socio trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 5:00 p.m,le socio se dedica a este negocio 6 años y le va muy bien y por medio de este negocio el socio saca adelante a sus hijos,el sueño del socio es comprarse un carro  nuevo.El socio solicita el credito para comprar llantas y repuestos para su carro.

El socio esta agradecido con el credito y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
The member continues in the transportation business. He runs a tourism service to areas like the Valle Sagrado (Sacred Valley).  He works from 8:00 a.m. until 5:00 p.m.  This member has been working in this business for 6 years and it's going quite well, and because of his business the member is able to help his children get ahead in life.  This man's dream is to buy a new car.  He is asking for this loan to buy tires and replacement parts for his car.

The member is thankful for the loan and promises to make his payments on time.

loans.use: to buy tires and parts for his car.

loans.name: Nancy

texts.en:
Nancy  is a married woman, with two children. She describes herself to be as an ambitious person.

She operates a talioring retail store where she repairs worn-out clothes and also makes new clothes, which in turn she sells. She has been involved in this business for 10 years. Her business is located at a busy area, and her primary customers are local residents. She describes her biggest business challenge to be the lack of funds for maintaining her business. 

She will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy a sewing machine. Her business goal is to start a new business of running a cyber café within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will have diversified her businesses.

loans.use: To buy a sewing machine.

loans.name: Jean Marie Vianney

texts.en:
Jean Marie Vianey is 40 years old.  He has three children, aged between 9 and 15. 

Jean Marie Vianey sells shoes, and he has been running his business for the past three years.  He wants a loan to buy more used shoes for sale. 

The profits from the business will be used to buy a motorbike, which Jean Marie Vianey will use as another source of income.

loans.use: To buy more shoes for sale.

loans.name: Marjorie

texts.en: Marjorie, aged 50, is a hardworking woman who lives with her husband and children in the town of Luna. At her age she is still capable of caring for two pigs. This is profitable work, and it serves as her pastime for the whole day. She farms pigs to save funds for her and her husband to use as they get older. At this moment, Marjorie is asking for support in the form of a loan of 15,000 PHP. She will use the loan to purchase feed, vitamins, and medicines to ensure the proper growth of her pigs.

loans.use: to purchase feed, vitamins, and medicines to ensure the proper growth of her pigs

loans.name: Antonio

texts.es: Antonio comenzó a trabajar desde pequeño al lado de su padre y sus hermanos cortando café para otras personas y con el paso del tiempo fue aprendiendo todo lo necesario para convertirse en productor de café. A los veinte años se casó con Guadalupe con quien tiene dos hijos que son quienes lo ayudan a realizar todas las labores necesarias en la finca de café que tiene. Para la próxima cosecha Antonio necesita de un crédito ya que tiene que abonar sus fincas en las partes que ha resembrado nueva planta de café. Este crédito lo pagará al final de la cosecha. Si realiza a tiempo estas labores dentro de dos años podrá aumentar su producción la cual actualmente es de cuatro toneladas anuales. Al final de la cosecha Antonio tiene pensado adquirir un terreno para aumentar su patrimonio y también su producción.
texts.en:
Antonio started working when still little alongside his father and brothers cutting coffee for third parties and in time learned everything necessary to become a coffee grower.  At the age of twenty he married Guadalupe and they have two children who help him do all the necessary chores in his coffee plantation.  

Antonio needs a loan for the next crop because he needs to fertilize the parts of his farm he’s replanted with new coffee plants.  He will repay the loan when harvesting is done.  If he does these tasks in time, in two years his production will increase; it’s currently four tons annually.  When the harvest is done, Antonio is planning on acquiring a piece of land to increase his estate and production.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer.

loans.name: Gs El Jardin Group

texts.es:
Doña Nelsis de 42  años de edad es madre soltera y líder del grupo solidario  EL JARDIN,  tiene casa propia y vive con sus tres hijos, y se dedica desde hace varios años a la venta de golosinas como ser: tacos, enchiladas, baliadas, frescos y dulces, su negocio esta ubicado en el colegio  de la comunidad y también vende de manera ambulante, esta ubicada en la comunidad de agua fría  en la parte sur de Honduras.
Doña Nelsis esta solicitando su tercer préstamo y lo necesita para compra de verduras, frescos, y carnes. Con el apoyo de este préstamo ella pretende salir adelante en su negocio, y con la s ganancias mejorar su calidad de vida y la de  su familia.
Doña Nelsis su sueño es tener un mejor negocio y mejorar su casa.
Doña Edis se dedica a la venta de tortillas y Doña Nibi se dedica a vender cosméticos y productos de limpieza.
San Lorenzo, Honduras - Septiembre del 2012
texts.en:
Nelsis is 42 years old and is the single mother and leader of the solidarity group EL JARDIN. She lives together with her three children in her own home, and has worked for several years selling prepared foods such as: tacos, enchiladas, quesadillas, soft drinks, and candies. Her business is located in the local high school and she also makes sales as a street vendor. She works in the town of Agua Fria, in the southern part of Honduras.

Nelsis is applying for her third loan, which she needs in order to purchase vegetables, soft drinks, and meats. With the help of this loan she will keep her business going and earn income to improve the quality of living for herself and her family.  She hopes to have a better business and a better home. 

Edis works selling tortillas and Nibi works selling cosmetics and cleaning supplies.

San Lorenzo, Honduras - September 2012

loans.use: to purchase vegetables, soft drinks, and meats for her business.

loans.name: Karine

texts.en:
Karine lives in Jermuk town, Vayots Dzor region, with her husband and 15-year-old son. Karine's husband works at one of Jermuk's schools, while Karine manages the household. 

In addition, the couple runs a farm, where they raise cows and lambs, as well as growing fruit trees. Karine has applied for this loan to buy forage for the cattle. This is important for her to keep up the development of the farm and continue gathering a stable agricultural income.

loans.use: To pay for forage to feed the livestock.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to replant and clear weeds.

loans.name: Tejedoras De Rio San Juan Group

texts.es:
La señora Oralia esta unida a su esposo, tiene 32 años de edad, no tuvo la oportunidad de estudiar, tiene 1 hijo, el cual aun no esta estudiando, se dedica a lo oficios de la casa como también tiene el trabajo de tejedora de cortes y guipiles, inicio este negocios gracias al poyo de se señora madre cuando Oralia tenia 12 años de edad, hasta el momento lleva 20 años de experiencia de realizar este trabajo, cuanta con el apoyo de su esposo quien se dedica a la agricultura.

Organiza un grupo para solicitar un préstamo que lo utilizara para la compra de hilos de varias clases y colores, en el futuro quiere tener varios puntos de venta para comercializar su producción de cortes y guipiles, y tener buenas ganancias. Las demás integrantes d3el grupo se dedican a la artesanía, crianza de animales domésticos, y alguna a la agricultura.
texts.en:
Oralia is married to her husband and is 32 years old.  She never had the opportunity to study, and she has one child, who is also not in school.  She works in her home as a housewife, and also has work making skirts and traditional blouses (guipiles).  She began this work with the help of her mother when Oralia was only 12 years old.  Now, she has 20 years of experience in this line of work, and she has the support of her husband, who works in agriculture.

The group has been organized to ask for a loan, which she will use to buy thread of different types and colors, and in the future she wants to have various sales points to make money from the production of skirts and blouses and make a good living.  The other members of the group are craftspeople, small animal ranchers, and some are in agriculture.

loans.use: to buy thread for weaving skirts and traditional blouses (guipiles).

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to replant, fertilize and provide crop maintenance.

loans.name: Jose Danilo

texts.es:
El señor José de 51 años de edad es casado se dedica desde hace varios años al negocio de compra venta de pescado de manera ambulante en su carro, El vive con Doña María quien es su esposa que atiende el molino cuando el sale a vender que es otra actividad que le genera ingresos, tiene casa propia ubicada en la comunidad de Agua Zarca San Lorenzo, al sur de Honduras.
Don José esta solicitando 7,000.00 lempiras para compra de camarón y pescado, para salir a vender a las aldeas aledañas y a San Pedro Sula. Con el apoyo de este préstamo él desea salir adelante y mejorar sus ingresos.
Don José su deseo es vender más para tener mejores ganancias que puedan reflejarse en las mejoras de su casa.
San Lorenzo, Honduras - Septiembre del 2012.
texts.en:
José, 51, is married and for several years has worked selling fish in his car from place to place.  He lives with María who is his wife and when he goes out selling she tends to the mill which is an additional source of income.  He owns his house which is located in the community of Agua Zarca, San Lorenzo, in southern Honduras.

José is requesting a 7,000 Lempira loan to buy shrimp and fish to go out and sell in adjacent villages and in San Pedro Sula.  With support from this loan he wants to move forward and improve his income.  José’s wish is to sell more to have better income that will be reflected in home improvements.

San Lorenzo, Honduras - September, 2012.

loans.use: to buy fish and shrimp.

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.es: Yolanda, de 31 años, vive en su propia casa junto a su esposo Ernesto de 33 años y sus 04 queridos hijos a quienes desea brindar un buen futuro. Yolanda, es una mujer de lucro se dedica al negocio, su propósito es estar junto a su familia  sin descuidar los deberes. Hace 13 años logró abrir su tienda de abarrotes  en la cual le resulta muy bien con las ventas que realiza, ya que sus principales clientes son sus vecinos cercanos a ella. Yolanda, comenta que hay ventajas y desventajas en su labor; por lo cual tiene que afrontar y seguir adelante con las ventas de su negocio para sobresalir en los gastos económicos. Desde que empezó a solicitar el préstamo de MFP ahora su negocio le va muy bien ya que de esa manera puede seguir con sus planes de trabajo. Este es su crédito número 08, por el cual asegura cumplir fielmente en sus pagos respectivos, además le va de la mejora manera en su grupo comunal. Con los 1,000 nuevos soles, comprará mercadería, para así abastecer a su bodega, con el propósito de captar más clientes.
texts.en:
Yolanda, 31, lives in her own house with her husband, Ernesto, 33, and their four beloved children for whom she wants to provide a better future.  Yolanda is a profitable merchant; her purpose is to be near her family and not neglect her duties.  She succeeded in opening her grocery store 13 years ago and its sales are very good since her main customers are neighbors near her.  Yolanda comments that there are advantages and disadvantages to the work she does which she has to face and continue forward with sales in order to cover expenses.  

Since she first requested MFP loans her business has done very well because she’s able to continue with her business plans.  This is her 8th loan and she is sure that she’ll be able to make her respective payments. In addition, she does very well in her communal group.  She will use the 1,000 new soles to buy merchandise to stock her store in order to secure more customers.

loans.use: to buy stock merchandise for her store.

loans.name: Gs El Esfuerzo Group

texts.es:
La Señora María, se dedica al comercio su actividad principal es la venta cosméticos, ropa interior ropa nueva de catalogo, ella cuenta con 4 años de experiencia en el manejo de su negocio. Ella cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo en los gastos familiares ya que el se dedica a la agricultura. Doña María es una persona muy trabajadora. El crédito lo necesita para comprar cosméticos, ropa interior y ropa nueva,  Ella cuenta con  la clientela de la zona, a través de su negocio a salido adelante, ya que ha sido una de sus principales fuentes de ingresos, ella se a sabido ganar la clientela porque  su  manera de atenderlos es muy especial, con el apoyo solicitado del préstamo que reciba Doña María, le contribuirá a tener un mejor negocio, para cubrir los gastos en el hogar y darle una mejor calidad de vida a su familia.
Doña María sueña con tener un negocio mas surtido y poder contar con un local ya que la venta ambulante en la comunidad donde ella vive, ella esta solicitando el apoyo del préstamo de manera grupal con Luís quien se dedica al comercio su actividad principal es la venta de helados (conos y chili guilis) desde hace mas de 9 años el vende de manera ambulante en la zona y Justo, se dedica al comercio, su actividad principal es la venta de abarroteria (pulpería), El cuenta con 2 años de experiencia. Negocio que opera bajo el nombre de pulpería “Lucy” 
Danli El Paraíso, Honduras - Agosto 2012
texts.en:
María is engaged in commerce, and her main activity is to sell cosmetics, underwear, and new clothes by catalog. She has four years of experience managing her business. She has the support of her husband for the family expenses, because he is engaged in agriculture. María is a hard-working person. 

She needs the loan to buy cosmetics, underwear, and new clothes. She has her clientele in the area. She gets ahead thanks to her business, because it's been one of her main sources of income. She gained customers because she has a very special way to serve them. With the support requested, the loan, María will have a better business in order to cover the household expenses and to give a better quality of life to her family. María dreams of owning a better stocked business, so she can have premises, because she is a street peddler in the community where she lives. 

She is requesting the support of a loan as a group with Luís, who is engaged in commerce and his main activity is to sell ice cream (cones and Chilly Willy's). He has been selling them as a street peddler in the area for more than nine years. Justo is engaged in commerce, his main activity is the sale of groceries (grocery store), and has two years of experience. He operates the business under the grocery store name "Lucy".

Danli El Paraíso, Honduras - August 2012

loans.use: to buy cosmetics, underwear and new clothes for her business.

loans.name: Judith

texts.es:
Judith de 41 años de edad, es una mujer muy alegre; junto a su esposo y sus 04 hijos viven en su propia casa que compraron gracias a su trabajo cotidiano. Judith, es una mujer de lucro, se dedica a la venta zapatos y prendas  de vestir para niños jóvenes y adultos. Esta labor lleva realizando hace 12 años, siempre cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo. Lo que le gusta de este trabajo, es que gracias a ello pudo mejorar su calidad de vida, ya que es rentable porque siempre tiene ventas, sobre los fines de mes o fin de semana, por lo que la gente de diferentes comunidades bajan al ciudad central donde esta su puesto de Judith.
Con el préstamo que obtuvo invertirá en la compra de mercadería para su negocio y sus planes a futuro es poder abrir sucursales en diferentes comunidades. Este es su crédito número 11; agradece a los financieros quienes apoyan a su trabajo en su negocio, ya que gracias a los créditos que adquiere ah logrado mejorar su puesto de ventas. Por otro lado le agrada formar parte de su banco comunal, porque trabaja con socios responsables. Con los 4,000  nuevos soles, podrá abastecerse de ropa y calzados.
texts.en:
Judith, 41, is a very cheerful woman.  She lives with her husband and four children in her own house they bought thanks to their daily work.  Judith is a priceless woman; she sells shoes and clothes for children, young adults and adults.  She’s been doing this work for 12 years and can always count on help from her husband.  What she likes about this work is that she was able to improve her quality of life thanks to it because it’s profitable and she always makes sales especially at the end of the  month and on weekends which is when people from various communities come down to the city where Judith’s stand is located.

She will use the loan she got to buy merchandise for her business and her plan for the future is to open branches in other communities.  This is her 11th loan and she thanks all the lenders who support her work in her business because thanks to the loans she gets she’s improved her sales stand.  On the other hand, she enjoys being part of her communal bank because she works with responsible members.  She will use the 4,000 new soles to stock up on clothes and shoes.

loans.use: to buy clothes and shoes.

loans.name: Julia

texts.es:
Julia, de 49 años de edad, es una mujer laboriosa; vive en su propia casa junto a su esposo y sus 05 hijos. Julia, se dedica a la venta de conservas, verduras, cereales, bebidas, golosinas, entre otros. Esta labor lleva realizando hace mas de 10 años y comenta que desde que empezó a laborar con este negocio cada vez iba mejorando su calidad de vida y la de su familia, ya que en este negocio siempre tiene ingresos. 
Lo que le gusta de trabajo es que es independiente; comenta que a inicios tuvo dificultades ya que tenía mucha clientela, pero poco a poco fue mejorando su tienda gracias a los préstamos que MFP y los financieros le facilitaban. 
Con el crédito obtenido, realizará la compra abarrotes para su tienda. Este es su crédito número 13, una vez más agradece a los financieros por la confianza que le brindan. Asimismo, agradece a los socios de su banco comunal por ser personas cabales.
Con los 3,000 nuevos soles, se abastecerá de sacos de arroz y azúcar, al igual que cereales y conservas, ya que son los mas pedidos.
texts.en:
Julia, 49, is a hardworking woman.   She lives in her own house with her husband and five children.  Julia sells canned goods, vegetables, cereals, soft-drinks and snacks, among others.  She’s been doing this work for more than 10 years and comments that ever since she started to work with this business she’s been improving her and her family’s quality of life every day because the business always produces income.

What she likes about the work is that it’s independent; she comments that at the beginning it was difficult because she had much clientele but she was gradually able to improve the store thanks to MFP loans.

She will use the granted loan to buy groceries for her store.  This is her 13th loan and once again she thanks the lenders who place their trust in her.  She also thanks the members of her communal bank for being honest people.  She will use the 3,000 new soles to stock up on sacks of rice and sugar as well as cereals and canned goods which are in highest demand.

loans.use: to buy sacks of rice and sugar as well as cereals and canned goods.

loans.name: Khaled

texts.en: Khaled is a 41-year-old married man who has six family members from Jarash, Jordan. He is requesting a loan of 400 JD to pay for his home improvements. He would like to buy new furniture. In the future he hopes to improve his family's living standard.

loans.use: to pay for his home improvements

loans.name: Richard

texts.en: Richard is a single man. He has no children yet. He describes himself as an honest man. He operates a grocery store where he sells vegetables and fruits. He has been involved in this business for two years. His business is in a remote local residential area, and his primary customers are residents from the environs. He describes his biggest business challenge to be insufficient funds for improving the business. He will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy fruits and vegetables. His business goal is to run a bigger grocery store. He hopes that in the future, he will run another grocery store. This is his first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to buy vegetables and fruits to resell

loans.name: Victoria

texts.es: Maximina, de 51 años de edad, es una mujer viuda; tiene 02 hijos; juntos habitan en su propia casa. Maximina, es una mujer laboriosa; ella se dedica a la agricultura; tiene  cultivos de cacao y café productos que lo comercializa en los centros de acopio de su localidad, quienes le remuneran buenas ganancias. En  temporada de cosecha necesita  el apoyo de peones con la finalidad de que puedan cosechar las hojas de manera rápida. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es cuidar sus cultivos y lo hace con mucho esmero, lleva 25 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es transportar sus productos, ya que los sacos que lleva son muy pesados y la cansan mucho. Para más adelante, desea tener el dinero suficiente para comprar nuevas tierras y así incrementar sus  plantaciones de cacao. Este es su crédito número 05, por el cual se compromete a seguir pagando puntualmente sus cuotas como en anteriores créditos. Con los 3,000 nuevos soles, realizará la compra de abono natural y la contrata de peones para que le ayuden en el mantenimiento de sus plantas.
texts.en:
Maximina, 51, is a widow; she has two children.  They live in her own house.   Maximina is a hardworking woman; she works in agriculture.  She grows cocoa beans and coffee, products that she sells in her local gathering centers where she earns good profits.  During the harvest season she needs help from day laborers in order to harvest the leaves more quickly.  What she enjoys most about her work is caring for her crops which she does with much dedication.  She’s been doing this work for 25 years and considers the most difficult aspect transporting the products because the sacks she carries are very heavy and they tire her out very much.  For later on she’d like to have enough money to buy new land and enlarge her cocoa bean crops.

This is her 5th loan and she commits to continue making her payments punctually like she’s done with previous loans.  She will use the 3,000 new soles to buy natural manure and to hire day laborers to help her with plant maintenance.

loans.use: to buy natural manure and to hire day laborers.

loans.name: Mediatrice

texts.en: Mediatrice is 40 years old. She is married to a motorcyclist. She sells beans and bananas. With the loan, she plans to add more bananas and beans to sell. The profits from the business will be used to buy a plot of land.

loans.use: To buy more bananas and beans to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks and beverages

loans.name: Michelle

texts.en: Michelle is 29 years old and married with with an infant child. She is an active member of PMPC. She lives in Bontod, Larena, Siquijor. She engages in selling frozen foods like hotdogs and dried fish. She's been engaged in the business for less than a year, earning a monthly average of Php 2,500. She took a loan from PMPC in the amount of Php 10,000 to purchase frozen foods and dried fish for resale. She will use the profit to provide food for the family and to save for a better future.

loans.use: to purchase frozen food and dried fish for resale

loans.name: Deily

texts.es:
Deily es una joven de 20 años de edad, vive en la ciudad de Puntarenas, ella estudia y a la vez trabaja en su casa haciendo artesanías para colaborar con los gastos de su familia.  Su meta es tener su propio taller de artesanía, para ello está solicitando un crédito de  un millón de colones (¢1.000.000), para comprar materia prima y aumentar la producción de piezas artesanales con lo que obtendrá mayores ingresos .
Deily agradece la oportunidad de realizar sus sueños a través de estos proyectos de crédito local, dice que alcanzará sus metas tanto en el estudio como en el comercio.
texts.en:
Deily is a young woman who is twenty years old. She lives in the city of Puntarenas, She studies and also works from her home making artisanal crafts to be able to contribute to the household expenses of her family. Her goal is to have her own craft workshop. She has requested a loan of one million colones (¢1.000.000) to buy raw materials to increase her production of crafts and by doing so increase her income. 

Deily is thankful for the opportunity to make her dreams come true through these local loan projects; she said she will reach her goals, both in studying and in business.

loans.use: to by raw materials to make artisanal crafts.

loans.name: Naile

texts.en:
Naile is 46 years old. She is married and has three children ranging in age from 16 to 11 years old. Her husband works in construction. Naile makes and sells handicraft items to earn her living. She operates from her home in Kosovo. She has run this business for more than three years and it is going very well, thanks to the commitment she puts into her work. She has a lot of customer’s visit her every day with different demands. 

She has requested a loan from KosInvest in order to buy materials for her handicraft business. This loan will help her to expand her business.
Naile's goal is to expand her business, to improve the living conditions for her family and to save money toward her children's education.

Knowing that this is a Kiva loan, she would like to thank all Kiva lenders!

loans.use: To buy materials for her handicraft business

loans.name: Pilar

texts.es: Pilar, de 21 años es una joven madre soltera. Vive junto a su madre e hijo Damian, en la casa de ella desde que nació. Gracias al terreno que le heredó su mamá ella puede sembrar papa, maíz y alverja, esto le permite adquirir algunos ingresos para su hijo y ella. Cuenta que en épocas de cosecha trabaja como peón en otros terrenos agrícolas, así puede juntar dinero para su próxima siembra. Aun cuenta con pequeños sembríos pero eso no la desanima, ya que tiene las ganas de seguir triunfando sobre todo porque es una mujer que no se rinde con facilidad. Hace poco abrió una peluquería, logro la adquisición de un pequeño local, donde comenzó a realizar cortes, peinados y maquillajes, puso sillas y espejos. En todo estos meses le fue muy bien pero aún le falta capital de trabajo por lo que esta segura recibirá el apoyo de su asociación. Ella pertenece al banco comunal “mujeres luchadoras” y este es el segundo crédito con MFP, se siente agradecido con el apoyo que encontró en su asociación pues le permite mejorar el capital de trabajo de su negocio. Por esa razón promete ser puntual en el pago de sus cuotas. Pilar; invertirá el dinero del préstamo en la compra de los insumos como tijeras, tintes y shampoo en cantidad para atender a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Pilar, 21, is a young, single mother.  She lives in her own house with her mother and her son, Damian, since he was born.  Thanks to land her mother passed down to her she’s been able to grow potatoes, corn and peas which makes it possible for her to earn some income for her and her son.  She relates that during harvest season she works as a day laborer on other farms to earn enough money for her next planting.  Although her crops are small, she is not discouraged because she wants to continue succeeding especially because she’s a woman who does not easily give up.

A short time ago she opened a beauty salon.  She managed to acquire a small locale where she provides haircuts, hair styling and make-up; she installed chairs and mirrors.  She’s done well all these months but she still lacks working capital which is why she’s sure to get help from her association.  She belongs to the “Mujeres Luchadoras” communal bank and this is the second MFP loan.  She’s grateful for the support obtained in her association because it allows her to improve her business’ working capital.  Because of this she promises to be punctual with her installment payments.  Pilar will use the loan money to buy supplies like scissors, hair color and shampoo in quantity in order to take care of customers.

loans.use: to buy scissors, hair color and shampoo.

loans.name: Teresa

texts.es: Teresa se ha dedicado a producir café desde hace doce años. Ella comenzó ayudando a su padre durante la época de corte y poco a poco fue aprendiendo todo lo necesario para desarrollar esta actividad. Cuando se casó su padre le regaló un terreno para que pudiera trabajar junto con su esposo Moisés, quien se encarga de la mayoría de las labores en el campo. Teresa trabaja por las mañanas de empleada doméstica cerca de la comunidad en la que viven y por las tardes ayuda a su esposo y también cuenta con un vivero de café en su casa. El café que Teresa y su esposo producen es convencional y a ellos les gustaría cambiar su producción a café orgánico. Este proceso lleva aproximadamente tres años y ya están haciendo las labores necesarias para lograrlo. Para la siguiente cosecha Teresa necesita un crédito para comprar fertilizantes pues ha resembrado parte de su finca. Pasando la cosecha tienen planeado componer su casa y poner un negocio de abarrotes allí para que de esta forma puedan tener un ingreso extra para la familia.
texts.en:
Teresa has been producing coffee for the past 12 years.  She began helping her father during the harvest season, and little by little she learned to do everything necessary to this work.  When she married, her father gifted her a plot of land so she could work with her husband Moisés, who does the majority of the fieldwork.  Teresa works as a domestic worker near the community where she lives and in the afternoons she works with her husband and also a coffee plant nursery in her home.

The coffee that Teresa and her husband produce is the conventionally grown type, and they would like to change over to producing organic coffee.  This process takes about three years and they have already begun the work necessary to achieve this.  For the next harvest, Teresa needs a loan to buy fertilizers, since she has recently replanted a part of her farmland.  After the harvest, they have plans to repair their home and put in a grocery store there in order to develop an extra source of income for the family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and change her production of conventional coffee to organic coffee.

loans.name: Godfrey

texts.en: Godfrey lives in the town of Masindi, Uganda and operates a retail shop business where he sells general merchandise like sugar and soap.  He is charged with the responsibility of looking after four children and his wife. Price fluctuations and high fuel and transportation costs hinder his business profits and his dreams are to educate his children to attain degrees as minimum qualification and to set up a wholesale business since most of the traders dealing in similar products have to travel to town to buy the goods. Godfrey is requesting a loan to buy general merchandise such as sugar and soap to sell.

loans.use: to buy general merchandise such as sugar and soap to sell.

loans.name: Daysi

texts.es: La Sra. Daysi tiene 57 años es casada con tres hijos que ya son mayores de edad,  vive por la zona de Agustín Saavedra,   La Sra. Daysi,  se dedica a la venta de variedad de artículos de primera necesidad en su tienda de barrio que se encuentra en la misma zona donde vive,  este préstamo es su primera  secuencia dentro de la institución, la Sra. Daysi va a usar este préstamo para la compra variedad de productos para surtir su negocio como abarrotes y refrescos  y  de esta manera brindar variedad de productos a sus clientes,  su razón para solicitar este préstamo es seguir mejorando en su  negocio, la Sra. Daysi va a utilizar los beneficios para seguir comprando productos y así mejorando sus ingresos, su deseo para su negocio es tener un almacén y así brindar un  mejor servicio a su clientela. La Sra. Daysi es una persona muy trabajadora se siente feliz por la oportunidad brindada.
texts.en: Daysi, 57, is married and has three children who are all adults now.  She lives in the Agustín Saavedra zone and she works selling basic staple goods in her neighborhood store located in the same zone she lives in.  This loan will be her first sequence in the institution and Daysi will use it to buy a variety of products like soft-drinks and groceries to stock her store thus providing wider variety of products for her customers.  The reason for requesting this loan is to continue to improve her business.  Daysi will use profits to continue buying products and improve her income.  Her wish for the business is to have a well-stocked store thus providing better customer service.  Daysi is a very hardworking person who feels happy for the opportunity provided.

loans.use: to buy stock merchandise for her store.

loans.name: C1120 Tuzamurumuryango Group

texts.en:
Dorcas is 41 years old and married with six children between 11 and 26 years old. She has nine dependents in her family. She owns a business selling various goods such as sugar, rice, cassava, etc. She is the leader of the group called "C1120 TUZAMURUMURYANGO" in the local language and she is the one who raising her hand. She has 10 years of experience in this work and she currently employs two people to help her.

Dorcas has requested a loan from Kiva lenders via Vision Finance Company to buy various goods such as sugar, rice, cassava, etc for resale. With the profit, she expects to save money for her future, to pay her children's school fees and to build her own house.

loans.use: To buy sugar, rice, cassava, etc for to sell

loans.name: Justine

texts.en: Justine is 38 and married to a farmer. They have three children. She sells beans and soya beans. She has been selling these items for the past three years. The loan requested will be used to add more beans to sell. The profits from the business will be used to buy a cow, which she thinks will help improve her family.

loans.use: To buy more beans and soya beans to sell

loans.name: Larisa

texts.ru:
Лариса замужем. У нее две дочери. Лариса имеет собственный бизнес.

Лариса продает женскую одежду на рынке родного города.  Опыт ее работы в этом направлении 17 лет.  У Ларисы собственное торговое место. Она ответственная и трудолюбивая. Лариса хочет развивать бизнес, чтобы получать больший доход.

Лариса просит предоставить ей кредит на закупку сезонной одежды - свитеров, брюк, кофт. Она планирует получить дополнительную прибыль и улучшить свои жилищные условия.
texts.en:
Larisa is married and has two daughters. She has her own business selling women's clothing at the market of her hometown. Larisa has 17 years of experience in this field. 

Larisa is responsible and hard-working. She wants to develop her business in order to increase her income. Larisa is asking for a loan to buy seasonal clothing: sweaters, pants and shirts. She plans to earn more profit and improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to buy seasonal clothing: sweaters, pants and shirts

loans.name: Philomene

texts.en: Philomene is 38 years old. She sells sodas and beers. She has been in this business for the past 9 years. The loan requested will be used to buy more beers and sodas for sale. The profits will be reinvested in the business.

loans.use: To buy more sodas and beers for sale.

loans.name: Nueva Esperanza *** Group

texts.es: El Banco de Emprendimiento NUEVA ESPERANZA *** está compuesta por ocho integrantes de los cuales seis son mujeres y dos varones que se dedican a distintas actividades, la presidenta del banco es la  Sra. Rita tiene 41 años, tiene tres hijos que se encuentran en edad escolar, ella se dedica a tejido de chompas y mantas de lana de Alpaca para las mujeres de pollera, ella vive en la zona 16 de Julio, este préstamo es su primera secuencia dentro de la institución, la Sra. Rita va a usar este préstamo para la compra de lana de alpaca por mayor para el tejido de sus chompas y mantas ya que por esta fechas tiene mucha venta también
texts.en:
The Entrepreneurship Bank Nueva Esperanza *** is composed of eight members of whom six are women and two are men. They are engaged in various activities.

The bank's president is Rita, who is 41 years old and has three children who are in school age. She is dedicated to knit sweaters and blankets and skirts for women made of alpaca wool. She lives in the area of 16 de Julio.  

This loan is her first sequence in the institution. Rita will use this loan to buy alpaca wool in bulk to knit her sweaters and blankets since she is selling a lot in these dates.

loans.use: to purchase alpaca wool in bulk.

loans.name: Jose Manuel

texts.es: El Sr. Jose tiene 34 años, casado con 2 hijos que son de las edades de 12 años y otro de 10 años, su actividad es de  Diseño y costura de ropa deportiva para niños, sus diseños son propios y simples, por lo cual son económicos, su taller  se encuentran en la zona de Sewenkani de la ciudad de La Paz,  Este préstamo es el Primero que ha tomado de Emprender,  Jose  va a usar este préstamo ya que una  de sus máquinas over  está fallando por lo que necesita hacerle mantenimiento y tambien comprara material para realizar su trabajo,  Su razón para solicitar este préstamo es que el cliente es miembro de un grupo de nuestra agencia, su grupo se lama SEWENKANI por la zona donde el vive, es un grupo bueno que no tiene atrasos y se colaboran entre ellos. Jose enfrenta retos en su negocio ya que  El señor es discapacitado parcialmente, tiene un problema de displasia que su mamá no pudo solucionar cuando él era un bebe, ahora el camina cojeando un poco, su anhelo es que sus hijos sean profesionales. Su deseo para su negocio  es conseguir una casa en anticrético y así  tener un taller más grande ya que ahora, su taller es pequeño y el frio que hace por la zona le hace daño a su salud y a la de sus hijos.
texts.en:
José, 34, is married and has two children who are 12 and 10 years old.  His activity is designing and manufacturing children's sportswear.  The designs are his own and they are simple which makes them affordable.  His workshop is located in the city of La Paz’s Sewenkani zone.  This is the first loan he’s taken in Emprender and José will use it to repair one of his overlock sewing machines and also to buy supplies to do his work.  The reason for taking out this loan is that he’s a member of one of the agency’s groups, called “Sewenkani,” after the zone’s he lives in.  It’s a good group that has had no delays and that has good teamwork.

The business challenge José faces is that he’s partially disabled, he has dysplasia that his mother was unable to correct when he was a baby and now he limps a bit.  His wish is that his children become professionals.  His wish for his business is that he acquires a house in the ‘anticrético’ modality [transaction whereby a property owner requests a "loan" from you in exchange for housing, which must be paid back to you at the end of your contract. If your loan is not repaid, the property owner could lose the property to you] in order to have a larger workshop than the one he has now.  His workshop is small and cold because of the zone and it damages his and his children’s health.

loans.use: to service his sewing machines and to buy more supplies to do his work.

loans.name: Paul

texts.en:
Paul is 52 years old with four children living in Hoima, Uganda. He is the soul breadwinner for his family. He is a hard working father and his family's welfare comes first in everything he does. He is a crop farmer and he has been growing bananas for a period of 10 years. Now he wants to add other crops like beans and maize to supplement his income.

Paul faces the challenges of high transportation costs and inadequate capital. His family goal is to educate his children up to the university level and to buy a car to improve his travel to market places. Paul also wishes to diversify his business and buy land for crop farming. He intends to use the loan to pay for labor and buy seeds for his garden.

loans.use: to pay for labor and buy seeds for his garden.

loans.name: Norbert

texts.ru: Норберт использовал предыдущий кредит для улучшения своих жилищных условий, а также внесения части суммы за образование. В этот раз Норберт просит предоставить ему кредит для оплаты образования за год. Он учится на третьем году обучения в колледже и ему тяжело насобирать всю сумму - 7,000 гривен - чтобы оплатить за весь год, как того требует колледж. Норберт надеется, что полученное образование поможет ему получить новую работу с большим доходом.
texts.en: Norbert used his previous loan to improve his housing conditions, as well as to pay part of his educational costs. This time Norbert is seeking a loan to pay the fees for a whole academic year. He is in his 3rd year of studies and is having difficulty coming up with the entire amount of 7,000 Ukrainian Hryvnia to pay for the year, as is required by the college. Norbert hopes that the education he receives will help him to find a new job with a high salary.

loans.use: to pay for education costs

loans.name: Lourdes

texts.es: La Sra. Lourdes tiene 37 años y es soltera con 2 hijos que son de las edades de 3 y 11 años, ella se dedica al servicio de chapería en su taller  que se encuentran en zona Santa Rosa, este préstamo es su primera secuencia dentro de la institución, la Sra. Lourdes  va a usar este préstamo para la compra de herramientas para su negocio, su razón para solicitar este préstamo es quiere mejorar el trabajo que realiza, la Sra. Lourdes enfrenta retos en su negocio que son la competencia y va a utilizar los beneficios para la compra de herramientas, como ser amoladora, lijadora y así poco a poco ir equipando su taller, se siente feliz y agradecida por la oportunidad que le brindan.
texts.en: Lourdes, 37, is single and has two children who are 3 and 11 years old.  She works in her auto body repair shop located in the Santa Rosa zone.  This loan is her first sequence in the institution and Lourdes will use it to buy work tools.  The reason for requesting the loan is that she wants to improve the work she does.  The business challenge she faces is competition and she will use profits to buy tools like a buffer and a sander and gradually equip her workshop.  She feels happy and grateful for the opportunity she’s being provided with.

loans.use: to buy tools.

loans.name: Haykush

texts.en:
Haykush lives in Yeghegnadzor town with her husband, Lavrent. Haykush works at the local military unit as a cook. In addition, she helps her husband to run a farm, where they keep a cow and hens and grow fruit trees. 

Haykush would like to increase the number of cattle, but she doesn't have enough means for it. With the loan's help Haykush plans to buy a cow, as well as forage for the cattle. Developing agriculture will allow Haykush to get a stable income and cover daily costs.

loans.use: To pay for a cow and cattler forage.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy more ready-to-wear clothes to resell.

loans.name: Ikpindi

texts.fr: Ikpindi a 28 ans. Elle est célibataire et sans enfants. Ikpindi vend depuis 03 ans des ignames et du mais à domicile. Elle sollicite un crédit auprès de Wages afin de posséder des fonds suffisants pour acheter en gros ses marchandises. Elle compte diversifier ses produits céréaliers pour pouvoir satisfaire sa clientèle et se lancer plus tard dans la vie maritale.
texts.en: Ikpindi is 28. She is single and does not have any children. Ikpindi has been selling yams and corn from home for three years. She requests a loan from Wages in order to have enough funds to purchase her stock wholesale. She plans to diversify her cereal products in order to satisfy her customers and subsequently envisage marriage.

loans.use: To buy yams and corn.

loans.name: Gadah

texts.en: Gadah is a 24-year-old married woman from Jarash, Jordan who supports two family members. She is requesting a loan of 600 JD to pay for home improvements. She will be repainting her home to improve her living standard. She hopes in the future to provide a good environment to live in. Since Gadah is under 30 years old, her loan is considered a youth loan.

loans.use: to pay for home improvements

loans.name: Winnie

texts.en:
Winnie, who is 31 years old, describes herself as a happy, enterprising person who is, above all, working very hard to get her children ahead. Winnie lives with her husband and three children in the town of Tiribe.

She sells shoes at the market to help her husband with the household expenses. At the moment, she has a good customer base, but the challenge is that she does not have enough capital to stock her store with merchandise. For this reason, she is requesting a loan from Yehu for the purchase of more stocks of shoes, so that her customers will have a good variety to choose from. 

This investment will allow her to expand her customer base, increase her sales, and increase her income. This will help her to support her family.

Winnie dreams of having a boutique in future.

loans.use: To purchase of more stocks of shoes to sell.

loans.name: Stephen

texts.en:
Stephen is 39 years old and lives in the town of Mbarara, Uganda. He is married and has four children, who are all currently in school. For the past 10 years, Stephen has been working hard to manage his small business, which sells household goods and clothes. 

To help expand his business, Stephen has requested a loan of 3,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy necklaces, shorts, lip balm, and firewood for building bricks.   It will help Stephen to generate greater profits and improve his family's standard of living. Stephen hopes that in the future, he will be able to open a wholesale shop. 

Stephen is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Stephen who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: To buy necklaces, shorts, lip balm, and firewood for building bricks.

loans.name: Ndeye Coumba

texts.fr: Madame Ndeye Coumba  est une femme mariée qui habite au Sénégal.  Elle capitalise une expérience de 2 ans dans le secteur du commerce et pratique l’activité d’animatrice. En meme temps elle s’active dans le commerce et gère un restaurant.  Elle consacre 8 heures de temps de la journée à son activité.  Elle sollicite un crédit de 250 000 frs prévu pour renforcer son ravitaillement pour son restaurant.   Elle souhaite  diversifier les  services qu’elle offre a sa clientèle, et épargner davantage  d’argent afin de réaliser ses projets futurs.
texts.en: Mrs Ndeye Coumba is a married woman who lives in Senegal. She has two years experience in commerce and is an organiser. At the same time as working in commerce, she manages a restaurant. She devotes eight hours a day to this activity. She requests a loan of 250 000 frs that is destined to the provision of supplies for her restaurant. She wishes to diversify the services that she offers to her customers, and save more for future projects.

loans.use: To buy supplies.

loans.name: Nanny Soledad

texts.es:
EL Banco Comunal Montecristi se reúne cada quince días en el Cantón Montecristi, conocido por su rica cultura pre colonial y por su artesanía que es reconocida a nivel nacional e internacional. Lugar de los famosos sombreros de paja toquilla.

La señora Nanny tiene 44 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen un hijo de  25 años que estudia en universidad y aun vive en su casa. Su esposo trabaja con maquinaria pesada.

Ella tiene una tienda en su casa en la cual  vende todo tipo de productos como arroz, azúcar, aceites,  legumbres además de ciertas cosas de bazar, papelería y algunas medicinas, trabaja todos los días desde las 6h00 hasta las 21h00 y a veces hasta más tarde, su hijo le ayudan en su trabajo cuando está desocupado. Tiene tres años con su negocio el cual ha ido aumentando con el paso de los días y con la ayuda de los créditos que ha recibido del banco comunal.

Este crédito lo va a emplear en surtir mas su tienda, va a comprar arroz, azúcar, aceite, detergentes, cuadernos, tarjetas, entre otros productos de primera necesidad. Está en el Banco Comunal hace 7 ciclos y le gusta porque el grupo es muy unido.
 
Sus metas son seguir adelante en su negocio y que su tienda crezca cada día más.
texts.en:
The communal bank 'Montecristi', meets every two weeks in the canton Montecristi. The area is known for it's rich, pre-colonial culture and for the handicrafts that are made there, well known on a national and international level. Montecristi is also known for producing the highest quality of Panama hats.

Nanny is 44 years old. She is married and with her husband has one son, who is 25 years old and studies at the university and still lives at home. He husband works with heavy machinery.  

She has a small store which she runs out of her home, from which she sells all types of products including rice, sugar, cooking oil and vegetables, as well as a few stationary items, paper and some medicines. She works everyday from 6am until 9pm, and sometimes even later. Her son helps her with her work when he is not busy. She has had this business for the past three years, which has grown with the passing of time and with the help of the loans that she has received from the communal bank.    

This loan she is going to use to stock her store. She is going to buy rice, sugar, cooking oil, soaps, notebooks and cards as well as other products of daily consumption. She has taken out 7 previous loans and she likes the communal bank because the group is well united. 

Her goals are to continue working on her business and that her store would continue to grow everyday.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, cooking oil, soap, notebooks, cards and other products of daily consumption .

loans.name: Vasyl

texts.ru:
Василь женат, имеет двое детей. Работает водителем автобуса на городском маршруте. Вместе со своей семьей Василь живет в стареньком доме. Василь любит ходить за грибами вместе со своей семьей. 

Недавно он сделал ремонт в одной из комнат и хочет поселить туда детей. Для этого им нужно закупить мебель - стол, где его сын сможет учиться, шкаф и кровати. Василь просит предоставить ему кредит в размере 8,000 гривен. 

Примечание: на фото Василь вместе со своей женой.
texts.en:
Vasyl is married and has two children. He works as a bus driver on a city mini-bus. He lives in an older home with his family. Vasyl and his family like to pick mushrooms together.

Recently, Vasyl renovated one of the rooms is his house and plans to use it as the children's room. In order to do that, he needs to buy furniture: a desk where his son can study, a wardrobe, and beds. Vasyl is seeking a loan in the amount of 8,000 Ukrainian Hryvnia. 

Vasyl is pictured here with his wife.

loans.use: to buy furniture for his children's room

loans.name: Diana Beatriz

texts.es:
