But now that she has the opportunity, Linda is looking for a loan to buy supplies for preparing fast food, in order to be able to fulfill her customers' orders.

Her dream is to open a cafe where she can have better income and also to get her two children ahead in life, by offering them a good education.

loans.use: to buy supplies to make fast food and be able to fill her customers' orders.

loans.name: Fabien

texts.en: Fabien is 32 years old. He owns a bar. He has been in the business for 8 years. He wants a loan to buy more beer for sale. The profits from the business will be used to buy a house.

loans.use: To buy more beer for sale.

loans.name: Andrea Cecilia

texts.es:
Andrea siempre ha sido reconocida por ser una persona muy trabajadora que con mucho esfuerzo ha venido sacando adelante su familia, pues a pesar de que no tuvo la oportunidad de estudiar ha desempeñado diferentes labores en las que siempre deja muy buena imagen por su gran compromiso. Actualmente tiene un trabajo en un hogar pero los ingresos que allí recibe no están siendo suficientes para poder sostener los gastos de su familia, es por esto que ha decidido iniciar un negocio paralelo a este el cual es una venta de prendas de vestir. Gracias a que ha venido teniendo buenas ventas y siguen creciendo, Andrea busca un préstamo para comprar prendas de vestir y surtir su negocio para responder a los pedidos de sus clientes.

Andrea espera recibir cada vez mejores ingresos para ofrecer a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Andrea has always been known as a a hardworking person who has gotten her family ahead with a lot of effort. Despite not having had a chance to go to school, she has worked at different things, always leaving a good impression because of her committment. Right now, she she has a job in a house but the money she makes there isn't enough to pay for her family expenses. That is why she has decided to start a side business selling clothing. Thanks to having good sales and growth, Andrea is seeking a loan to buy clothing and stock her business to respond to her customers' orders.

Andrea hopes to make more and more income to offer her family a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy clothing to stock her business to respond to her customers' orders

loans.name: Serapia

texts.es: La socia es la señora Serapia, ella continúa con su oficio  de corte y confección, elaborando diferentes tipos de manualidades en tela como cortinas, secadores de utensilios de cocina y artículos para el hogar en general y los comercializa en una de las principales ferias de la ciudad. Serapia trabaja duro para mejorar en su actividad, por ello esta ahorrando para comprar maquinaria que le permita ofrecer mejores productos a sus clientes, y en esta oportunidad está solicitando el préstamo para comprar una máquina para remallado de telas. Serapia está muy agradecida con la ayuda de KIVA, por ayudarla a mejorar  su actividad económica la cual le permite ofrecer una mejor calidad de vida a su familia. La socia pertenece al banco comunal “GRAN RENOVACION”; de la ciudad del Cusco – Perú.
texts.en: Serapia continues in her dressmaking occupation making various types of crafts like curtains, dish towels and articles for the home in general that she sells in one of the city’s main street markets.  Serapia works hard to improve her activity and is saving up to buy the machinery that will make it possible for her to offer her customers better products.  On this occasion she’s requesting a loan to buy a machine to darn fabric.  Serapia is very grateful for Kiva’s help to improve her economic activity that allows her to provide her family with better quality of life.  She’s a member of the “Gran Renovación” (Great Renewal) communal bank in the city of Cusco, Peru.

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine.

loans.name: Sovanara's Group

texts.en:
Sovanara resides in a rural area of the Kandal Province’s Kandal Stoeng district, Cambodia. He is 42 years old and married with five children, three of whom are dependent on him and still in school. To support his family, he has been involved in working as a paid taxi driver for 12 years whiles his wife plants sugarcane to help the family generate the income. The current business earns his family around 17,000 KHR per day and allows him to save about 6,000 KHR every day for future needs. Low crop yields resulting from flooding is the main challenge for his business.

Sovanara’s group consists of three members who are all males and it is his first microloan with Kiva’s partner VisionFund. He is leading his group asking for a loan of 200,000 KHR each. He will use his portion to buy materials for construction of a sanitary latrine (such as a toilet), tile drainage, and sewage. He hopes this loan will enable his family to have a sanitary latrine to improve their standard of living.

loans.use: To buy materials for construction of a sanitary latrine

loans.name: Maria Isabel

texts.es:
Maria comenzó hace unos 4 años a trabajar en la actividad de la crianza de ganado y producción de leche motivada principalmente por generar recursos para su familia que pudieran brindar una mejor calidad de vida, pues los ingresos que generaba su esposo estaban siendo insuficientes para el sostenimiento de sus gastos y los de sus 4 hijos. Como ya ha tenido conocimiento en la actividad, con unos ahorros compró su primera vaca y a partir de allí comenzó con la actividad, y ahora puede aportar recursos económicos que le permiten tener una mejor calidad de vida en su familia. Buscando seguir creciendo, Maria busca un préstamo para comprar ganado y aumentar su capacidad de producción.

Su sueño es continuar con esta actividad y generar recursos que le permitan mejorar la calidad de vida de su hogar y ofrecerles a sus 4 hijos una mejor educación.
texts.en:
Four years ago Maria started to work raising cattle and producing milk. She was motivated principally by the need to generate resources for her family that would be able to offer them a better quality of life, since the income her husband earned was not enough to support their household with four children. As she already had experience in this type of work, she used some savings to buy her first cow and from then on she started working. Now she can contribute financial resources that allow her family to have a better quality of life. Seeking to keep growing, Maria is looking for a loan to buy cattle and increase her production capacity.

Her dream is to continue with this type of work and generate resources that allow her to improve the quality of life for her home and offer a better education to her four children.

loans.use: to buy cattle and increase her production capacity.

loans.name: Ayesh

texts.en:
Ayesh is a 29-year-old married woman who supports three family members. She is from Jarash, Jordan. Since Ayesh is under 30 years old, her loan is considered a youth loan.

Ayesh is requesting a 600 JOD loan to pay for home improvements. She would like to buy a new furniture. In the future, Ayesh wants to improve her standard of living.

loans.use: to pay for home improvements

loans.name: Muhamedi

texts.en:
Muhamedi is 40 years old and is single with two children, one of whom is currently in shool. He lives in the town of Mbarara, Uganda. For the past five years, Muhamedi has been working hard to manage his shoe boutique, where he sells shoes for men, ladies and children. 

Muhamedi is requesting a 3,000,000 UGX loan to buy a wide range of shoes to sell to help expand his business. His loan will help him generate greater profits and improve his family's livelihood. Muhamedi hopes that in the future he will be able to start another business. 

Muhamedi is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Muhamedi who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy a wide range of shoes to sell

loans.name: Maria Betsabe

texts.es:
Maria tiene un trabajo como madre comunitaria en su municipio, pero como los ingresos que allí recibe no son suficientes para sostener a sus 2 hijos de 14 y 18 años de edad, ha decidido comenzar con la actividad de la agricultura, pues sus padres se dedicaron a esta actividad y ahora tiene gran experiencia. Como el terreno donde piensa tener sus cultivos no está adecuado, Maria requiere hacerle las adecuaciones necesarias, pero por falta de capital recurre a un préstamo para comprar semillas de verduras y pagar un tractor para realizar el trabajo de la adecuación del terreno.

Su sueño es mejorar sus ingresos y así ofrecerle una mejor calidad de vida a sus 2 hijos, para no tener que seguir padeciendo las grandes dificultades económicas que se presentan en su familia.
texts.en:
Maria has a job as a community mother in her town, but the income she receives there is not enough to support her two children, aged 14 and 18. She has decided to start farming, since her parents worked as farmers and now she has a lot of experience. Since the land where she plans to have her crops isn't suitable, Maria must make the necessary adaptations. However since she doesn't have the capital she needs a loan to buy vegetable seeds and pay for a tractor to do the work of making the land suitable.

Her dream is to improve her income in order to offer a better quality of life to her two children, and to no longer keep suffering the great financial difficulties that her family is faced with.

loans.use: to buy vegetable seeds and pay for a tractor to do the work of making the land suitable.

loans.name: Francisco Javier

texts.es:
Francisco empezó a vender productos de manera ambulante desde hace muchos años, cuando comenzó vendiendo frutas en un carrito. Luego tuvo la oportunidad de conseguirse un puesto en la calle y desde allí comenzó a ofrecer las frutas, pero como ese negocio no se estaba moviendo mucho decidió comenzar a vender productos de uso personal. Desde entonces ha venido creciendo con este negocio y pese a que no cuenta con mucho capital, su esfuerzo le ha permitido ir saliendo adelante para superar las adversidades. Gracias a que ha venido teniendo buenas ventas, su familia ha podido tener una mejor calidad de vida, y buscando seguir aumentándolas, Francisco busca un préstamo para comprar productos de uso personal para surtir su negocio.

Su sueño es tener un almacén donde ubicarse para no tener tantas dificultades en invierno y poder generar empleo para unos familiares muy necesitados.
texts.en: Francisco started selling from place to place many years ago with a small fruit cart.  He later had the opportunity of getting a street stand and then started selling fruit but because the business wasn’t doing too well he decided to start selling personal use products.  Since then, the business has been growing and despite not having much capital his efforts have allowed him to move forward and overcome his adversities.  Thanks to the good sales he’s been having, his family has had a better quality of life.  Seeking to increase them still more, Francisco needs a loan to buy personal use products to stock his business.  His dream is to have a store to locate in so that he can avoid having so many problems in winter and be able to generate employment for some very needy family members.

loans.use: to buy personal use items to stock his business..

loans.name: Jose Luis

texts.es:
José Luís, esta casado y tiene tres hijos, vive en la casa de sus suegros ocupando dos habitaciones, la casa reencuentra ubicada en la zona Mariscal Santa Cruz de la ciudad de El Alto.
El estudió solo hasta terminar la secundaria y actualmente trabaja como chofer por más de diez horas al día y hasta altas horas de la noche en un taxi de su propiedad, ya que debe cubrir los gastos de alimentación, pago de servicios básicos y educación de sus hijos.
El crédito lo requiere para el mantenimiento general de su vehículo ya que es la única fuente de ingresos que tiene para mantener a su familia.
El sueño de José Luís, es tener su casa propia para dar más comodidad a su familia y mejorar su calidad de vida.
Es la segunda vez que solicita crédito junto a IMPRO y la primera vez con KIVA.
texts.en:
José Luís is married and has three children.  He lives in his in-laws’ house occupying two bedrooms.  The house is located in the city of El Alto’s Mariscal Santa Cruz zone.  He only completed secondary school and currently works as a driver for more than ten hours daily into the late night hours driving a taxi he owns since he must cover food, utilities and his children’s schooling costs.

He needs the loan to service his vehicle since it’s his sole source of income to support his family.  His dream is to own a house to provide more comfort for his family and improve their quality of life.  This is his second loan request to Impro and first to Kiva.

loans.use: to service his taxi.

loans.name: Sophie

texts.en:
Sophie is married with ten children. Five of her children go to school. She also takes care of additional family members (including her mother). She has a pub and has been in this business for six years. She generates additional income with rental houses. She operates her business in a shop and sells on a retail basis six days out of every week. 

Her major business challenges include rent for her business premises, off and on electricity, and transportation of crates of beer and soda. Sophie aspires to own a fully stocked pub and also to become a wholesaler. She resides in her own house, and the family has access to electricity but not running water. Her monthly expenses include rent for her business premises and paying for utility bills.

loans.use: To buy more crates of beer and soda and boxes of mineral water

loans.name: Norah

texts.es:
Norah, es viuda y tiene dos hijas las cuales ya son independientes, vive en casa propia ocupando solo una habitación, la casa se encuentra ubicada en la zona Sopocachi de la ciudad de La Paz.
Actualmente trabaja como secretaria en una empresa pública por más de ocho horas al día ya que debe cubrir sus gastos de alimentación y pago de servicios básicos.
El crédito lo requiere para la refacción de su baño y cocina ya que tiene mucha humedad y están muy deterioradas. Comprará pinturas y azulejos para dicha refacción.
El sueño de Norah, es construir más habitaciones para poder acoger a sus hijas ya que actualmente vive sola.
Es la segunda vez que solicita crédito junto a IMPRO y la primera con KIVA.
texts.en:
Norah’s a widow and has two daughters who are already independent.  She lives in her own, one-bedroom house located in the city of La Paz’s Sopocachi zone.  She’s currently employed as a secretary in a public firm and works more than 8 hours daily because she must cover her food and basic utility costs.

She needs the loan to redo her bathroom and kitchen because the dampness has damaged them.  She will buy paint and tile for said renewal.  Norah’s dream is to add more bedrooms so that her daughters can move in with her since she currently lives alone.  This is her second IMPRO loan request and first with KIVA.

loans.use: to buy paint, tile and other supplies to redo the bathroom and kitchen at home.

loans.name: Sambo's Group

texts.en:
Sambo is a 46-year-old married man with four children. Two of his children, one daughter and one son, are dependents who are currently in school. Sambo lives in the Battambang province’s Ratanak Mondul district of Cambodia. To earn a living, Sambo plants corn while his wife farms rice in order to supplement the family's income. He has received seven previous VisionFund microloans which have helped him to improve his family’s living conditions.  His main business challenge is the lack of irrigation to supply his corn field. 

Sambo and his fellow group member, who just joined VisionFund as a first-time female borrower, are requesting a 2,100,000 KHR loan. He will use his portion of the loan, 1,400,000 KHR, to cover the cost of plowing his corn field, buying corn seeds and fertilizer, and to cover the cost of labor. In the future, Sambo hopes to expand his business to earn more income.

loans.use: to buy corn seed, fertilizer, and pay for plowing fees

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter is 37 years old and lives in the town of Mbarara, Uganda. He is married and has three children who are all currently in school. For the past five years, Peter has been working hard to manage his depot, which sells beer, sodas, wine and water. 

To help expand his business, Peter has requested a loan of 3,000,000 Ugandan shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more waragi, wine and other drinks to sell. It will also help Peter generate greater profits and earn more money, which will increase the living standards of his family. Peter hopes that in the future he will be able to own a bigger bar. 

Peter is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP). The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Peter who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy more waragi, wine and other drinks to sell

loans.name: Constance

texts.en:
Constance is 30 years old and is married with a child who is currently in school. She  lives in the town of Mbarara, Uganda. For the past three years, Constance has been working hard to manage her retail store where she sells sugar, posho, pads, rice, and sodas. 

Constance is requesting a 3,000,000 UGX loan from BRAC Uganda to help expand her business and buy more soap, Royco, jelly, Vaseline, basins, and sugar. Her loan will help her to generate greater profits and increase the variety of her stock which will increase sales. In the future, Constance hopes that she will be able to own a supermarket. 

Constance is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Constance who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy soap, Royco, jelly, Vaseline, basins, and sugar

loans.name: Hrayr

texts.en: Hrayr lives in the town of Yeghegnadzor in the Vayots Dzor region with his mother Anahit. Hrayr serves as a commander at the Yeghegnadzor military unit. In addition, he helps mother raise two cows. Hrayr wants to expand the farm by purchasing a calf, which is why he has applied for this loan. Hrayr will also purchase forage to feed the cattle. Development of agriculture is important in order for Hrayr to have an independent source of income and ensure a prosperous life for his family.

loans.use: to buy a calf and forage

loans.name: Batool

texts.en: Batool is a 19-year-old university student. She is living with her parents and her younger siblings. Batool is majoring in business administration and is in her third year. She has applied for this loan to pay for her semester fees because she wants to graduate as soon as possible to find a job and help her parents financially.

loans.use: to pay for her semester fees

loans.name: Abeer

texts.en:
Due to cultural reasons, Abeer prefers that her photo not be on the Internet; thus the above photo is of her husband.

Abeer, a 26-year-old who formerly sold clothes and blankets, has three family members from Al Russeifeh, Jordan. She is requesting a loan of 600 JD to pay for improvements she would like to make on her home. In the future she hopes to provide a good environment to live in.

Since Abeer is under 30 years old, her loan is considered a youth loan.

loans.use: to pay for her home improvements.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy basic necessities and to stock up her store.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy raw ingredients used in making snacks.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for maintenance.

loans.name: Mona

texts.en:
Mona is a 46-year-old housewife living with her family of eight members. After her husband retired from the military, she started working in the protection and security business to keep on supporting the family.

Mona has a daughter in her first year at the university; because she wants to support her in her education, Mona is requesting this loan to pay for her registration and semester fees.

loans.use: to pay for her daughter's registration and semester fees.

loans.name: Estrella Janeth

texts.es:
Estrella es una joven trabajadora que durante casi toda su vida ha tenido que laborar para poder tener sus propios ingresos y contribuir económicamente en su hogar con sus padres. Desde hace muchos años está trabajando en la escuela de su municipio, donde antes desempeñaba los cargos de vigilante y luego de aseadora; hace unos meses logró que le dieran la administración de la cafetería de la escuela, por eso comenzó con unos pequeños ahorros que tenía a comprar surtido de gaseosas, dulces, y comidas variadas. Gracias a este negocio ha podido ver como mejoran sus ingresos y la calidad de vida en su hogar, donde convive con su esposo y sus 2 hijos. Como no tiene mucho capital para poder surtir la cafetería, Estrella busca un préstamo para comprar insumos para el negocio y así surtir su cafetería con productos que se le han ido agotando.

Su sueño siempre ha sido llegar a tener un salón de belleza, por eso espera que con esta cafetería pueda tener un dinero para terminar sus estudios de corte y cepillado del cabello y el capital suficiente para montar su soñado salón de belleza.
texts.en:
Estrella is a young worker who during most of her life has had to work in order to have her own income and to contribute economically toward the household costs of her parents' home.  For many years she has been working in the school in her city, where first she worked as a security guard and later as a cleaner.  After many months, she was named the director of the cafeteria in the school, and this is how she began to buy an assortment of soft drinks, sweets, and various foods with the small amount of savings that she had.  Thanks to this business, she has been able to see how to better her earnings and the quality of life in her home, where she lives with her husband and 2 children.  Because she doesn't have much capital to supply the cafeteria, Estrella seeks this loan to buy supplies for the business and to restock the cafeteria with products that have sold out.

Her dream has always been to eventually own a beauty salon.  She hopes that with this cafeteria she can earn the money to finish her studies of cutting and fixing hair and have sufficient capital to establish her dream beauty salon.

loans.use: to buy supplies for her business in order to restock her cafeteria products

loans.name: Ediver De Jesus

texts.es:
Ediver es un joven muy trabajador y emprendedor que aprendió la actividad de la venta de legumbres por parte de su padre quien siempre se dedicó a esta actividad. El hecho de estar desde muy pequeño trabajando en esta actividad le permitió adquirir mucha experiencia y así abrió su primer negocio en la plaza de mercado de su municipio; pero por motivos adversos su negocio se quebró y tuvo que cerrar. Ahora viene con más fuerzas, con más motivación y espera reiniciar el negocio de la venta de legumbres de la mejor manera, por esto ha ido comprando surtido poco a poco y también adecuando el local. Como no cuenta con mucho capital y ya casi todo lo ha gastado realizando las adecuaciones necesarias para su negocio, Ediver busca un préstamo para comprar verduras y frutas y reiniciar su negocio.

Ediver espera volver a recibir ingresos de este negocio y continuar progresando junto a su familia.
texts.en:
Ediver is a young man who is entrepreneurial and a very hard worker. He learned the business of selling vegetables through his father who also made a living in this business. The fact that he has been working in this business since he was very little has allowed him to acquire a lot of experience. That is how he opened his first business in the market plaza of his community. 

However, due to adverse circumstances, his business failed and he had to close it down. Now he is back having gathered more strength, more motivation, and the hope of restarting his business selling vegetables in a much better way. To do this he has been purchasing stock little by little as well as acquiring a storefront. As he does not have a lot of capital and he has spent almost everything making necessary repairs to his business. 

Ediver is requesting a loan to buy fruits and vegetables, and restart his business. Ediver hopes to make and income from his business again and continue progressing together with his family.

loans.use: to buy fruits and vegetables, and to restart his business.

loans.name: Consuelo

texts.es: La socia es la señora Consuelo, ella continúa con su actividad de venta de ropa y zapatos por catalogo para damas caballeros y niños. Consuelo trabaja duro para poder ahorrar y comprar un terreno para construir una casa. Consuelo está solicitando el préstamo para comprar mercadería como zapatos y ropa para la próxima campaña navideña, y por ello está muy agradecida con la ayuda de KIVA, por ayudarla a mantener  su actividad económica la cual le permite ahorrar para cumplir con su objetivo que es la de comprar un terreno. La socia pertenece al banco comunal “GRAN RENOVACION”; de la ciudad del Cusco – Perú.
texts.en: Señora Consuelo continues with her business of selling clothing and shoes by catalog for women, men, and children.  She works hard to be able to save to buy land to build a house.  She is requesting a loan to buy merchandise like shoes and clothing for the Christmas season.  She is very thankful to Kiva for helping her sustain her business, which lets her save to meet her goal, which is to buy a piece of land.  She belongs to the communal bank, "Gran Renovación," in the city of Cusco, Peru.

loans.use: to buy shoes and clothing.

loans.name: Sonia Teresita

texts.es:
Sonia tiene un taller de confección desde hace mucho tiempo en su hogar con el que ha ayudado económicamente a sacar adelante a su familia que está compuesta por su esposo y sus 2 hijos de 6 y 7 años de edad. Gracias a que tiene muy buena calidad en su producción, adicional a prestar el servicio de confección a terceros también tiene su propia confección de ropa la cual vende en su casa, y de esta manera puede tener un poco de mejores ingresos para su hogar. La gran dificultad que ha padecido es el costo de la educación de sus 2 hijos, y es por esto que en el momento está atravesando una gran dificultad económica. Para superarla, Sonia busca un préstamo para comprar insumos para la confección  como telas e hilos y responder a unos pedidos que tiene de sus clientes.

Su sueño es poder hacer crecer su taller y mejorar los ingresos familiares.
texts.en:
Sonia has a tailoring workshop since a long time ago at her home, with which she helped to get her family ahead financially. Her family is composed of her husband and her two children of six and seven years old. Because she offers very good quality in her production, in addition to provide service to others, she is also tailoring clothes to sell at her home. Doing so, she can have a little more income for her household.

The great difficulty she has had is the cost of education for her two children, and that is why at the moment she is undergoing a big hardship. To overcome it, Sonia is requesting a loan to buy supplies for tailoring such as fabric and linen, so she can meet some orders she has from her customers. Her dream is to grow her workshop and to increase her family income.

loans.use: to buy supplies for tailoring such as fabric and linen and to meet some orders she has from her customers.

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es:
Rosa, de 34 años, es una mujer amable, buena y muy responsable, es madre soltera de un niño de 9 años de edad, habita su casa propia a lado de su menor hijo quien depende de ella para su educación y alimentación. Rosa tiene como trabajo el de brindar servicio de costura, tiene su taller instalado en su casa. Confecciona prendas de vestir inspiradas y creadas por ella misma. Acuden a su taller a diario todos sus clientes en busca de que algunas de las prendas que tienen en mal estado obtengan alguna solución y sean refaccionadas. Además, confecciona prendas a pedido del cliente según su preferencia y elección del diseño. Posee dos máquinas de coser y una remalladora, la segunda máquina y la remalladora se pudo comprar trabajando con la institución. Lleva 11 años en este trabajo, cuando no hay mucha demanda trabaja sola y cuando necesita que le ayuden se ve obligada a contratar a dos personas más que desarrollan la misma actividad saben del trabajo y son buenos en la costura. A Rosa siempre le gustó la costura y ama su trabajo, le agrada elaborar sus propias creaciones y desarrollar su creatividad, cuando no tiene clientes que atender o prendas que refaccionar sale a vender las prendas que ha confeccionado, espera mas adelante poner un taller de costura implementado y empezar a magnificar su trabajo para convertirse en proveedora de una tienda grande de la ciudad. Este es el crédito número 10 con MFP, por ello se siente agradecida con las personas que le brindan el financiamiento que necesita para que pueda concretar sus planes, por otro lado se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas de manera puntual y espera continuar trabajando con su banco comunal por el compañerismo y la solidaridad que muestran entre ellos cada uno de sus integrantes.
Con el monto solicitado 1200 soles, comprará materiales para continuar con su trabajo como botones, blondas, hilos de diferentes colores, elásticos y telas.
texts.en:
Rosa, 34, is a kind, good, very responsible woman.  She’s a single mother of a nine-year-old boy.  She lives in her own house with her minor son who depends on her for his education and his food.  

Rosa’s work is providing dressmaking services.  She has a shop installed at home.  She makes articles of clothing inspired and created by herself.  Customers come by her shop daily seeking solutions to clothes that might be in need of repair.   She also makes clothes to order for customers according to their taste and design choices.  She has two sewing machines and a darning machine.  She was able to buy the second sewing machine and the darner by working with the institution.  She’s been in business 11 years.  

When demand is low she works alone and when she needs help she’s obliged to hire two people who do the same kind of work and are good at sewing.  Rosa has always liked sewing and she loves her work.  It pleases her to make her own creations and develop her creativity.  When she has no customers to tend to or clothes to repair she goes out to sell the items she’s made.  She hopes later on to set up a well-equipped sewing workshop and start to expand her work in order to become a supplier to a large store in the city.

This is her 10th MFP loan and she feels grateful to the people who provide the financing she needs to realize her plans.  On the other hand, she commits to make her installment payments punctually and hopes to continue working with her communal bank because of the fellowship and mutual support they have among each and every one of the members.  She will use the requested 1,200 soles to buy materials like buttons, lace trim, thread in assorted colors, elastic and fabric to continue with her work.

loans.use: to buy buttons, lace trim, thread in assorted colors, elastic and fabric.

loans.name: Rukhsana

texts.en:
Ms. Rukhsana is a 41-year-old married woman. Her husband’s income is insufficient to cover everyday expenditures, so she is making a great effort to support her family. For five years, she has had a business of home appliance sales. She buys a large variety of products from the market at lower rates and sells them in her community. For the improvement of her business she needs to purchase new machines such as grinders, juicers, etc. to increase her sales. 

She contacted the Kashf Foundation business development officer for a loan of PKR 30,000. She has gradually improved her business through the support of the Kashf Foundation. She hopes to earn more income and she desires to utilize the earned revenue on the betterment of her family.

loans.use: to purchase new machines such as grinders, juicers, etc.

loans.name: Sergio Andres

texts.es:
Sergio genera los ingresos que necesita en su hogar con un negocio de venta de comidas rápidas y asados que ubica al frente de su casa. El negocio lo inició hace varios años y en este ofrece carnes asadas, chorizos y otras comidas rápidas a sus clientes, y gracias a la buena calidad de sus productos ha podido salir adelante con este negocio. Su esposa y sus 2 hijos de 6 y 8 años, ahora pueden tener una mejor calidad de vida, pues anteriormente la situación económica estaba muy deteriorada y pasaban por muchas dificultades. Ahora que ya ha podido ir consolidando su negocio, Sergio busca un préstamo para adecuar el techo del lugar donde pone su puesto de comidas y así mejorar la atención a sus clientes.

Su sueño es poder ampliar este negocio y que le genere mayores ingresos para su hogar, para así poder ofrecer una mejor calidad de vida y mayores oportunidades económicas a su familia.
texts.en:
Sergio generates the income his household needs through a fast food sales business located at front of his house. He started the business a number of years ago and sells BBQ meat, chorizos and other fast food to his customers. Thanks to the good quality of his foods he has been able to get ahead with this business. His wife and 2 children of 6 and 8 years can now have a better quality of life. 

Previously they had a very bad financial situation and were passing through a difficult period. Now that he has been able to consolidate his business, Sergio is asking for a loan to fix the roof of the place where he sets up his food stall, in order to provide his customers with a better service. 

His dream is to be able to expand his business to generate more income so that he can offer his family a better quality of life and better financial circumstances.

loans.use: to fix the roof of his food stall, in order to provide his customers with a better service.

loans.name: Edgar De Jesus

texts.es:
Edgar anteriormente trabajaba en la actividad de la construcción, pero buscando tener un trabajo con mejores condiciones laborales decidió ahorrar y desde hace 3 años logró montar una tienda general desde su casa en la cual ofrece productos de la canasta familiar. Pese a que sus ingresos no han aumentado y su esposa y sus 3 hijos aún no pueden tener una mejor calidad de vida, las condiciones laborales de Edgar si han mejorado notablemente y espera que eso se empiece a ver reflejado en mejores ingresos para el hogar. Es por esto que Edgar busca un préstamo para comprar productos de la canasta familiar y así mejorar sus ventas aumentando la variedad de productos que ofrece a sus clientes.

Su meta es tener una tienda grande donde pueda proveer a sus clientes de todos los productos que necesiten, y también mejorar sus ingresos y generar empleo para unos familiares muy necesitados.
texts.en:
Edgar previously worked in construction, but while searching to have a job with better working conditions he decided to save and three years ago he managed to set up a general store in his house in which he offers basic household necessities.  Despite the fact that his income had not grown and his wife and three children were still not able to have a better quality of life, Edgar's working conditions have improved notably and he hopes that he will begin to see this reflected in a better income for the home.  This is why Edgar asks for a loan in order to buy basic household necessities and thus improve his sales by increasing the variety of products that he offers his customers.

His goal is to have a large store where he can provide his customers with all of the products that they need, and to also improve his income and generate employment for a few relatives in great need.

loans.use: to buy basic household necessities and thus improve his sales by increasing the variety of products that he offers his customers.

loans.name: Gladys Estella

texts.es:
Gladys ha tenido conocimiento de la actividad de la crianza y engorde de pollos gracias a que sus padres se la enseñaron y anteriormente tenía un corral de pollos en su casa para el consumo de solamente su familia. Como los vecinos comenzaron a pedirle que les vendieran de los pollos, Gladys comenzó así a trabajar la actividad ya con un enfoque más comercial y así comenzó con su negocio. Como no cuenta con mucho capital ha sido muy difícil poder ofrecer a sus clientes más pollos, y es por esto que ahora Gladys busca un préstamo para comprar pollos, el cuido para alimentarlos y también realizar algunas adecuaciones al corral para que quepan más pollos.

Así podrá hacer frente a los pedidos de sus clientes y su negocio comenzará a vender más. Su sueño es sacar adelante este negocio y poder generar bastantes ingresos con los cuales contribuya económicamente junto con su esposo para darles una mejor calidad de vida a sus 3 hijos.
texts.en:
Gladys gained the knowledge of raising and fattening chickens thanks to her parents, who taught her and had a chicken corral at their house for the sole consumption of their family.  Since the neighbors began to ask her if they could sell her chickens, Gladys began to work at the activity with more of a commercial focus and started her business.  Because she did not have much capital, it has been very difficult to offer her customers more chickens, and for this reason Gladys is now seeking a loan to buy chickens, chicken feed, and also to make some improvements to the corral so that it can hold more chickens.

In this way she will be able to fill the order of her customers, and her business will begin to increase sales.  Her dream is to get ahead in this business and to generate enough income, which she will contribute economically together with her spouse, to give their 3 children a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy chickens and chicken feed, as well as make improvements to the chicken corral so that it can hold more chickens

loans.name: Henoc De Jesus

texts.es:
Henoc comenzó hace más o menos 10 años con la actividad de la venta de animales la cual aprendió empíricamente y es con la que ha logrado sacar adelante a su familia. En un principio contaba con muy pequeños ahorros y por eso compró una res muy pequeña, pero poco a poco fue sacando el negocio adelante y ahora puede tener mejores ingresos. Como tiene 2 clientes que le están haciendo un pedido, pero no tiene el capital suficiente, Henoc busca un préstamo para comprar 2 caballos y responder a los pedidos de sus clientes.

Henoc espera seguir mejorando el negocio poco a poco y seguir ofreciendo en su hogar una mejor calidad de vida. Su sueño es que los ingresos que recibe le permitan terminar de construir su casa que la tiene en obra negra, y así ofrecer a su esposa y sus hijos un buen hogar.
texts.en: Approximately ten years ago, Henoc began his business selling animals, which he learned empirically.  This is how he has been able to take care of his family.  In the beginning, he could save very little, and this is why he bought a very small cow.  But little by little, he got ahead with his business, and now he has better income.  He has two customers that have given him orders, but he doesn't have enough capital.  Henoc is looking for a loan to buy two horses to respond to his customers' orders.  He hopes to keep improving his business little by little and to keep offering a better quality of life in his home.  His dream is that the income he receives lets him finish building his house, which is under construction, so he can offer his wife and children a good home.

loans.use: to buy two horses to respond to his customers' orders.

loans.name: Sophorn's Group

texts.en:
Sophorn is a 41-year-old mother of five children. She and her entire family are living in a rural area of Sa Ang district, Kandal Province. She and her husband make a living via rice cropping, which they have been doing for several years. 

Including this cycle, Sophorn is a fourth-cycle micro-loan borrower through Kiva's partner, VisionFund. In a smart manner, she has paid back entirely all of her previous loans and it has enabled her to keep up good progress for her business and to maintain her family income. Now Sophorn has formed a group of three to seek a new loan. The three of them are each seeking the same loan amount, KHR 500,000.

As the group leader, Sophorn plans to use her portion to buy materials to build a decent above-the-ground latrine for her household. She hopes that this latrine will help promote good hygienic practices and protection for her family.

loans.use: To build a decent above-ground latrine for her household.

loans.name: Jalia

texts.es: Jalia, es una mujer de 44 años, es amable, solidaria, alegre y muy trabajadora, es soltera pero tiene 3 hijos y vive en su casa propia únicamente con la menor de ellos junto a su yerno y su nieto. Jalia, tiene como principal actividad la venta de abarrotes, ha destinado un pequeño espacio en su vivienda en donde ofrece a la venta los principales productos de primera necesidad como arroz, azúcar, aceites, huevos, leche, pan, té y otros. De manera frecuente acude al mercado a comprar los productos que pone a la venta gastando entre 250 a 300 soles. En esta actividad trabaja sola y atiende durante todo el día. Lleva en este negocio más de 6 años y afortunadamente desde que empezó no ha sufrido pérdidas económicas considerables. Asimismo, en temporadas de invierno vende pollos, ya que en esta época del año el precio de venta de este producto aumenta y eso la favorece. Lo que le gusta de su actividad es que le permite tener un ingreso económico que le ayuda a afrontar con los gastos básicos de su hogar, además puede manejar su economía de manera organizada y orientada a su futuro, espera más adelante establecer una tienda mas grande y complementarla con nuevos productos. Este es el préstamo número 12 con MFP, está muy agradecida por la oportunidad crediticia que le brindan y por el respaldo financiero que necesita para seguir adelante. Se compromete a pagar sus cuotas mensuales de manera puntual y continuar trabajando con mucha responsabilidad junto a los miembros de su banco comunal. Con el monto solicitado de 500 nuevos soles, comprará mayor cantidad de abarrotes como arroz, azúcar y huevos que son los que tienen mayor demanda entre sus clientes.
texts.en:
Jalia is a pleasant, supportive, happy, and very hardworking 44-year-old woman.  She's single but has three children and lives in her own house with only her youngest, her son-in-law, and her grandson.

Jalia's main work is selling groceries.  She has set aside a small space in her house where she sells the main staple items, such as rice, sugar, oil, eggs, milk, bread, tea, and other things.  She goes to the market frequently to buy the products she sells, spending 250-300 soles [PEN].  

She works alone all day in this job.  She has been in this business for more than six years and fortunately hasn't suffered any significant economic losses since she started.  In the winter she also sells chickens because at that time of year the selling price for this product goes up and this is favorable for her.

What she likes about her job is that it allows her to have an income, which helps her meet the basic household expenses.  She also can manage her finances in an organized way while looking toward the future.  She hopes to set up another, bigger store with new products in the future.

This is her twelfth loan with MFP.  She's very grateful for her opportunity for credit and for the financial support she needs to move forward.  She pledges to make her monthly payments punctually and to continue working responsibly along with the members of her communal bank.

With the requested loan of 500 nuevos soles [PEN] she'll buy large quantities of groceries such as rice, sugar, and eggs, which are what her customers most want.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, and eggs

loans.name: Tenneh

texts.en:
Tenneh is a 40-year-old married woman from West Point. Her husband is a farmer and they have five children aged 12 to 23 years old. 

For the past sixteen years she has been selling charcoal. Tenneh received a little amount from her husband to help start her business. She learned how to run the business from her mother and she likes it because she makes more profit. 

Tenneh is requesting a loan to purchase more charcoal by the bag to sell. Her plan is to build a house for her children with the income.

loans.use: to purchase more charcoal by the bag to sell.

loans.name: Aisha

texts.en:
Aisha is 48 years old and lives in the town of Ntungamo, Uganda. She is single and has 3 children - 2 of them are currently in school. For the past 15 years, Aisha has been working hard to manage her clothes and garment shop, which sells blankets, bedcovers, and towels. 

To help expand her business, Aisha has requested a loan of 2,500,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more items like towels, bedcovers, sweaters, and blankets and will help Aisha to generate greater profits and increase the family's income and standard of living. Aisha hopes that in the future she will be able to keep growing the business. 

Aisha is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Aisha who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy more items like towels, bedcovers, sweaters, and blankets.

loans.name: Saodat

texts.ru: Трудное условие жизни заставляет человека направлять все свои усилия и мотивировать существующие ресурсы.  Саодат  является одним из таких личностей, которая старается улучшить условия жизни и стимулировать экономическое состояние семьи. Она разведена и на воспитании имеет 2 детей. Ее муж женился на другой женщине, и уехал в Российскую Федерацию. Раньше она пекла пирожки, а ее дети продавали на базаре, но она получала мало дохода от этого бизнеса и Саодат научилась шить национальные одеяло (курпача). Саодат обучилась в курсе «Добейся успеха» организованный Ассоциация Деловых Женщин и получила сертификат. Теперь она вполне может организовать свой бизнес и стать успешной в этой сфере. Она хочет организовать бизнес шитьем и продажей национального одеяла. От полученного дохода она планирует обеспечить своих детей с хорошим образованием и высококалорийными продуктами питания. Она запрашивает кредит на сумму  1000 сомони для покупки ткани для шитья национального одеяла, чтобы организовать новый бизнес. Она ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en: Difficult life circumstances force people to gather all their strength and galvanize their existing resources. Saodat is one such person who is trying to improve her living standard and jump-start the economic situation of her family. She is divorced and has two children at home. Her husband is now re-married to another woman and has left to live in the Russian Federation. Saodat used to bake pies which her children sold at the bazaar, but her income from this business was small so she learned how to sew "kurpacha," or traditional national blankets. She also took a course entitled "To Get Ahead" that was organized by the Association of Businesswomen, and for which she earned a certificate. Now Saodat is fully capable of organizing her own business and becoming successful at it. She wants to set up a business sewing and selling national blankets. Saodat plans to use the income she earns to provide her children with a good educational and nutritional food. She is seeking a loan in the amount of 1,000 Tajikistan Somoni to buy material for the blankets so she can start her business. Saodat is waiting for your kind assistance.

loans.use: To buy material to sew traditional national blankets to sell

loans.name: Hrahat

texts.en:
Hrahat lives in Vayk town, Vayots Dzor region, with his wife and daughter. Hrahat is the only breadwinner in the family, and the low salary he gets working for the Vayk watering service is not enough to make ends meet. 

About 4 years ago Hrahat started breeding cattle, and now he keeps cows and hens along with ten colonies of bees. Hrahat would like to develop his farm, for which he needs sufficient funds. With the requested loan he plans to purchase one more cow and forage to feed the cattle. 

It is important for Hrahat to keep gathering a stable income from the sales of agricultural products, so he can sustain his family.

loans.use: to pay for a cow and forage.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose is 46 years old, married to Stephen. They are blessed with four children, aged 22, 20, 15 and 10 years, respectively. Rose sells onions and tomatoes, a business she started ten years ago, and earns a monthly income of KES35,000. 

Rose is borrowing a second loan of KES30,000 to purchase more tomatoes and onions for sale. 

With the anticipated profit, she plans to purchase additional stock. Her hope and dream is to own a large green grocery store.

loans.use: To purchase onions and tomatoes for sale.

loans.name: Zaruhi

texts.en:
Zaruhi lives in Yerevan town with her husabnd, son, and daughter. Zaruhi runs a little booth where she trades women's clothing. She started this business 7 months ago. Now she needs some investments to increase the clothing variety in her booth. 

Thus, she has applied for this loan to purchase women's clothing. A larger stock with more variety will help Zaruhi to be competitive in the market and increase sales. Increased business income will help Zaruhi not only to continue investing in the business, but to also cover her family's costs.

loans.use: to pay for women's clothing.

loans.name: Soken's Group

texts.en:
A citizen from a rural village of the Sa Ang district of Kandal province, Soken is 30 years old. She lives with her husband and two children - both are still in school. 

The main source of the family’s income is from selling bread. Having been in this business for 5 years, she can earn about KHR 10,000 per day to support the family. 

Soken is requesting her first loan with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund. Now, she and her group members are requesting a loan with VisionFund of KHR 500,000 each. As the leader, she is going to use her portion to construct a decent latrine. She hopes this loan will help her family to have a healthy latrine so as to improve their hygienic standard of living.

loans.use: to construct a decent latrine.

loans.name: Fatima

texts.en:
Due to cultural reasons Fatima prefers that her photo is not on the Internet; thus the above photo is of her husband. 

Fatima is a 45-year-old married woman who has 5 family members. She is from Al Russwifeh, Jordan. In the past, she sold clothes. 

Fatima is requesting a loan of 500 JD to pay for improvements to her home. She wants to buy new electronics. In the future, she would like to improve her family's standard of living.

loans.use: to pay for improvements to her home.

loans.name: Rubi Magly

texts.es: La socia es la señora Rubí, ella continúa con su actividad de agente de turismo en su agencia minorista en donde ofrece paquetes para turismo tradicional. Rubí trabaja duro para ahorrar y acreditar su agencia, también está incursionando en el alquiler y venta de bicicletas de montaña para la actividad turística del Cross country. Rubí está solicitando el préstamo para comprar accesorios de ciclismo como trajes y accesorios, y por ello está muy agradecida con la ayuda de KIVA, por ayudarla a fortalecer y hacer crecer su actividad económica, la cual le permite proporcionar una mejor educación a sus hijos. La socia pertenece al banco comunal “GRAN RENOVACION”; de la ciudad del Cusco – Perú.
texts.en:
Rubi belongs to the GRAN RENOVACION community bank in the city of Cusco, Perú.  She is continuing her activities as an tourist agent in her retail agency where she offers packages for traditional tourism.  Rubi works hard to save money and to accredit her agency.  She is also entering into the rental and sale of mountain bicycles for the tourist activity of cross country cycling.  

Rubi is asking for this loan to buy cycling gear like clothing and accessories.  She is very thankful for the help of Kiva, which helps her to build and grow her economic activity, which in turn permits her to afford a better education for her children.

loans.use: to buy cycling clothes and accessories

loans.name: Pilar

texts.es:
La socia es la señora Pilar, ella tiene  52 años de edad, está casada y tiene 2 hijos adultos, ella trabaja en el área de limpieza en un hotel, actividad que viene realizando hace muchos años y con la cual sacó profesionales a sus hijos.
Pilar es una persona muy trabajadora y emprendedora, la socia está construyendo su casa y es para darle los acabados que está solicitando el préstamo, ella comprará pisos cerámicos y pintura.  Pilar está muy agradecida con la ayuda de KIVA, por ayudarla construir su casa. La socia pertenece al banco comunal “GRAN RENOVACION”; de la ciudad del Cusco – Perú.
texts.en:
This communal bank member is Señora Pilar. She is 52 years old. She is married and has two adult children. She works in the cleaning department of a hotel, a job that she has been doing for many years and with which she raised her children to have careers.

Pilar is a very hard-working and entrepreneurial person. She is building her house, and it is to give it the finishing touches that she is applying for the loan. She will buy ceramic floor tile and paint. Pilar is very grateful for the help of Kiva for helping her to construct her house. She belongs to the communal bank "Gran Renovacion" in the city of Cusco, Peru.

loans.use: to buy ceramic floor tile and paint.

loans.name: Chhoun's Group

texts.en:
Chhoun is 42 years old and married with five children. Two of her children are dependent on her, one of whom is still in school while the remaining one works in a garment factory. To make a living, Chhoun has been catching fish for 21 years. She is able to earn about 30,000 KHR a day and manages to save about 10,000 KHR each day after daily expenses. 

Chhoun’s group consists of two members who live in the same village of the Sa Ang district of Kandal province, Cambodia. Chhoun is with VisionFund just this cycle. Chhoun is leading her group to ask for a loan of 500,000 KHR each. She will use this loan to buy materials such as a latrine pan and tiles to construct a decent latrine. She hopes this loan will help her family to have a healthy latrine so as to improve their hygienic standard of living.

loans.use: to buy materials such as a latrine pan and tiles to construct a decent latrine

loans.name: Rosabel

texts.es:
Rosabel, de 46 años es una mujer dulce. Vive en compañía de su hijo menor Jhojan al que cuida en su casa propia. Se siente orgullosa, pues es una mujer como pocas. Cuidó de sus 4 hijos sola, ahora se encuentra delicada de salud, pues tuvo un accidente que lastimó su rodilla por lo que tiene una molestia al caminar. Su principal actividad económica es la venta de productos de primera necesidad en un espacio que acondicionó en su casa, su tienda es muy surtida, cuenta con dulces, carne y bebidas de toda variedad. Pero como es una mujer del campo, continua sembrando papa, habas, cereales en sus terrenos propios, los cuales cuida con mucho esmero, aunque ya no pueda limpiar por ella misma sus sembríos producto de la lesión en la rodilla. Más se siente feliz de cuidar a sus animales como cerdos, cuyes y gallinas que vende cuando ya están maduras. “Estar en el campo es mi mayor pasatiempo y medicina”, afirma. Ella pertenece al banco comunal “mujeres luchadoras” y este es el cuarto crédito con MFP, se siente agradecido con el apoyo que encontró en su asociación pues le permite mejorar el capital de trabajo de su negocio. Por esa razón promete ser puntual en el pago de sus cuotas.
Rosabel; invertirá el dinero solicitado en la compra de arroz, azúcar y demás verduras para aumentar su tienda de comestibles.
texts.en:
Rosabel, 46, is a sweet woman.  She lives in the company of her youngest son, Jhojan, who she cares for in her own home.  She is proud because she is a woman like no other.  She cared for her four children on her own.  Now she is in a delicate state of health because she had an accident that injured her knee in such a way that it bothers her when she walks.  Her main way of earning a living is selling basic goods in an air-conditioned space in her house.  Her store is well stocked; she has sweets, meat, and drinks of every variety.  But since she is a country woman she continues to plant potatoes, beans, and grains on her own land, which she tends to with much care although she still cannot clean the crop products on her own due to the lesion in her knee.  She is also happy to care for her animals like pigs, guinea pigs, and chickens, which she sells when they are mature.  "To be in the fields is my greatest pastime and medicine," she says.  

She belongs to the communal bank "Mujeres Luchadoras" and this is her fourth loan with MFP.  She is grateful for the support that she has found in her association since it has allowed her to improve the working capital of her business.  For this reason, she promises to be on time with her repayments.

Rosabel will use the requested money to buy rice, sugar, and other vegetables in order to augment her grocery store.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, and other vegetables in order to supply her store.

loans.name: Mamie

texts.en: Mamie lives in West Point and is 46 years old. She is married and has four children between the ages of 17 and 28 years. Two of her children live at home and attend school. Since 2009, she has been running a cook shop (restaurant). One problem she faces is the rainy season because she doesn’t have a good location. She enjoys the interaction with her customers and the profit she makes. Having food in her home makes her proud of her business. She is requesting a loan to purchase more rice, fish, pepper, palm oil, and other items for her business. Mamie's dream is to have a house for her children.

loans.use: to purchase more rice, fish, pepper, palm oil, and other items for her restaurant

loans.name: Islam

texts.en: Islam, a 19-year-old single lady, is a university student majoring in child care studies. She is in her second year. She has five siblings that are living together with their parents. Now Islam has applied for this loan to be able to pay for her semester fees.

loans.use: to pay for her semester fees.

loans.name: Vorn's Group

texts.en:
Aged 45 years, Vorn is a married mother of seven children. Three of her children are dependent on her and still in school. Her family lives in a rural area of the Sa Ang district of the Kandal province in Cambodia. She has earned a living through farming rice for 22 years. The current business earns her about 15,000 KHR per day, and she manages to save about 10,000 KHR each day after daily expenses. 

Vorn is a first-cycle client, while her group is a second-cycle client with VisionFund. Vorn is now leading her group of two to ask for a loan. She will use her portion to build a proper latrine for her family to use. She hopes this loan will enable her family to have a clean latrine for daily use, improving their healthy standard of living.

loans.use: to build a proper latrine for her family to use

loans.name: Saira

texts.en: Ms. Saira is a 27-year-old unmarried woman. She has been doing a tailoring business with her father for many years. She earns enough to provide her siblings with good food and clothing. She serves well in her community. She is in her first loan cycle with Kashf Foundation. For the improvement of the business, she needs to purchase a new sewing machine and reels of thread to meet up with customers' demands time after time. So she requested a loan of 20,000 Pakistani rupees. She is hoping to earn more profits and wishes to utilize them on her siblings’ education.

loans.use: to buy a new sewing machine and reels of thread.

loans.name: Nilda

texts.es: La socia es la señora Nilda, ella continúa con su actividad de venta de productos de belleza como cosméticos y perfumería por catálogo, pero ahora también aprovecha su clientela para vender también zapatos y ropa. Nilda trabaja duro para mantener a su clientela, innovando siempre con nuevos productos, por ello la socia está solicitando el préstamo para comprar mercadería como perfumería, cosméticos, zapatos y ropa para la próxima campaña navideña y por ello está muy agradecida con la ayuda de KIVA, por ayudarla a fortalecer y hacer crecer su actividad económica. La socia pertenece al banco comunal “GRAN RENOVACION”; de la ciudad del Cusco – Perú.
texts.en: The member is Señora Nilda; she continues with her job of selling beauty products like cosmetics and perfumes through a catalog, but now she also takes advantage of her customers by also selling shoes and clothing.  Nilda works hard in order to maintain her customers, always innovating with new products, and for this reason she is requesting a loan to buy merchandise like perfume, cosmetics, shoes, and clothing for the next Christmas season.  This is why she is very grateful for the help from Kiva, for helping her to strengthen and grow her business.  The member belongs to the communal bank "Gran Renovacion" (Great Renovation) from the city of Cusco, Perú.

loans.use: to buy perfume, cosmetics, shoes, and clothing.

loans.name: Yeny

texts.es:
Yeny, de 33 años es una mujer sabia. Pues cuida sola de sus 3 hijos: Joselin, Kely y Luis en casa de su papá, donde vive desde que nació. Su actividad económica se centra en el campo. La ganadería y agricultura, son sus herramientas para salir adelante, la siembra de papa y habas es su principal cultivo. Ello lo realiza en terrenos que le heredó sus padres, donde todas las mañanas sale a fertilizar, limpiar y regar; a la espera de la cosecha, ya que es donde obtiene el pago de tantos meses de esfuerzo y sacrificio, pero como es una mujer sabia, también cría animales como cerdos y gallinas las que engorda y vende para mantener la estabilidad de su hogar durante todos los meses de maduración de los alimentos, donde no tiene ingreso económico. Ahora ella desea ahorrar y abrir el negocio de compra y venta de granos verdes y de esa manera obtener un ingreso extra a su hogar. Ella pertenece al banco comunal “mujeres luchadoras” y este es el segundo crédito con MFP, se siente agradecido con el apoyo que encontró en su asociación pues le permite mejorar el capital de trabajo de su negocio. Por esa razón promete ser puntual en el pago de sus cuotas.
Yeny; invertirá el dinero solicitado en la compra de fertilizantes naturales para esparcir entre sus sembríos y si el dinero le alcanza en la compra de más animales.
texts.en: Yeny, who is 33 years old, is a wise woman. She alone cares for her three children, Joselin, Kely, and Luis, in the house of her father,, where she has lived since she was born. Her economic activity is centered on the land. Raising livestock and agriculture are her tools to advance. She plants potatoes and beans as her principal crops. She does this on land that she inherited from her parents, where every morning she goes out to fertilize, clean, and irrigate, looking forward to the harvest, since this is when she receives the payment for so many months of effort and sacrifice. But since she is a wise woman, she also raises animals such as pigs and chickens, which she fattens and sells to maintain the stability of her household during the months when the food crops are maturing, when she doesn't have income. Now she wants to save and open a business of buying and selling unroasted coffee beans and in this way obtain extra income for her household. She belongs to the communal bank "Mujeres Luchadora" (Striving Women), and this is her second loan with MFP. She feels thankful for the support that she has found in her association, since it allows her to improve the working capital of her business. For this reason, she promises to be punctual in making her payments. Yeny will invest the money she has applied for in the purchase of natural fertilizers to sprinkle among her plantings and, if there is enough money, in the purchase of more animals.

loans.use: to buy natural fertilizers and animals

loans.name: Mert's Group

texts.en:
Mert is aged 54 and married with four children. Two of her children are dependent on her and help with the family’s business. Mert resides in a rural area of the Ratanak Mondul district of Battambang province in Cambodia and makes a living by growing corn on a three-hectare area of farmland. Having been in this business for eight years, she is able to earn about 20,000 KHR per day and save about 10,000 KHR each day after offsetting daily expenses. Drought is the main challenge for her corn business.

Mert has been with VisionFund for one cycle and completely paid back the past loan. The other group members are first-cycle clients with VisionFund. Mert's first loan has helped her to relieve her family’s burden and improve their livelihood. She is now leading her group of three to ask for a loan. Mert will use her portion to buy seeds, fertilizer and pesticides for her corn plantation and also use a portion of it to spend on labor costs. She hopes this loan will enable her crop yield to become more profitable so she can sell it for a good price and also fulfill her dream to expand her current business.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizer and pesticides for her corn plantation

loans.name: Lilibett Patricia

texts.es: Lilibett, se dedica a la administración de su movilidad (Micro Bus Línea Urbana 6), cuenta que le gusta de FINCA la facilidad con la que recibe sus préstamos y la ayuda que le brindan, afirma que le gustan mucho las charlas que ofrecen las promotoras porque les enseñan hacer puntuales y sobre todo responsables. Llevara un préstamo que lo invertirá en hacer el mantenimiento a su carro.
texts.en:
Lilibett drives a micro-bus that she owns along Urban Line #6. She tells us that what she likes most about FINCA is the ease with which she receives her loans and the help that this provides. Lilibeth affirms that she very much enjoys the talks the promoters offer, because they teach how important it is to be punctual and, above all, responsible.

She will invest this loan in maintenance on her vehicle [and insectisides for her farm].

loans.use: buy a tire for her van and insecticides for her farm.

loans.name: San Rafael Group

texts.es:
El comité “SAN RAFAEL” se encuentra en el Duodécimo ciclo del programa de Mujeres de la Fundación Paraguaya, tiene 20 integrantes y todas ellas se unieron con la idea de ayudar a sus familias y de esa forma salir adelante, y gracias a su trabajo lo están logrando.
Juana, la presidenta se dedica a la venta de frutas, ella cuenta que su grupo le ha ayudado mucho a salir adelante y que por medio del apoyo de sus compañeras ha mejorado mucho. Juliana es una persona que tiene mucho entusiasmo y que desea seguir creciendo y ayudando a los suyos.
Ella solicita el crédito para poder invertirlo en la compra de frutas y así poder surtirse y ayudar a su familia a salir adelante.
texts.en:
San Rafael Communal Bank is in its twelfth loan cycle with the Fundación Paraguaya's women's program.  It has 20 members, all of whom got together with the idea of helping their families and getting ahead.  Thanks to their work, they're achieving this.

Juana, the president, makes a living selling fruit.  She says that her group has helped her a lot to get ahead and that she has improved with the support of her companions.  Juana is a very enthusiastic person who wants to continue to grow and help her family.

She's requesting the loan to be able to invest in buying fruit to stock up and help her family get ahead.

loans.use: to buy fruit

loans.name: Jacqueline

texts.es: Jacqueline, de 42 años es una mujer trabajadora. Vive en compañía de sus 2 hijos: Jonathan y Brandon a los que cuida en la casa de su madre desde hace 15 años. A lo largo de su vida aprendió todo lo concernientes a las actividades agrícolas y también ganaderas,  hoy en día siembra maíz, papa y alfalfa en menores cantidades, la alfalfa le sirve en especial para alimentar a sus animales. Pero la actividad que más le agrada es la crianza de ovejas y cuyes, las cuales vende periódicamente para tener ingresos permanentes para invertir en el bienestar de su familia, manifiesta que le agrada su trabajo porque siempre tiene disponible para vender lo que produce en su almacén y para su consumo familiar, tiene deseos de adquirir más terrenos y tener mas animales de ganado ovino. Pues hace poco sufrió el robo de sus animales, pero está segura de volver a mantener el mismo ganado de antes, gracias a su experiencia. Ella pertenece al banco comunal “sicaya 2000” y este es el crédito número 3 con MFP, se siente feliz pues en este tiempo logró obtener muchas ganancias, todo gracias al apoyo económico que le brindan. Por ello promete cumplir con el pago de las cuotas. Además gusta de trabajar en su asociación, donde los integrantes son personas solidarias y trabajadoras. Jacqueline, invertirá el dinero en la compra de varios ejemplares de cuyes y ovejas para aumentar su ganado.
texts.en:
Jacqueline, 42 years old, is a hard-working woman.  She lives with her two sons, Jonathan and Brandon who she has cared for in her mother's house for 15 years.  Throughout her life, she learned everything about farming and caring for livestock.  Currently she plants corn, potatoes, and alfalfa in small quantities.  The alfalfa helps her specially to feed her animals. 

The work that she likes the most is raising sheep and guinea pigs, which she periodically sells to have permanent income to invest in the well-being of her family.  She says that she likes her work because she is always ready to sell what she produces at her store and for her family's consumption.  She wants to acquire more land and have more sheep.  Not too long ago, she was robbed of her animals, but she is sure she will return to having the same number of livestock as previously thanks to her experience.  

She is a member of the community bank Sicaya 2000 and this is her third loan with MFP.  She is happy since she succeeded in having high earnings thanks to the financial support they provided.  She promises to make her payments on time.  In addition she likes to work with a group where the members are supportive and hardworking.  Jacqueline will invest this money in the purchase of various types of guinea pigs and sheep to increase her number of livestock.

loans.use: to purchase sheep and guinea pigs.

loans.name: Wedad

texts.en: Wedad is a 36-year-old married woman. Her husband works in a governmental entity. Having seven kids has increased the financial pressure on the father, and that’s why Wedad opened a mini market four years ago in order to have another source of income. Now, she wants to buy more goods and food products for her store, which is why she has applied for this loan.

loans.use: To buy more goods and food products to sell

loans.name: Avetik

texts.en: Avetik runs a little shop where he trades fruits and vegetables. Avetik started this business in 2011. Avetik wants to purchase a car to transport fruits and vegetables to his shop, but his current income does not allow him to make such a purchase. With the loan's help, Avetik will purchase a car. This will allow him to significantly decrease his transportation costs and get more income.

loans.use: To pay for a car

loans.name: Blanca

texts.es: Blanca, de 64 años de edad, es una mujer emprendedora y muy trabajadora. Nunca se casó pero convivió por muchos años con el hombre que amó y junto a él tuvo 12 hijos, pero cuando él partió tuvo que luchar ella sola para sacarlos adelante, actualmente todo son mayores de edad e independientes. Vive en su casa propia junto a uno de sus hijos, su nieto y su nuera. La actividad que realiza Blanca es la venta de abarrotes, para eso cuenta con una bodega instalada en su propia casa, desde ahí atiende de manera amable y cordial a sus clientes que en su mayoría son sus vecinos. Ofrece a la venta diversos productos de primera necesidad como arroz, pan, leche, huevos, verduras y otros. Los productos no perecibles los renueva semanalmente pudiendo invertir alrededor de 100 a 150 soles en cada compra. Lleva en este negocio más de 3 años y trabaja sola. Además, vende diferentes tragos típicos elaborados con raíces y cortezas de árboles medicinales de la Amazonía, también trabaja en este oficio en su casa y lo realiza desde hace 5 años. Le gusta su negocio pues le permite estar en casa y contar con la tranquilidad de un ingreso económico, además del tiempo libre que lo puede emplear en las labores cotidianas de su hogar. Pero  no le gusta cuando sus clientes le solicitan créditos por sus compras pues comenta que ya tuvo malas experiencias con éste tipo de venta por la falta de pago. Sin embargo, ahora viendo los buenos resultados  tiene planes de ampliar su negocio  y además quiere adquirir un mototaxi para que pueda alquilarlo e incrementar sus ingresos económicos. Este es el crédito número 9 con MFP, está muy contenta al saber que tiene un apoyo financiero que le brinde la garantía para continuar trabajando con mucha tranquilidad, ella por su parte se compromete a seguir siendo una socia puntual en el pago de sus cuotas así como lo hizo en anteriores créditos que tuvo, asimismo se siente cómoda perteneciendo a su banco comunal ya que todos sus integrantes son muy responsables y solidarios. Con el monto solicitado de 1000 nuevos soles, comprará algunos abarrotes para que continúe vendiendo.
texts.en: Blanca is 64 years old, she is a very hard working business owner.  She is not married, but she lived many years with a man that she loved, with whom she had 12 children.  When they separated Blanca worked hard to keep her family moving forward on her own.  Today her children are adults and independent.  She lives in her own house with one of her children and a grandson and granddaughter.  Blanca runs a grocery store from her house, from which she attends to her clients, most of whom are her neighbors, in a friendly and cordial way.  She sells important household products such as rice, bread, milk, eggs, vegetables, etc.  Since most of the products are perishable she renews her inventory every week and spends about 100 to 150 soles each time.  She has been running this business for about 3 years by herself.  She also sells various medicinal drinks made from the roots and bark of trees from the Amazon, which she has been doing for 5 years.  She likes her business because it allows her to be in her house and at ease because of the income, she is also able to employ people to work in her home.  She does not like it when her clients want to run a tab in her store because in the past she has had bad experiences with people not paying.  However, after seeing the good results from her experiences she is planning to expand her business.  She also wants to acquire a mototaxi in order to rent it out and make more money.  This is her 9th loan with MFP, and she is very happy to know that she has the support from them so she can continue working worry free.  For her part, she will continue to make punctual payments as she has always done.  She feels comfortable belonging to a community bank because all of the members are responsible and caring.  With the 1000 soles that she is asking for she will buy more merchandise to continue selling.

loans.use: to purchase important household products

loans.name: Bonanza  (Cuenca) Group

texts.es:
El banco comunal Bonanza está conformado por 8 mujeres que viven en diferentes lugares de la ciudad de Cuenca, ciudad que se caracteriza por su clima,  su centro nos regala imágenes de su historia colonial y se encuentra rodeada de 4 ríos. Su gente es amable, tiene un corazón cálido y un gran carisma, mantienen su cultura y tradiciones, su gastronomía típica es muy variada. Las socias son mujeres sencillas de corazón y muy trabajadoras que buscan la manera de mejorar la economía de sus hogares y sacar adelante a sus familias, realizan los créditos en la banca comunal para mejorar sus pequeños negocios en el cual trabajan a diario.

Una de las socias de este grupo es la Señora. Mercy, vive en el centro de la ciudad de Cuenca, tiene 44 años de edad, está casada y en su unión conyugal ha concebido 2 hijos  de 19 y 9 años de edad, su primer hijo cursa los estudios universitarios y su segundo hijo está en una escuelita de la ciudad. Su esposo labora como empleado privado, no tienen casa propia por lo que viven en casa de un familiar.
 
Doña Mercy es una mujer emprendedora que de lunes a sábados se levanta temprano para dedicarse a la preparación de refrigerios, actividad que la desempeña hace 7 años y cuenta con su clientela fija, también labora en la atención de su tienda en la que trabaja de domingo a domingo sin un horario fijo. 

Su crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de un congelador para su tienda.

Su meta es  construir su casa en un terreno que es de su propiedad.
texts.en:
The communal bank Bonanza is formed by 8 women that live in different areas of the city of Cuenca, characterized by its weather. The center of the city confers images of its colonial history and it is surrounded by 4 rivers. The people are kind with a warm heart and great charisma, they maintain their culture and traditions and their gastronomy is varied. The members are women of humble hearts, very hardworking and looking for a way to better the economy of their households and keep their families going. They obtain their loans at the communal bank to improve the small businesses they work at everyday.  

One of the members of this group is Mercy. She lives downtown in the city of Cuenca, she is 44 years old and married. In her conjugal union she conceived 2 sons of 19 and 9 years old. Her first born attends university and her second son attends a small school in the city. Her husband works as a private employee. They do not own their home and thus they live in the home of a family member.    

Mercy is an entrepreneurial woman that wakes up early Mondays to Saturdays to make a living in the preparation of snacks, an activity she has been carrying out for the last 7 years and for which she has a steady customer base. She also works looking after her shop Sunday to Sunday without set hours.

She is going to invest her loan in the purchase of a freezer for her store.    

Her goal is to build her house in a lot that she owns.

loans.use: to buy a freezer.

loans.name: Gertrude

texts.en:
Gertrude lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married with four children, and three of her children go to school. She has one additional family member (mother). Gertrude operates a retail shop. She has been in business for the last 5 years. She works six days a week. She also gets additional income from farming. 

Gertrude has requested a loan of 1,500,000 Ugandan shillings from MCDT SACCO to buy 50 kgs of sugar, boxes of soap, 50 kgs of flour, a jerrycan of cooking oil, a bag of rice and 50 kgs of beans. Her major business challenges are transportation and seasonality. Her goals and aspirations are to buy a refrigerator so as to start selling cold drinks and also to own a fully stocked shop.
