Besides being a good student she has her own income that she uses to help pay for her education and also does beauty consultations and individual makeovers which she uses to practice of what she is studying. María does different types of work like hair dying, makeup, nails, and other jobs. She works everyday and when her customers require her services they call or go to her residence since she works from her home and does house calls as well. María has worked in this field for 5 years and has done very well.

This loan will be used to buy certain beauty tools that she needs for her work like, dyes and makeup. This is her sixth loan cycle with the communal bank and says that she likes it for the ease of getting loans.

Her dreams are to one day have a SPA and to finish her education.

loans.use: buy certain beauty tools that she needs for her work like, dyes and makeup.

loans.name: Luisa Beatriz

texts.es:
En el sitio la pila del cantón Montecristi se reúne cada quince días el Banco Comunal  Para el Futuro De la Mujer. Este lugar es muy conocido en la provincia y en el país por su rica cultura tradicional, se puede encontrar una gran variedad de  artesanía que son elaboradas por sus habitantes siguiendo las costumbres tradicionales.

En este lugar vive la señora Luisa, tiene 39 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen tres hijos de 16, 14 y 8 años de edad, las dos mayores estudian en colegio y la menor en escuela. Su esposo es maestro.

Ella para salir adelante y ganar algo por su cuenta sin depender de su esposo se dedica al comercio, tiene una pequeña tienda en su casa, allí vende todo tipo de víveres y dulces de muchas formas y sabores los cuales son muy apetecidos por los turistas que pasan por el sector, trabaja todos los días desde las 6h00 hasta las 20h00 y a veces hasta más tarde, sus hijos le ayuda en su negocio cuando pueden, lleva más de 8 años con su negocio y le va bastante bien ya que gracias a los créditos cada vez lo surte mas.

Este crédito lo va a emplear para surtir más su tienda, va a comprar dulces, arroz, azúcar, embutidos, detergentes y toda clase de víveres. Está en el Banco Comunal desde hace 15 años y le gusta porque con un crédito empezó su negocio. 

Sus metas son seguir aumentado su negocio y darles una buena educación a sus hijos
texts.en:
The Para el Futuro De la Mujer communal bank gets together every two weeks in La Pila, Montecristi. This place is well-known both in the province and in the country for its rich traditional culture; one can find a great variety of handicrafts that are made by the locals using the traditional customs. 

This is where Luisa lives. She is a 39-year-old married mother of three, ages 16, 14, and 8. The two eldest are in secondary school while the youngest is in elementary school. Luisa's husband is a teacher. 

In order to get ahead and make her own money without having to depend on her husband, she is a small business owner. She runs a small general store from home, where she sells all types of provisions and candies that the local tourists crave. She works every day from 6:00 a.m. until 8:00 p.m., and sometimes even later. Her children her with the business whenever they can, and she has been quite prosperous because thanks to these loans, she is able to stock up her business more and more. 

She will use this loan to stock up on all types of provisions. She has been with the bank for 15 years, and she likes it because she started her business with a loan. 

Her goals are to expand her business and to provide her children with a good education.

loans.use: to purchase sweets, rice, sugar, canned items, detergents and other goods

loans.name: Idalia Margarita

texts.es:
En el sitio la pila del cantón Montecristi se reúne cada quince días el Banco Comunal  La Pila. Este lugar es muy conocido en la provincia y en el país por su rica cultura tradicional, se puede encontrar una gran variedad de  artesanía que son elaboradas por sus habitantes siguiendo las costumbres tradicionales.

La señora Idalia, tiene 52 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen dos hijos  mayores de edad, su hija aun vive con ella. Su esposo es agricultor.

Doña Idalia tiene un pequeño comedor en su casa en el cual prepara deliciosos platos, trabaja de lunes a sabados desde las 06h00 hasta las  a las tres de la tarde ya que solo prepara desayunos y almuerzos. Trabaja sola y siempre le ha ido muy bien ya que por su casa pasan todos los días cientos de personas que se desplazan a otras ciudades y porque ella prepara diferentes platos para todos los gustos, lleva más de 10 años con este negocio el cual le permite salir adelante.

Este crédito lo va utilizar en comprar arroz, carne, pescado y otros víveres para la preparación de los alimentos. Está en el Banco Comunal desde hace 4 años  y le gusta porque los créditos son de mucha ayuda para poder seguir adelante con su negocio.

Sus sueños son seguir adelante y que sui negocio mejore aun más.
texts.en:
The “La Pila” (The Water Basin) communal bank meets in La Pila in Montecristi Canton.  This place is very well-known in the province and in the country for being a place rich in tradition.  A great variety of crafts that are made by the inhabitants following traditional customs can be found here.  Idalia, 52, is married and has two adult children; her daughter still lives with her and her husband works in agriculture.

Idalia has a small eatery at home where she prepares delicious dishes.  She works Monday to Saturday from 6am until 3pm since she only prepares breakfast and lunch.  She works alone; she’s always done well because hundreds of people pass by her house daily on their way to other cities and because she always prepares different dishes for all tastes.  She’s been in business ten years and it makes it possible for her to get ahead.

She will use this loan to buy rice, meat, fish and other foodstuffs to prepare the food.  She’s been in the communal bank for four years and likes it because the loans are very useful for her to be able to stay in business.  Her dream is to continue forward and that the business improves still more.

loans.use: to buy rice, meat, fish and other foodstuffs.

loans.name: Emily Dayana

texts.es:
La socia es la señora Emily, tiene 27 años de edad, es soltera y madre de  1 hija en edad escolar,  ella vive en el distrito Santiago del Cusco, la socia tiene un almacén y se dedica a la   comercialización de productos como cerveza y bebidas gaseosas.
Emily invertirá su préstamo solicitado para comprar mercadería como cerveza y gaseosas por cajas,para capitalizar su negocio.
La socia está muy agradecida con KIVA por ayudarla en el fortalecimiento de su actividad. Emily pertenece al banco comunal “Rumbo al Éxito-Santiago” de la ciudad del Cusco – Perú.
texts.en:
This member is Emily.  She is 45 years old, single, and the mother of two children.  She lives in the Santiago district of Cusco.  She has a store where she sells products such as beer and soft drinks.   

Emily will use the requested loan to buy merchandise to capitalize her business. 

She is very thankful to Kiva for helping her strengthen her business.  Emily belongs to the Rumbo al Éxito-Santiago Communal Bank of the city of Cusco, Peru.

loans.use: to buy merchandise such as beer and soft drinks

loans.name: Irma

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal ”PACHAMAMA“;  La socia Irma tiene 42 años de edad ,01 hijo y es conviviente, la socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta de repuestos de carro como baterías,llantas,timones entre otros, la socia lleva años en este negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, la socia tiene un local donde vende toda su mercadería por el centro de la ciudad, la socia desea poder tener un local propio para no tener que estar pagando alquiler este es  uno de sus sueños a futuro, la socia es una persona responsable y empeñosa siendo de esta manera que la socia saca adelante  a su familia.

La socia solicita el préstamo para la compra de aceites para carro.


La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota
texts.en:
Member Irma belongs to the communal bank Pachamama. She is 42 years old, has one child, and lives with her partner. 

She combines her daily activities with her business selling auto parts like batteries, tires, steering wheels, and other items. She has been in business for three years and it is going well thanks to the effort she puts into her business every day. She sells all of her merchandise in a shop downtown. She would like to own her own shop so that she wouldn't have to pay rent. This is one of her long-term dreams. She is a responsible and hard-working woman and her business is her means to provide for her family.

She is requesting the loan to purchase motor oil.

She is happy with the loan and promises to make her installment payments.

loans.use: to purchase motor oil.

loans.name: Hilda

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal ”PACHAMAMA“;  La socia Hilda tiene  40 años de edad ,04 hijos y es casada, la socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de elaboración de pan de trigo para luego distribuirlo a sus clientes que le solicitan como panderias,tienda de abarrotes entre otros, la socia trabaja conjuntamente con su esposo,la socia a la vez se dedica  a la venta de productos de  belleza como cremas ,perfumes entre otros ella vende de forma independiente ofreciendo su mercadería a sus amistades y clientes que le solicitan siendo de esta manera que la socia saca adelante a su familia.

La socia solicita el préstamo para la compra insumos para la elaboración de pan como trigo y harina.


La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota
texts.en:
Hilda is a member of the Communal Bank “Pachamama”.  She is 40 years old, married, and has four children.  Hilda divides her time between her daily activities and her business of making wheat bread.  She distributes her products to customers who have placed orders such as bakeries, grocery stores, and other establishments.  Hilda works with her husband.  Sometimes she also sells beauty products such as crèmes, perfumes, and other items.  In this business, she works independently and offers her merchandise to friends and clients who have requested these items.  By working in this manner, she is able to help her family move forward.

Hilda is requesting a loan to buy supplies for making bread, such as wheat and flour.  She is pleased with the loan and promises to complete her payments.

loans.use: to buy supplies for making bread.

loans.name: Ayélé

texts.fr: Ayélé est mariée à un comptable. Elle est âgée de 35ans et n’a pas d’enfants en charge. Elle revend des bazins riches qu’elle achète chez les grossîtes venus du Mali, du Sénégal et autres à ses clients qui se trouvent dans les différents coins de la ville de Lomé.  Son activité qu’elle e démarré en 2007 se déroule de façon ambulante. Elle sollicite de WAGES un deuxième prêt pour s’acheter des marchandises (bazins) afin de mieux satisfaire ses clients. elle veut disposer d’aune boutique pour mieux répondre aux sollicitations des clients et prendre soin de ses futurs progénitures.
texts.en:
Ayélé is married to an accountant.  She is 35 years old and has no children in her care.  

She sells "bazin riche" (damask) fabrics that she buys from wholesalers who come from Mali, Senegal and other countries.  Ayélé got involved in this business in 2007 and works as an itinerant seller in various neighborhoods of Lomé.

Ayélé is requesting a second loan from WAGES, in order to buy some bazin fabrics and to better satisfy the needs of her customers.  She would like to have a shop to better meet her customers' requests, and to be able to take care of her future children, one day.

loans.use: to buy "bazin" (damask) fabrics.

loans.name: Ponty

texts.fr: Madame Ponty est une femme mariée qui vit au Sénégal.  Elle s’active dans le secteur du commerce et exerce la vente  de bonbons depuis plus que 5 ans.Les produits  qu’elle commercialise sont exposés sur une table devant chez elle de sorte a attitrer l’attention des enfants.  Les revenus  que lui procure son activité  lui permettent d’agrandir sa boutique et de  supporter les charges de  sa petite famille  composée de  trois enfants.  Elle  est sociétaire d’un des guichets de l’UIMCEC et sollicite un crédit de 100,000 frs prévu pour l’achat de bonbons qu’elle va vendre.  Son objectif est de mieux développer son activité jusqu'à ce qu’elle puisse réaliser son vœu futur qui consiste a disposer  d’une grande boutique de  vente de produits alimentaires.
texts.en: Mrs Ponty is a married woman living in Senegal. She has been involved in the commercial sector for the past five years through the selling of candy. These products are placed on a table in front of her house in order to attract children. The profits from this activity allow her to keep growing her store as well as take care of the needs of her small family, including those of her three children. She is a member of one of the offices of UIMCEC and is asking for a loan of 100,000 XOF (~200 USD) to purchase larger quantities of candy to re-sell. She aims to continue increasing her sales until she can achieve her future goal of owning a larger store from which she could sell a variety of food products.

loans.use: purchase candy to re-sell

loans.name: Saliwa Omontayo Adjoke

texts.fr: Agée de 27 ans, Saliwa Omontayo est mariée et mère de trois enfants dont un est scolarisé. L'aîné et le benjamin ont respectivement 05ans et 02ans 06mois. Elle vend des lubrifiants depuis 02 ans et s'approvisionne dans l'un des marchés du Bénin. Sa clientèle large et variée est essentiellement composée des mécaniciens. Soucieuse d'accroître son chiffre d'affaire et de satisfaire la demande de ses clients, elle a fait recours au micro crédit de Finadev en vue de maximiser son profit et de participer à la scolarisation de ses enfants.
texts.en: Saliwa Omontayo is a 27 year old married mother of three children, one of whom attends school. The oldeest and the youngest are respectively 5 years and 2.5 years old. For the past two years she has been selling lubricants/oils and stocks up at one of the markets in Benin. Her wide customer base is largely comprised of mechanics. Anxious about increasing her sales and satisfying the demands of her customers, she is asking for a loan from Finadav in order to maximize her profits and contribute to the education of her children.

loans.use: purchase 5 cartons of motor oil

loans.name: Luz

texts.es:
Luz, de 66 años de edad, es una mujer emprendedora, alegre y muy amble, le gusta los retos. Es conviviente con Abdias quien es desempleado, fruto de esa unión tuvieron  03 hijos que ya son independientes. Juntos viven cómodamente instalados en su propia casa en compañía de su nieto de 19 años de edad. El negocio que tiene Luz es la venta de comidas, para eso tiene un pequeño puesto ubicado al frente de una posta de salud, donde atiende como variados platos de la región y menús a su distinguida clientela, levantándose de muy temprano para realizar las compras de sus ingredientes para la preparación del día, pagando un precio cómodo que le permite tener un mayor margen de ganancias. 
Ya  lleva 8 años en éste negocio atendiendo a sus clientes contando con el apoyo de su pareja  para atender al público. Considera a su negocio bastante rentable por la clientela constante que tiene y ha sabido ganarse por la buena sazón de sus comidas. Le gusta su negocio pues le ha traído muchas satisfacciones personales y económicas, ya que lo ha visto crecer iniciándose  con venta de jugos, pasando  a la venta de comidas en una mesa ambulatoria, ahora contando con un local, sabiéndose ganar un buena clientela, y le deja buenas ganancias, viendo esto tiene planes solo de mantenerse en el negocio por la edad que tiene. Este será el préstamo número 4 con la institución MFP. Por tanto cuenta de un pequeño préstamo para que pueda cumplir con sus objetivos. Por otro lado comenta sentirse bien con su banco comunal pues cuenta con su apoyo permanente.
Con el monto solicitado de 800 nuevos soles los invertirá en la compra de golosinas para mejorar la variedad de sus productos a ofertar a sus clientes, así como también los ingredientes para la preparación de sus comidas, buscando precios más cómodos por sus compras en volumen.
texts.en:
Luz is 66 years old. She is an enterprising, cheerful and vert kind woman. She likes challenges. She lives with Abdias, who is unemployed. From this relationtionship they had 3 children who are already grown. Together they live comfortably in their own home with their 19 year old grandson. Luz' business is selling food. To do this, she has a small spot infront of a health center where she sells various regional dishes and fixed menus to her distiguished clientele. She gets up very early to purchase her ingredients to prepare that day, paying a comfortable price that allows her to have a larger profit margin.

She has been doing this business for 8 years, serving customers with the support of her spouse. She considers her business to be very profitable becuase of the regular customers she has and because she has been able to get ahead with her good cooking. She likes her business because it has brought her a lot of personal and financial satisfaction. She has seen it grow, starting by selling juice and then selling food on a mobile table. Now she has a locale and she knows how to earn good customers. This brings her good earnings and she plans to just maintain the business, because of her age. This will be loan number 4 with the MFP institution. She has the small loan so that she can meet her objectives. She says that she feels good in her communal bank because she has permanent support. 

With the amount of 800 nuevos soles that she has asked for, she will invest in buying snacks to improve the variety of the products she offers her customers, as well as ingredients to prepare her foods, seeking more comfortable prices for her bulk purchases.

loans.use: to buy products for food preparation as well as snacks.

loans.name: Mary Luz

texts.es:
La joven Marilu como es conocida es una persona muy trabajadora dedicada su negocio, vive actualmente con su esposo y 1 hijo en Choluteca Honduras. Su negocio es la venta de ropa nueva actividad que realiza en las plantaciones de melón, sandia y caña de azúcar desde hace más de 2 años.
Marilu el préstamo lo invirtió en su negocio en la compra de ropa como blusas, camisas, trajes niños y ropa interior. Ella espera que mejore su actividad con el capital fresco y satisfacer las necesidades de sus clientes. Marilu sus planes es de comprar un vehículo para salir a vender a otras fincas mas retiradas y ayudar a su familia ya que necesitan de su ayuda.
Choluteca, Honduras - Agosto del 2012
texts.en:
Marilu is known as a hardworking young woman who is dedicated to her business. She lives with her husband and son in Choluteca, Honduras. Her business is selling clothes, a new activity that she has done at melon, watermelon and sugarcane farms for more than 2 years.

Marilu will invest the loan in her business by buying clothing such as blouses, shirts, children's clothes and underwear. She hopes to improve her activity with the fresh capital and meet her customers' needs. Marilu's plans are to buy a vehicle to go out to sell at other farms further away, since they need her help.

Choluteca, Honduras - August of 2012

loans.use: to buy blouses, shirts, children's clothes and underwear for her business

loans.name: Rachelle

texts.fr: Agée de 42ans, Rachelle est mariée et mère de deux enfants scolarisés dont l'aîné et le benjamin ont respectivement 17ans et 13ans. Elle s'est spécialisée dans la vente de tissus depuis des années dans un quartier populaire du Bénin et s'approvisionne dans l'un des marchés de la place. Sa clientèle large et variée est essentiellement composée des hommes et des femmes. En vue de renforcer son chiffre d'affaire et de satisfaire la demande de ses clients, elle a sollicité et a obtenu un micro crédit à Finadev. Ce crédit lui permettra de maximiser son profit et de participer à la scolarisation de ses enfants.
texts.en:
42-year-old Rachelle is married and the mother of 2 children who both go to school. The eldest child is 17 years old and the youngest 13. She has specialised in selling fabric in a popular district of Benin for years, and she gets her supplies at one of the local markets. Her large and varied clientèle is essentially composed of men and women.

In order to increase her turnover and satisfy her customer demand, Rachelle has requested and received a microloan from Finadev. This loan will enable her to maximise her profits and contribute to her children's schooling expenses.

loans.use: to buy 25 pieces of fabric.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a bag of flour, a can of oil, a bag of sugar, a bucket of beans and some rice.

loans.name: Khady's Group

texts.fr:
Ce Banc Villageois dont fait partie le groupe est créé depuis le 13 décembre 2008. Il est composé par les femmes qui habitent dans le même village et des alentours.Elles font comme activité principale le commerce.
Ndiague âgée de 26 ans est mariée et mère de 4 enfants dont 3 garçons et 1 fille. Elle est debout sur la photo et levant la main gauche.
Avec le prêt reçu elle compte acheter des habits qu'elle revend auprès de ses clients dans les villages environnants. 
Les bénéfices lui permettent d'améliorer les conditions de vie de ses enfants.
texts.en:
This group is part of a banc villageois created on the 13th of December, 2008. It is made up of women who live in the same village and its surrounding area. They are primarily retailers.

Ndiague is 26 years old, married and the mother of 4 children; 3 boys and one girl. She is standing and raising her right hand in the picture. She plans to use the loan she has received to buy clothes which she resells to her customers in the surrounding villages. Her profits enable her to improve her children's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy clothes.

loans.name: Khady Niang's Group

texts.fr:
le BANC VILLAGEOIS dont fait partie ce groupe est créé depuis le 13 décembre 2008. Il est composé de femmes qui habitent dans le même village. Elles font comme activité principale le commerce.
Khady est âgée de 38 ans. Elle est mariée mais n'a pas d'enfants. Elle est debout à droite de la photo et lavant la main
Avec le prêt reçu elle envisage de faire du commerce. Elle achète des haricots(niébé), de l'arachide, du mil qu'elle va revendre. Elle compte faire confectionner des chaussures pour les vendre aussi.
Les bénéfices générés lui permettent de soutenir son mari dans la prise en charge des besoins de la famille.
texts.en:
This group is part of a banc villageois created on the 13th of December, 2008. It is made up of women who live in the same village. They are primarily retailers.

Khady is 38 years old. She is married but has no children. She is standing on the left of the picture and raising her hand. She plans to use the loan she has received for her business. She will buy beans (cowpeas), groundnuts and millet which she will resell. She also plans to have shoes made for resale. The profits generated by her business enable her to support her husband in providing for the family's needs.

loans.use: to buy beans, groundnuts and millet.

loans.name: Santhiaba Coki 2 Group

texts.fr:
Ce Banc  Villageois Santhiaba Coki 2 est créé depuis le 30 décembre 2009; il est composé par les femmes qui habitent dans le même village. Elles ont comme activité principale le commerce.


Le groupe PS constitué de 3 femmes a comme emprunteur vedette madame Yatta âgée de 38 ans, elle est mariée , mère de 2 enfants 1 garçon et 1 fille.Elle mène une activité de commerce de tissus et de chaussures et capitalise une bonne expérience de 03 ans. Elle est debout sur la photo habillée en robe teintée et a levé la main gauche.

Elle s’approvisionne à Dakar et à Touba et revend dans son village et les environs. 


Avec le prêt reçu elle compte acheter des habits et des chaussures qu'elle revend auprès de ses clients dans les villages environnants. 


Les bénéfices lui permettront d'aider son mari dans la gestion de la famille et renforcer son épargne dans le BV.
texts.en:
The "Santhiaba Coki 2" banc villageois was created on the 30th of December, 2009. It is made up of women who live in the same village. They are primarily retailers.

The featured borrower of this 3-member group is Yatta. She is 38 years old, married and the mother of 2 children; a boy and a girl. She sells fabrics and shoes and is capitalising on 3 years of good experience. She is standing and wearing a dyed dress in the picture, and is raising her left hand. She gets her supplies in Dakar and Touba, and resells them in her village and the area around it. She plans to use the loan she has received to buy clothes and shoes to resell to her customers in the surrounding villages. The profits will enable her to support her husband in running the family and to build up her savings at the banc villageois.

loans.use: to buy clothes and shoes for resale.

loans.name: Henriette

texts.fr: Henriette est mariée et mère de deux enfants dont un seul est scolarisé. Le plus âgé et le moins âgé ont respectivement 25ans et 20ans. Elle a une boutique où elle vend des boissons depuis des années. Elle s'approvisionne dans les grands dépôts de la place. Dans le but d'accroître sa capacité d'approvisionnement et de répondre favorablement à la demande de ses clients qui augmentent sans cesse compte tenu du bon emplacement de son fonds commerce, elle a sollicité et a obtenu un financement auprès de Finadev en vue de maximiser son revenu additionnel et de participer à la scolarisation de ses enfants.
texts.en: Henriette is married and the mother of 2 children, only one of whom (still) goes to school. The eldest child is 25 years old and the youngest is 20. She has a shop in which she has been selling drinks for years. She gets her supplies from the local warehouses. In order to increase her supply capacity and to respond positively to the demands of her customer base, which is continually growing thanks to the good location of her business, she has requested and received a loan from Finadev, with a view to maximising her additional revenue and contributing to her children's education.

loans.use: to buy 10 cases of soft drinks and 10 cases of beer.

loans.name: Layla

texts.en: Layla is a 47-year-old married woman. Her husband works as a school bus driver to support his family of six members. Layla, on the other hand, makes jewelry at home to sell. She has applied for this loan to buy more beads and gemstones to increase her productivity and her profits.

loans.use: To buy more beads and gemstones

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma is 33 years old. She lives with her life partner. She sells coconuts at the market. She has had this business for five years, and she has gained a lot of experience in sales. She has built a large clientele as she is very pleasant and helpful. People recommend her because she has top quality products and, above all, low prices.

Fatuma is an energetic, hardworking woman with many dreams she hopes to achieve. Every day, she gets up trusting that with time, she will manage to earn a more prosperous future. She will put in the maximum effort, because she knows that it's the only way she will be successful.

In recent weeks, the demand has increased, and she wants to take advantage of that to make a new investment, but she doesn't have the sufficient capital. That's why she is requesting a loan from Yehu that will allow her to buy more coconuts to sell.

loans.use: To buy more coconuts to sell

loans.name: Davit

texts.en: Davit lives in the town of Goris with his wife, Araksya, and their 3-year-old daughter. Davit works as a teacher at a local school. Additionally, Davit runs a farm, where he breeds cows. Davit would like to purchase one more cow and expand his farm. He also wants to purchase grass so he can feed the cows during winter. Development of agriculture is important for Davit to earn more income and create better living conditions for his family.

loans.use: to pay for a cow and grass feed.

loans.name: Marie Gorette

texts.en: Marie Goreth is 40 years old. She sells foodstuffs, a business she has been in for three years. She wants a loan to buy more foodstuffs such as potatoes, beans and rice for sale. The profits she earns from the business will be used to pay the school fees for her children.

loans.use: to buy more foodstuffs such as potatoes, beans and rice for sale.

loans.name: Resty

texts.en:
Resty is 32 years old and lives in the town of Matugga in the Luwero region of Uganda. She is married and has four children, three of whom are currently in school. For the past eight years, Resty has been working hard to manage her small tailoring business.

To help expand her business, Resty has requested a loan of 2,500,000 UGX from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more materials for making new, fashionable clothes. This will help Resty to generate greater profits and improve her standard of living. Resty hopes that in the future she will be able to start up a training center for tailoring. 

Resty is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP). The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Resty who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for micro-loans.

loans.use: to buy more materials for sewing new, fashionable clothes.

loans.name: Mumtaz

texts.en: Ms. Mumtaz is a young, energetic female who has been in the business of cattle sales and purchasing for the past 10 years. Since her husband's income was too low to support the three members of her family, now Ms. Mumtaz has also started her own business. She sells and purchases cattle and earns a reasonable amount to contribute to the family's income. Their financial condition is better now. She is requesting 15,000 PKR to buy a calf.

loans.use: To buy a calf.

loans.name: Guevara

texts.en:
Guevara is a 41-year-old, married man and a father of three children. Guevara is a hard worker who puts much effort into improving his family's living conditions. He especially wants to improve his children's education.

Guevara has worked as a van driver for the past 20 years. He is well-known in the region and has a very good reputation. Most of his customers are loyal to him since they set daily schedules with him for their fixed appointments.

To achieve his objectives, Guevara has applied for a loan for the first time from Kiva's partner Al Majmoua. He needs a loan to buy another van to expand his work. This will help him increase his income as much as he can to make sure that he'll be capable of covering his children's tuition and higher education fees as long as he can afford it.

Guevara hopes to buy a school bus and expand his working field.

loans.use: To buy another van to expand his business.

loans.name: Teo

texts.en:
Teo lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is single with three children and none of them goes to school. She has two additional family members (grand children). She lives in a rented house and the family has no access to electricity nor to piped water. Her monthly expenses include feeding the family and rent.

She roasts maize and sells sweet bananas at the market. She sells her products on a retail basis. She has been in this business for the last six years. She works six days a week. She generates additional income through selling charcoal.

She has requested a loan of 500,000 UGX from MCDT – SACCO to buy bunches of sweet bananas and a sack of maize. Her major business challenges are thieves and seasonality. Her goals and aspirations are to build her own house and also to start growing maize and other cereals.

loans.use: to buy more bunches of sweet bananas and a sack of maize.

loans.name: Santos

texts.es:
El señor Santos de 50 años de edad es soltero, vive con su hijastra y dos nietos, tiene casa propia, radica en la comunidad de el Jícaro Galán, Nacaome, al sur de Honduras, se dedica desde hace varios años al comercio de frescos al por mayor y al detalle, también vende jugos de todas las clases y dulces. Don Santos es un hombre muy trabajador y luchador con deseo de salir adelante en la vida.
Don Santos esta solicitando 25,000.00 lempiras para compra frescos de botella y desechables, jugos, churros, dulces y más productos que en su negocio se venden, con el apoyo de este préstamo él desea surtir mas su negocio y por ende obtener mejores ganancias, y con las ganancias desea ampliar mas el negocio.
Don Santos su sueño es mejorar su casa, quiere hacerla de bloque porque es de tierra.
San Lorenzo, Honduras - Septiembre  del 2012.
texts.en:
50-year-old Santos is single and lives with his step-daughter and two grandchildren.  He owns his own home which is located in el Jícaro Galán community, in Nacaome, in the south of Honduras.  Santos has been selling soft drinks wholesale and retail for a number of years.  He also sells all kinds of juice and sweet treats.  He is a very hard-working, tenacious man who has a desire to do well in life.

Santos is requesting a loan for 25,000 lempiras to buy bottled and disposable soft drinks, juices, churros, sweet treats and other products that he sells in his business.  With the support of this loan, he would like to further stock his business so that he can make better profits.  With his profits, he would like to further expand his business.

Santos' dream is to improve his home.  He would like to build it out of blocks because it is currently made from earth.

San Lorenzo, Honduras - September 2012

loans.use: to buy bottled and disposable soft drinks, juices, churros, sweet treats and other products for his business

loans.name: Affoussatou

texts.fr: Agée de 42ans, Affoussatou est mariée et mère de deux enfants scolarisés. Le plus âgé a 09ans et le moins âgé a 06ans. Elle distribue des produits cosmétiques depuis quelques années et s'approvisionne auprès des grossistes à l'extérieur afin de les revendre aux détaillants. Dans le souci de renforcer son fonds de commerce et de couvrir les besoins de ses clients, elle a sollicité et a obtenu un concours financier auprès de Finadev. Ce concours financier lui permettra de maximiser son intérêt et de participer à la scolarisation de ses enfants.
texts.en: Affoussatou is a 42 year old married woman of two children, both of whom attend school. The oldest is 9 and the youngest is 6 years old. She has been distributing cosmetic products for the last few years and stocks up from wholesale suppliers in order to sell them to retailers. In order to strengthen her business and address the needs of her customers, she is asking for a loan from Finadev. This will allow her to maximize her profits and participate in the education of her children.

loans.use: purchase two cartons of perfume, 1/2 carton of toothpaste, 2 cartons of soap and 1 carton of creams

loans.name: Naseem

texts.en:
Naseem is married and the mother of four children. She is a hardworking and intelligent lady, and she does different work to support her family. 

She started a general store and has a sewing machine. In her free time, when there are no customers, she stitches clothes so that no time gets wasted. 

She has been with Kashf for two years and has greatly improved the store.  

Naseem is in need of 25,000 PKR for her general store. She wants to buy stocks of rice, wheat, pulses, etc., in bulk, as well as toffees, chewing gum and other items for children. She also wants some running capital in hand.

loans.use: To buy stocks of  rice, wheat, pulses, etc., in bulk.

loans.name: Providance

texts.en:
Providance, age 44, is married and has six children. They all go to school. 

She sells curtains. She has been in the business for 18 years. 

She wants the loan to buy more curtains for sale. She plans to use the profits for paying school fees for her children.

loans.use: To buy more curtains for sale.

loans.name: Saumu

texts.en:
Saumu is 36 years old, married, and has five children. She lives in the town of Msambweni, Kenya, with her family.

For the past two years, she has been selling goats for slaughter, selling to the people at the slaughter houses. In addition to this, she also owns a butcher shop that she supplies with meat. Thanks to her efforts, she has been able to send her children to school.

She is requesting her third loan in the amount of 30,000 KES. The money will be spent on the purchase of more goats. Saumu has maintained an active business, and she dreams of expanding her business and owning a slaughter house in future.

loans.use: to purchase more goats.

loans.name: Clementine

texts.en:
Clementine is 26 years old. She sells skirts. She has been in the business for two years. 

She wants the loan to buy more skirts for sale. The profits from the business will be used for buying a house.

loans.use: To buy more clothes for sale.

loans.name: Hamdah

texts.en:
Due to cultural reasons, Hamdah prefers that her photo is not on the Internet; thus the above photo is of her husband. 

Hamdah is a 50-year-old married woman from Al Russeifeh, Jordan, who has six family members. She is requesting a loan of 500 JOD to pay for materials to continue to build the third floor. In the future she hopes to buy new furniture also to see her sons married.

loans.use: to pay for her home improvements.

loans.name: Dúo Mujeres Con Esperanza Group

texts.es:
Dúo Mujeres Con Esperanza.
Este Dúo está integrado por la señora Carmelina de 26 años de edad ella es originaria de Rabinal, 
Ella se dedica a la elaboración y venta de tortillas tiene 3 años de dedicarse a esta actividad, está muy contenta porque por medio de su negocito ha podido ayudar a su familia, y espera que le puedan dar ese apoyo que necesita ya que es una forma de aumentar su negocio y tener mejores ganancias para ayudar a su familia. Ella está solicitando este crédito para la compra de maíz para la elaboración y venta de tortillas.
texts.en:
Mujeres Con Esperanza (Hopeful Women)

One of the members of this group is 26-year-old Carmelina who is from Rabinal.  Her business is making and selling tortillas and she has been in this business for three years.  She is very happy because through her small business she has been able to help her family.  She hopes that you can give her this support that she needs because it is a way to increase her business and make better profits to help her family.  Carmelina is requesting this loan to buy corn for making and selling tortillas.

loans.use: to buy corn for making and selling tortillas

loans.name: Almara

texts.en:
Almara lives in Verin Artashat village with her family: her husband, her sister, two daughters and two sons. 

Almara works at the library of Verin Artashat. She also helps the family to run a farm, where they grow apricot, peach, cherry and apple trees and keep a grape orchard. 

Almara needs some financial means to organize the cultivation process. She wants to purchase fertilizer to fight against diseases of trees. Almara will also buy stakes and wires for the grape orchard, pay for watering the land and hire workers to gather the harvest. Implementation of these goals are important for Almara to have sufficient income from the sales of the harvest to sustain her family during the year.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, wires and stakes and to pay for watering the land and hiring workers.

loans.name: Dúo Princesas Group

texts.es:
Dúo princesas 
María Juana, de 28 años de edad quien se dedica a la agricultura como siembra de ejote, arveja , ella tiene 4 hijos la mayor de 12 años estudia el quinto grado de primaria y la  más pequeña en párvulos, doña Juana está solicitando el crédito para invertir en agricultura (siembra de ejote) ya que constante mente mantiene sus terrenos sembrados porque está inscrita en la cooperativa y su anhelo es cosechar un buen producto para seguir siendo socia de la cooperativa (cuatro pinos) y sobre todo tener la oportunidad de apoyar a sus hijas en sus estudios y verlas crecer y tener las oportunidades que ella no tuvo.
texts.en:
Dúo princesas (Princess Duo)

Maria Juana, 28, makes a living through agriculture; for example, she sows the seeds for green beans and peas. 

She has 4 children, the oldest is 12 years-old and is in the 5th grade of primary school, and the youngest is in preschool. 

Juana is requesting the loan to invest it in agriculture (sowing green bean seeds) because she constantly sows her land and is a business partner of a cooperative (Cuatro Pinos or "4 Pines"). 

She hopes to have a great harvest so she can continue being a partner and, above all, she hopes to support her children's studies, watch them grow, and give them opportunities she did not have.

loans.use: to purchase seeds in installments to cultivate green beans, peas, and other things.

loans.name: Armando

texts.es: Armando, de 46 años es un hombre responsable y ejemplar hijo. Vive en compañía de su mamá en la casa de ella, desde hace 10 años. En la actualidad posee 2 terrenos agrícolas donde siembra diversos productos agrícolas como papa, cebada, avena, heno y  trébol rojo. Con el tiempo obtuvo muchos compradores por lo que no se abastecía en la cantidad de alimento, es así que comenzó a alquilar otros terrenos agrícolas con los que abastece la producción. Ya tiene 20 años de experiencia no solo en la agricultura también en la ganadería, pues se dedica a la compra y venta de ganado vacuno, posee 2 vacas y un toro, pero en días de ferias, viaja a las ciudades de Chupaca y Jauja para vender los animales, “si vendo mis animales en el pueblo la ganancia es mínima, por esa razón viajo a las ciudades, pues ahí obtengo más dinero. Lo mismo pasa con la agricultura, en la cosecha comercializo a la ciudad a la capital del país, contrato camión y yo mismo realizo el viaje”, comenta. Este es el cuarto crédito con MFP, en todo este tiempo agradece el apoyo obtenido, pues le ayudó a salir adelante y mejorar el capital para sus actividades económicas. Por esa razón promete ser puntual con el pago de sus cuotas como en anteriores oportunidades. Armando, invertirá el dinero solicitado en la compra de 200 sacos de  fertilizantes naturales para esparcir entre sus próximos sembríos de papa, asimismo comprará una vaca más para continuar con su negocio.
texts.en:
46-year-old Armando is a responsible man and an exemplary son.  He has been living together with his mom in her home for the past 10 years.  Armando owns two plots of farmland where he grows a number of different crops such as potatoes, barley, oats, hay and red clover.  Over the years, he gained a lot of buyers which led to him not being able to produce enough to meet demand.  For this reason, he started renting additional land so that he could produce more.  He has 20 years experience not only in farming but also in cattle farming as he buys and sells cattle.  He has two cows and one bull.  On market days he travels to the cities of Chupaca and Jauja to sell his animals.  "If I sell my animals in the village my profits are minimal so I travel to the cities because I make more money there.  It's the same with my crops which I sell in the capital.  I hire a truck and I do the journey myself", he says.

This is Armando's fourth loan from MFP and he is grateful for the support that he has received over the years as it has helped him to make progress and improve the capital he has available for his business activities.  For this reason, he pledges to be punctual in making his repayments as he was with his previous loans.  Armando will invest the money he has requested in buying 200 sacks of natural fertilizers to spread over his next crop of potatoes.  He will also buy an additional cow so that he can continue making progress in his business.

loans.use: to buy 200 sacks of fertilizer and a cow

loans.name: Union Y  Esfuerzo Group

texts.es:
Grupos solidario formado por tres socios microempresarias exitosa que tienen diferentes actividades como doña Cándida que se dedica a la venta de nacatamales y pan desde hace dos años, además tiene animales de patio como 20 gallinas, 6 patos, y 6 chompipes.(pavo)
El crédito lo utilizara en la compra de cerdo, hojas, arroz, leña, especies, sal, papas etc. y compra de alimentos para sus animales de patios.
Doña Mercedes se dedica a la venta de nacatamales desde hace 7 años en su domicilio, doña Brígida hace sopas los fines de semanas, en su domicilio
texts.en:
This solidarity group is made up of three members, successful microentrepreneurs with different businesses. For example, Cándida has dedicated herself over the past two years to selling nacatamales [traditional Nicaraguan tamales] and bread. She also keeps domestic birds, including 20 hens, 6 ducks and 6 turkeys.

She will use the loan to buy pork, tamale wrappers, rice, firewood, spices, salt, potatoes, etc., and she will also buy feed for her domestic birds. 

Mercedes has worked for 7 years selling nacatamales from her home, while Brígida makes soups on the weekends at her home.

loans.use: to buy pork, tamale wrappers, spices, rice, etc.

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en:
Joyce is 43 years old, married to Genson, and blessed with three children, age 17, 12 and 8. 

She sells cereals, a business she started six years ago, and earns a monthly income of KES 15,000. She also practices dairy and poultry farming. 

She has requested a third loan of KES 100,000 to purchase 50 bags of maize. The profit from her business will help her educate her children. She hopes to do well in this business.

loans.use: To purchase 50 bags of maize for sale.

loans.name: Jeannine

texts.en:
Jeannine is 22 years old. 

She sells cows. She has been in the business for seven years. 

She wants the loan to buy more cows for sale. The profits from the business will be used for buying a house that will be used as her home.

loans.use: To buy more cattle for sale.

loans.name: Nuha

texts.en:
Due to cultural reasons Nuha prefers that her photo is not on the Internet; thus the above photo is of her mother. 

Nuha is a 31-year-old married woman from Al Russeifeh, Jordan, who has three family members. 

She is requesting a loan of 400 JOD to pay for her home improvements. She would like to buy new furniture. In the future she hopes to provide a good environment to live in.

loans.use: to pay for her home improvements.

loans.name: Epiphanie

texts.en: Epiphanie is 27 years old. She sells domestic animals. She has been in the business for 8 years. She wants the loan to buy more cows to slaughter for meat selling in her butchery. The profits from the business will be used to buy a house.

loans.use: to buy more meat to sell.

loans.name: Cruz Alexandra

texts.es:
EL Banco Comunal 1 De Agosto se reúne cada quince días en el Cantón Montecristi  conocido por su rica cultura pre colonial y por su artesanía que es reconocida a nivel nacional e internacional. Lugar de los famosos sombreros de paja toquilla.

La señora Alexandra, tiene 28 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tiene una hija de 9 años que estudia en escuela. Su esposo es radiotécnico.

Ella  junto a su esposo tienen dos locales en los cuales arreglan todo tipo de artefactos eléctricos como: Tv, cámaras fotográficas, radios, entre otros muchos artefactos. También venden los repuestos que se requieren para arreglar dichos artefactos, mientras su esposo trabaja en Montecristi ella se encarga del otro  local que tienen en La Pila, con ellos trabajan dos personas uno en cada local, trabajan todos los días desde las 8h00 hasta las 17h00 y los sabados y domingos hasta las 12h00, llevan en su negocio 8 años y gracias a Dios casi nunca les ha faltado trabajo y esto es por el buen trabajo que realizan.

Este crédito es para comprar repuestos eléctricos y aceites. Es socia fundadora del Banco comunal y le gusta porque  con los créditos han ido aumentado su negocio.
 
Sus sueños son seguir trabajando y agrandar más el negocio.
texts.en:
The “Primero de Agosto” Communal Bank holds a meeting every 15 days in the Montecristi township, known for its rich pre-colonial culture and its crafts that have national and international recognition. Place where you can also find the famous Paja Toquilla (straw) hats. 

Alexandra is 28 years old, she is married and has a 9-year old daughter that goes to school. Her husband is a radio repairman. Together, they own two stores where they fix all type of electronics: TV, cameras, radios, among others. They also sell the repair pieces needed to fix these items. While her husband works at the Montecristi store, she manages the store at La Pila. They have two other people that work with them; one on each location. Their hours of operation are weekdays from 8 a.m. to 5 p.m., and weekends from 8 a.m. to 12 p.m. Their business is 8 years old, and they have constant business due to the quality work they deliver to their customers. This loan is to purchase repair pieces for electronics and oils. 

Alexandra is one of the founders of her community bank, and she likes that the credits have allowed her business to grow. She dreams to continue working and continue to grow their business.

loans.use: To purchase repair pieces for electronics and oils.

loans.name: Dorotea

texts.es:
Dorotea, de 54 años es una mujer sencilla. Vive en compañía de sus hijos en la casa que compró hace algunos años. Toda su vida la dedicó al cuidado de sus hijos a quienes quiere mucho, “soy padre y madre para ellos”, comenta. Es así que día a día su inspiración y esfuerzo se ve reflejado en los estudios de ellos. Uno se encuentra estudiando en la universidad, mientras el otro solo está en preparatoria. Todas las mañanas desde las primeras horas del día se levanta a trabajar como peón en diversos sembríos donde recibe un sueldo diario, que le permite sustentar los gastos diarios del hogar. Aprovecha el tiempo libre que tiene para poder desarrollar el talento del tejido, siempre lleva en su bolsa los palos y lanas para poder tejer los gorros, chalinas y chompas. Que vende posteriormente a los clientes que gano durante muchos años de esfuerzo.  Ahora desea trabajar con mucho más esmero, pues pronto culminarán los estudios superiores de su hijo. Este es el quinto crédito con MFP, por lo que agradece el apoyo otorgado, pues le ayudó a cubrir algunos gastos de su negocio. Promete ser una persona responsable y pagar puntual sus cuotas.
Dorotea, invertirá el dinero en la compra de madejas de lana para sus tejidos, pues de esa manera ahorrará dinero si compra al por mayor.
texts.en:
54-year-old Dorotea is an unassuming woman who lives together with her children in a house that she bought some years ago.  She has devoted her entire life to caring for her children whom she loves very much.  "I am their father and their mother", she says.  Dorotea's inspiration and hard work are reflected daily in her children's studies.  One of her children is studying at university whilst the other is still in high school.

Every morning, Dorotea gets up at the crack of dawn to go and work as a farm laborer, for which she receives a daily wage.  This allows her to meet her daily household expenses.  She makes the most of any free time she has to put her knitting skills to use.  She always carries her knitting needles and yarn in her bag with her so that she can knit hats, scarves and sweaters which she then sells to customers who she has gained through her hard work over the years.  Now Dorotea would like to work a lot more carefully as her son will soon finish his higher education.

This is Dorotea's fifth loan from MFP and she is grateful for the support she receives as it has helped her to cover some of her business expenses.  She pledges to be a responsible person and make her loan repayments on time.  Dorotea will invest her money in buying skeins of yarn for her knitting.  She will save money by buying wholesale.

loans.use: to buy skeins of yarn in different colors

loans.name: Khitam

texts.en: Khitam is a 43-year-old married woman who has three family members from Al Russeifeh, Jordan. She is requesting a loan of 400 JD to pay for her home improvements. She would like to buy new furniture and household. In the future she wants to open a project for her family and she hopes to buy a new home.

loans.use: to pay for her home improvements

loans.name: Erick

texts.en:
Erick is 29 years old, married to Caroline, and blessed with three school-aged children.He provides transport services using his motorbike, a business he ventured into two years ago, and earns a monthly income of KES. 8,000. 

He wants to service his motorbike and has requested for a first loan of KES 11,000. The profit he makes from his business will contribute towards him buying another new motorbike for additional income. 


His dream is to see his business prosper as well as bring up a happy family.

loans.use: To purchase spare parts for repairing and maintaining his motorbike.

loans.name: Paula Eleodora

texts.es:
EL Banco Comunal Primero de Agosto se reúne cada quince días en el Cantón Montecristi, conocido por su rica cultura pre colonial y por su artesanía que es reconocida a nivel nacional e internacional. Lugar de los famosos sombreros de paja toquilla.

La señora Paula tiene 63 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen tres hijos los mismos que ya son mayores de edad e independientes, solo uno de ellos aún viven en su casa. Su esposo trabaja en el Municipio de Montecristi.

Ella es una muy buena ama de casa que para ayudar con los gastos que genera el hogar se dedica a preparar y vender bocadillos y comida rápida, ella prepara deliciosas empanadas, hornado (plato típico), corviches,  jugos de frutas, sodas entre otras cosas que prepara y vende. También prepara almuerzos y meriendas pero solo para entregar. Trabaja todos los días desde las 8h00 hasta las 15h00 y los días que más vende son los sabados y domingos, lleva más de 8 años dedicada a esta actividad y le va bien ya que cada dia tiene más clientes y más encargos de almuerzos.

Este crédito lo va utilizar en comprar aceite, plátanos, pescado, maní y otros víveres para la preparación de los alimentos. Está en el Banco Comunal desde el inicio  y le gusta por la ayuda que le dan con los créditos.
 
Su sueño es tener un gran restaurante.
texts.en:
The “Primero de Agosto” Communal Bank holds a meeting every 15 days in the Montecristi township, known for its rich pre-colonial culture and its crafts, that have national and international recognition. Place where you can also find the famous Paja Toquilla (straw) hats.

Paula is 63 years old, she is married and has three adult and independent children, one still lives at home. Her husband works for the Montecristi Municipality. She is a very good housewife that in order to help with home expenses, she cooks and sells snacks and fast food. She prepares delicious empanadas, roast pig (hornado, a traditional dish), corviches (croaker ceviche), fruit juices, sodas, and other items. She also cooks lunch and dinner for takeout only. She works every day from 8 a.m. to 3 p.m., Saturday and Sunday are her more popular days. She has been running her business for 8 years, and it is going very well. Every day she has new customers, and more lunch takeout orders. 

She plans to use this loan to purchase oil, plantain, fish, peanuts and other food to prepare her meals. She participates in the Communal Bank since its beginning, and she likes the help that these loans provide. 

Her dream is to have a great big restaurant.

loans.use: To purchase oil, plantain, fish, peanuts and other food.

loans.name: Egide

texts.en: Egide is 39 years old. He owns a supermarket with various merchandise. He has been running the business for one year. He wants the loan to add more items such as mineral water, biscuits and juice for sale. The profits from the business will be used for paying school fees.

loans.use: to buy more items such as biscuits, sodas, snacks, and beverages to sell.

loans.name: Elias

texts.en:
Elias lives in the town of Ibanda in the Fort Portal region of Uganda. He is married and has two children who are both currently in school. For the past three years, Elias has been working hard to manage his restaurant, which serves local foods for all meals. 

To help expand his business, Elias has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more foods to cook and serve like "matoke" (plantains), beans and cassava, and will help Elias to generate greater profits and grow his daily income. Elias hopes that in the future he will be able to enlarge his restaurant. 

Elias is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Elias who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to serve local foods like "matoke", beans and cassava

loans.name: Cate

texts.en:
Cate is a first-time borrower with Ugafode Microfinance Ltd. She runs a kiosk at Kyotera Central Market, dealing in foodstuffs and home appliances.

Cate divorced her husband 10 years ago and decided to start up her small business that caters for her well-being and personal development. She has been in this business for the last three years and hopes to use this loan to pay school fees for her siblings and to invest part of it into her business. 

In addition to the business, Cate has a plantation where she earns some small income through the sale of bananas. Cate has been described as a humble and hardworking person. She applied for a loan of 1,500,000 shillings to buy shop items and also pay school fees.

loans.use: To buy shop items and pay school fees for her siblings.

loans.name: Resmu

texts.en: Resmu is 36 years old. He has a motorcycle, which acts as his business in terms of transporting. He has spent 10 years working as a motorcyclist. He wants the loan to buy an extra motorbike to make more earnings. The profits from the business will be used for building a house.

loans.use: To buy another motorcycle for use in transportation as another source of income.

loans.name: Grigor

texts.en:
Grigor lives in Meghri town with his wife and 10-year-old son. Grigor runs a farm, where he breeds cows and grows different types of fruit trees (apricot, peach, cherry, granate, walnut, persimmon). 

Grigor would like to increase the number of cattle he has in order to gather more milk. With the requested loan, Grigor plans to purchase three cows. This will allow him to sell more milk and get additional income, which he will invest in purchasing more cattle in the future.

loans.use: to pay for three cows.

loans.name: Las Positivas Group

texts.es:
¡Buenas tardes! Esta es Ines, la tesorera de la Alcancía Comunal “Las Positivas”, un grupo conformado por 10 socios responsables y comprometidos con el Programa Prosperidad y que en este momento pasan a su 8º ciclo.

Ines actualmente dedicase a la venta de ropas para niños y adultos, siendo sus mayores clientes familiares y vecinos de la zona. 

Ines está muy feliz con el préstamo y con él quiere comprar ropas como polos, pantalones, casacas y de esta manera tener más variedad de ropas para ofrecer a sus clientes.

Ines es casada y madre de 3 hijos. Con mucho esfuerzo y trabajo, ha logrado mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia. Su mayor deseo ahora es instalar una boutique donde pueda ofrecer sus prendas de vestir.

Ines es la primera del lado izquierdo y viste casaca roja y pantalón azul. ¡Ines agradece a los prestamistas Kiva por la ayuda brindada!
texts.en:
Good afternoon!  This is Ines, the treasurer of the 'Las Positivas' community bank.  This group has 10 responsible members who are all committed to working within the Prosperity Program.  They are currently on their 8th loan cycle.

Ines works selling children's and adults' clothing.  Most of her customers are neighbors and family members.

Ines is very happy to be receiving her loan and she would like to use it to buy clothing such as tops, pants and jackets.  This will give her a wider range of clothing to offer her customers.

Ines is married and the mother of three children.  With a lot of hard work and effort, she has managed to improve her family's quality of life.  Her biggest wish is to set up a small clothing store in which she can sell her merchandise.

Ines is the lady on the far left who is wearing a red jacket and blue pants.  Ines is grateful to Kiva lenders for their help!

loans.use: to buy items of clothing including tops, pants and jackets

loans.name: Olga Maria

texts.es:
Doña Olga es una microempresaria emprendedora que se dedica a la venta de ropa nueva, zapatos, cosméticos quien los vende en su comunidad, esta actividad la viene realizando desde hace varios años y de esta manera a salido adelante con su familia.
El crédito lo invertirá para compra de ropa nueva, pantalones, blusas, tobilleras etc.
texts.en: Olga is an entrepreneurial micro-businesswoman who sells new clothing, shoes and cosmetics in her community.  She has been in this business for a number of years and it is how she provides for her family.  She will invest her loan in buying new clothing, pants, blouses, ankle socks, etc.

loans.use: to buy shoes, clothing, perfumes, makeup, etc.

loans.name: Gema Monserrate

texts.es:
En la  parroquia Calderón de la ciudad de Portoviejo,  cada quince días se  reúnen las socias del Banco Comunal Pimpiguasi En Progreso. Este lugar se lo conoce por su rica gastronomía y su vegetación, la mayoría de sus habitantes se dedican a la agricultura y comercio en general.

La señorita Gema tiene 22 años de edad, está soltera y estudia Tecnología Médica, vive en la casa de los padres. Esta desde el inicio en el Banco Comunal y le gusta porque gracias a los créditos  ha podido salir adelante en su negocio y con sus ganancias seguir con sus estudios.

Ella es una gran estudiante que deja todo su esfuerzo para obtener su titulo y también se dedica al comercio, tiene una pequeña heladería en su casa en la cual vende helados de una marca nacional y también realiza recargas telefónicas de varias operadoras con lo cual se gana algo extra, trabaja todo los días más que todo en las tardes ya que estudia en la mañana, pero esas horas su mamá se hace cargo del negocio, lleva más de dos años con su negocio el cual le permite salir adelante.
 
Este crédito lo va emplear en comprar helados y recargas telefónicas.
 
Sus sueños son terminar sus estudios y ser una gran profesional.
texts.en:
In the Calderon parish of Portoviejo city, every 15 days the "Pimpiguasi En Progreso" Communal Bank members meet. This place is known for its delicious cuisine and its vegetation, most of its people work in agriculture and general commerce. 

Gema is 22 years old, she is single, lives with her parents, and is going to school to become a Medical Technologist. She has been a member of the Communal Bank from its beginning and thanks to its loans, she has been able to get ahead with her business that helps her afford her studies. She is a good student and works very hard to earn her degree. 

Her small business is an ice cream shop that she runs from her home. She sells national brand ice creams, and mobile phone credit for several carries that supplements her income. She works every day, mostly in the afternoons because she studies in the morning. Her mother takes care of the business during the morning. She has run this business for 2 years, and it has helped her get ahead. She plans to use this loan to purchase more ice cream, and pre-paid mobile phone credit. 

Her dream is to finish her studies, and become a great professional woman.

loans.use: To purchase ice cream, and pre-paid mobile phone credit.

loans.name: Janet

texts.en:
Janet lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married with two children, and both her children go to school. She also takes care of additional family members (old parents). 

She operates a drug shop. She sells her products on a retail basis. She has been in business for the last eight years. She works six days a week. 

She has requested a loan of 400,000 Uganda shillings from MCDT – SACCO to buy more drugs like syrups and tablets. Her major business challenges are the increasing prices of drugs and seasonality. Her goals and aspirations are to start providing family-planning services and also to own a fully  stocked drug shop and to build a house. 

She lives in a rented house, and the family has access to electricity but does not have access to piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees and rent.

loans.use: To buy more syrups and tablets.

loans.name: Khlood

texts.en: Khlood is a 33-year-old married woman from Al Russeifeh, Jordan. She is requesting a loan of 500 Jordan dinar (JD) to pay for her home improvements; she wants to do maintenance on the home and buy some household goods. In the future, she hopes to improve her living standards.

loans.use: to pay for her home improvements .

loans.name: Clarisse

texts.en: Clarisse is 26 years old. She sells meat from slaughtered cows. She has been in the business for 12 years. She wants the loan to buy more cows; from them, she'll get meat to sell. The profits from the business will be used to buy a house in which to live.

loans.use: To buy meat to sell.

loans.name: Carmen Auxiliadora

texts.es:
En la  parroquia Calderón de la ciudad de Portoviejo,  cada quince días se  reúnen las socias del Banco Comunal Pimpiguasi En Progreso. Este lugar se lo conoce por su rica gastronomía y su vegetación, la mayoría de sus habitantes se dedican a la agricultura y comercio en general.

La señora Carmen tiene 33 años de edad, es madre soltera de cuatro hijos de 15, 13, 11 y de 4 años de edad, los  tres mayores estudian en colegio.
  
Doña Carmen para salir adelante ya es sola con sus hijos se dedica desde hace dos años atrás a administrar el bar de una escuela de la localidad, allí vende todo tipo de alimentos nutritivos que ella misma prepara para que los niños coman saludable como corviches, empanadas de verde, ceviches, entre otros alimentos pero siempre variando el menú para que los niños no se cansen de lo mismo, también vende jugos de fruta naturales lo cual les encanta a los niños por lo cual está muy contenta.

Este crédito lo va utilizar en comprar víveres para la preparación de los alimentos. Está en el Banco Comunal desde hace 4 ciclos  y le gusta por la ayuda que le dan a pesar de que es una mujer sola.
 
Su sueño es darles una buena educación a sus hijos.
texts.en:
In the Calderon parish of Portoviejo city, every 15 days the "Pimpiguasi En Progreso" Communal Bank members meet. This place is known for its delicious cuisine and its vegetation, most of its people work in agriculture and general commerce. 

Carmen is 33 years old, and a single mother of four children: 15, 13, 11, and 4 years old. The oldest three go to high school. In order to get ahead as a single mother, Carmen has been working at a local school cafeteria for 2 years. She prepares and sells a variety of nutritional food for the kids. Her menu includes Corviches (croaker ceviche), plantain empanadas, ceviches, and other items that she rotates because kids enjoy the variety. She also sells natural fruit juices that the kids love, and this makes her happy. 

She plans to use this loan to purchase food items for the preparation of her meals. She has participated in the Communal Bank for four cycles, and she appreciates the help they provide even though she is a single mother. 

Her dream is to provide her kids with a good education.

loans.use: To purchase food items

loans.name: Yecenia

texts.es:
La señora Yecenia de 40 años de edad es casada, vive con sus cinco hijos, y su esposo en su casa de habitación, ubicada en la aldea Agua Zarca, San Lorenzo, Valle, se dedica desde hace varios años al negocio de venta de tortillas, actividad con la cual ha sacado adelante a su familia, su venta es en su casa sus cliente que ha diario le visitan son de la misma comunidad, Doña Yecenia es una mujer muy humilde y con gran deseo de seguir adelante.
Doña Yecenia esta solicitando 6,000.00 lempiras para compra de maíz, leña y cal que son la materia prima para elaborar las tortillas. Con el apoyo de este préstamo Doña Yecenia desea comprar estos productos que son lo que ella necesita para seguir trabajando.
El sueño de Doña Yecenia es que sus hijos se le gradúen y trabajen para que colaboren con la economía del hogar.
San Lorenzo, Honduras - Septiembre  del 2012.
texts.en:
Yecenia, 40, is married and lives with her five children and her husband in her own home in the town of Agua Zarca, San Lorenzo, Valle.  For several years she has made a living selling tortillas, work with which she has gotten her family ahead.  Her business is in her house, where her customers who visit her daily are from the same community.  Yecenia's a very modest woman with a great desire to get ahead.

Yecenia is requesting 6,000 lempiras [HNL] to buy corn, firewood, and lime, which are the raw materials for making tortillas.  With the support of this loan Yecenia wants to buy these products she needs to continue working.

Yecenia's dream is for her children to graduate and get jobs to contribute to the household expenses.

San Lorenzo, Honduras, September 2012

loans.use: to buy firewood, lime, and corn

loans.name: Sulinda Robertina

texts.es:
En la  parroquia Calderón de la ciudad de Portoviejo,  cada quince días se  reúnen las socias del Banco Comunal Pimpiguasi En Progreso. Este lugar se lo conoce por su rica gastronomía y su vegetación, la mayoría de sus habitantes se dedican a la agricultura y comercio en general.

La señora Sulinda tiene 52 años de edad, hace varios años su querido esposo falleció y quedo sola, pero de esta relación tuvo cuatro hijos que son mayores de edad y uno  de ellos aun vive con ella.
 
Doña Sulinda en sociedad con una de sus hijas se dedican a la venta de ropa de todo tipo, ellas todos los días instalan un pequeño local en el centro de la ciudad de Portoviejo en el cual venden su mercadería a las personas que a diario pasan por el lugar, trabajan todos los días desde las 08h00 hasta las 18h00 que recogen todo, guardan y regresan a su casa aunque ellas allí también venden en la noche si alguno de sus clientes de la localidad así lo quieren.  Llevan más de 10 años con su negocio el cual le ha permitido salir adelante.

Este crédito lo va emplear en comprar más mercadería como: pantalones, blusas, camisetas y ropa de niños. Está en el Banco Comunal desde hace cinco ciclos  y le gusta porque los créditos le ayudan mucho en su negocio.

Su sueño es tener su local  propio  y en un lugar fijo.
texts.en:
In the Calderon parish of Portoviejo city, every 15 days the "Pimpiguasi En Progreso" Communal Bank members meet. This place is known for its delicious cuisine and its vegetation, most of its people work in agriculture and general commerce.

Sulinda is 52 years old, and several years ago her husband died leaving her without a partner. From her marriage she has 4 adult children, and one still lives at home. Sulinda, in partnership with one of her daughters, sells clothes.  Every day, they set up a small area in the downtown of the city of Portoviejo, where they sell merchandise to the daily commuters. They work every day from 8 a.m. to 6 p.m., at the end of the day they pick up the merchandise, go back home, and if any of their local customers request it, they are available to sell during the night . 

They have been running their business for 10 years now, and it has helped them to get ahead. With this loan, they plan to purchase more merchandise such us: pants, blouses, t-shirts and children clothes. Sulinda has participated with the Communal Bank for five cycles, and she appreciates how much the loans help her business. 

She dreams of one day have her own store in a fixed location.

loans.use: To purchase pants, blouses, t-shirts and children's clothes.

loans.name: Chantal

texts.en:
Chantal is 21 years old. She sells skirts. She has been in the business for three years. 

Chantal wants the loan to buy more skirts for sale. The profits from the business will be used for building a house.

loans.use: to buy more skirts for sale.

loans.name: Clothilde

texts.en: Clothilde is 40 years old. She sells different items in the boutique that she has been running for 4 years. She wants the loan to buy more sugar, rice and salt to sell. The profits from her business will be used for building a house.

loans.use: To buy more retail items to sell

loans.name: Bakhtim

texts.en: Bakhtim lives in Kechut village, Vayots Dzor region with her 2 daughters and son. Bakhtim's son is a police officer, and her older daughter works at the local school of arts. Bakhtim runs a farm, where she raises cows and lambs. Bakhtim would like to increase the number of cattle, which will allow her to gather more income from cattle breeding. She has applied for this loan to purchase a cow and a calf, as well as forage to feed the cattle. Additional income is important for Bakhtim to cover her household costs and sustain her children with prosperous life.

loans.use: to pay for a cow, a calf and forage

location.town: Kechut village of Vayots Dzor region

loans.name: Bernadette

texts.en: Bernadette is 25 years old. She sells sweaters and has been in the business for 2 years. She wants the loan to buy more sweaters for sale. The profits from the business will be used for building a house.

loans.use: To buy more clothes for sale.

loans.name: Teopista

texts.en:
Teopista lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is a single mother of four children and three of her children go to school. She also takes care of three additional family members. Teopista lives in a rented house and the family has no access to electricity or piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees and rent.

Teopista sells fruits and vegetables at the market. She sells her products on a retail basis. She has been in this business for the last 3 years. She works seven days a week. Teopista has requested a loan of 300,000 UGX from MCDT – SACCO to buy passion fruits, greens, onions and pineapples. Her major business challenges are transportation and seasonality. Her goals and aspirations are to expand her business so as to serve more customers and also buy a plot of land so that she can build her own house.

loans.use: To buy more passion fruits, greens, onions and pineapples

loans.name: Epaphrodite

texts.en: Epaphrodite is 36 years old. He sells suites and trousers and has been in the business for 12 years. He wants the loan to buy more trousers for sale. The profits from the business will be used for making savings.

loans.use: To buy more clothes for sale.

loans.name: Charlotte

texts.en: Charlotte is 31. She is married and has two children, ages between 3 months and 2 years. Charlotte sells shoes and has spent two years in the business. She wants this loan to buy more shoes for sale. The profits from the business will be used to make more savings for a better future.

loans.use: to buy more shoes for sale

loans.name: Kiriana

texts.es:
La soci se sigue dedicando al negocio de crianza de animales,la socia cria cuyes y gallinas,la socia los hace engordar y crecer y luego los vende en los diferentes mercados,la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 6:00 p.m,la socia se dedica a este negocio 6 años y el va muy bien,por medio de este negocio la socia quiere salir adelante,el sueño de la socia es tener un local donde pueda vender los animales.La socia solicita el credito para comprar cuyes,gallinas y alimentos para los animales.

La socia esta contenta con el crediot otorgado y se compromete a pagar sus cuotas
texts.en:
Kiriana’s business is raising animals.  She raises guinea pigs and chickens; she fattens them and makes them grow.  She later sells them at different markets.  She works from 8:00 a.m. until 6:00 p.m.  She has had this business for six years, and it is going very well for her.

It is through this business that she wants to get ahead.  Her dream is to have a place where she is able to sell the animals.  She is requesting the loan to buy guinea pigs, chickens, and feed for the animals.  She is happy about the loan that was granted, and she pledges to make her payments.

loans.use: to buy guinea pigs, chickens, and feed for the animals.

loans.name: Adounsi Helene

texts.fr: Hélène est âgée 49 ans, mariée et mère de cinq enfants dont trois sont scolarisés. Le plus âgé a 28ans et le moins a 15ans. Elle a une boutique sise à domicile où elle vend de divers et des boissons depuis quelques années. Elle s'approvisionne dans l'un des marchés du Bénin. Dans le souci de renforcer son activité et de satisfaire la demande de ses clients, elle a fait recours au financement de Finadev afin d'en tirer d'énorme profit et de participer à la scolarisation de ses enfants.
texts.en:
Hélène is 49 years old, married, and a mother of 5 children, of whom 3 have been to school. Her oldest child is 28 years old and the youngest is 15 years old. 

She has a store located in her home where she has been selling various goods and drinks for the past few years. She gets her supplies in one of the markets in Benin. 

In order to strengthen her business and satisfy customer requests, she has turned to Finadev for financing, in order to make a large profit and to contribute to the schooling of her children.

loans.use: to buy 1 box of milk, 1 box of sardines, 1 box of spaghetti, 5 cases of beer, and 5 cases of candy

loans.name: Haruna

texts.en:
Haruna is 35 years old and lives in the town of Kijura in the Hioma region of Uganda. He is married and has four children with two of them currently in school. For the past 7 years, Haruna has been working hard to manage his small boutique shop which sells clothes. 

To help expand his business, Haruna has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more clothes for resale and will help Haruna to generate greater profits and manage to pay school fees for his children. Haruna hopes that in the future he will be able to expand the business into a wholesale shop. 

Haruna is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP). The program primarily serves microentrepreneurs like Haruna who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy more clothes for resale.

loans.name: Amalia Del Carmen

texts.es:
Doña Amalia del Carmen microempresaria de éxito se dedica a elaborar pan desde hace 8 años, su pequeño taller cuenta con varios trabajadores, su producto los vende en la comunidad.
EL crédito lo utilizara para la compra de harina, mantequilla, levadura, leñas etc.
texts.en:
Amalia del Carmen, a successful micro-entreprenuer, has been baking bread for some 8 years. Her small shop can count on various workers and her products sell in the community.

Amalia's loan will be used for purchasing wheat flour, butter, yeast, firewood, etc.

loans.use: buy flour, yeast, firewood, butter, etc., for baking bread to sell.

loans.name: Etibor

texts.ru: Этибору 29 лет. Она разведена и не имеет детей. Она живет с родителями и сестрой. Она почти 3 месяца занимается бизнесом. Она занимается шитьем женской одежды.
