Ее сестра помогает ей в ведении бизнеса. Она хочет купить новую швейную машинку, но не имеет средства для этого. Она запрашивает займ на сумму 1500 сомони для покупки швейной машинки, чтобы развивать новый бизнес. Она ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en: Etibor is 29 years old, divorced, and has no children. She lives with her parents and her sister. For nearly 3 months, Etibor has been in the business of sewing women's clothing, and her sister helps her out. Etibor wants to buy a new sewing machine, but does not have the financial means to do so. She is seeking a loan in the amount of 1,500 Tajikistan Somoni to buy a new sewing machine so she can develop her new business. Etibor is waiting for your kind assistance.

loans.use: To buy a sewing machine for her new business

loans.name: Victor

texts.es:
Víctor, de 42 años, es un hombre amable y muy trabajador, además de tener muchas ganas de salir adelante. Es conviviente con Victoria quien se dedica al comercio y es madre de sus 02 hijos.  Vive en su casa propia solo a lado de su pareja y sus 02 hijos  a quien desea brindar una mejor calidad de vida. A diario la tienda de abarrotes de Víctor siempre se encuentra abierta desde muy temprano, es por eso que sus múltiples clientes van en busca de algún artículo o producto de primera necesidad ya que saben que lo encontraran y que serán atendidos con su amplia sonrisa y un buen trato.  Su negocio está ubicado en un espacio que acondiciono en su casa, atendiendo  desde hace 8 años.  Viene realizando éste trabajo que inició al ver la necesidad de satisfacer algunas necesidades de su hogar.
Considera su negocio bastante rentable por las buenas ganancias que le deja.
Le gusta su negocio pues no tiene que salir mucho de casa  y puede apoyar a sus hijos con las tareas escolares. Agradece mucho  el apoyo que le brinda su menor  hija,  quien está siempre a su lado para ayudarle algunas veces en la atención de sus clientes, ahora desea seguir trabajando mucho y poder comenzar a ampliar y ofrecer mayor variedad de productos a sus clientes. Este es el crédito número 10 con MFP, está muy contento de saber que tiene un apoyo financiero, ya que así se sentirá segura de avanzar con su negocio.  Por otro lado ella se compromete una vez más a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas de manera puntual, ya que no desea quedar mal con su grupo, ya que todos son muy puntuales. Con el monto solicitado 4000 soles, comprará productos y mercadería como arroz, azúcar, aceites, golosinas, bebidas gasificadas y otros, para poder ofrecer en mayor cantidad y variedad a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Victor is 42 years old. He is a friendly and hardworking man, in addition to having a strong desire to succeed. He is living with Victoria who is a merchant and is the mother of their 2 children. He lives in his own house only with his partner and their 2 children for whom they want to provide a better quality of life.You will always find Victor's grocery store open very early on a daily basis. It is for that reason that multiple customers come here to look for an article or product of basic need because they know they will find it and that they will be attended to with his wide smile and good service. His business is located in an air conditioned space in his house, operating for 8 years. Doing this work, he has begun to see the satisfaction of some of the household needs.
He considers his business sufficiently profitable by the good earnings thus far.
He likes his business as he doesn't have to go out of the house much and can support his children with the school work. He appreciates very much the help that his youngest provides, who is always by their side to help him sometimes with attending to customers. Now he wants to continue working hard and be able to begin to expand and offer a greater variety in products to his customers. This is the 10th loan with MFP. He is very happy to know that he has financial support, because he will feel secure in advancing his business. He also promises again to comply with the payments in a punctual manner, as he doesn't want to look bad to his group, as everyone is every punctual. With the requested amount, 4000 soles, he will buy products and merchandise like rice, sugar, oil, sweets, soft drinks etc. in order to be able to offer a greater number and variety of products to his customers.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, oils, sweets, soft drinks, etc. in order to offer an increased number and variety of products to his customers.

loans.name: Marcelline

texts.en: Marcelline is 36 years old and is married to a farmer. They have six children, all of whom go to school. She sells charcoal. She has been in business for 12 years. She wants the loan to buy more sacks of charcoal for resale. The profits from the business will be used to pay school fees for all the children.

loans.use: To buy more sacks of charcoal for resale.

loans.name: Tamer

texts.en:
Tamer is 21 years old and from Gaza. He owns a food stall in the vegetable market, in which he has been sellling fruits and vegetables since 2010.

Tamer has asked Ryada for this youth loan in order to buy a small automobile and boxes for the vegetables he sells. He hopes that this loan will help him improve his income and his financial situation and help him approach his dream of having a big shop for fruits and vegetables.

loans.use: to buy a small automobile and boxes for the vegetables he sells

loans.name: Esther

texts.en: Esther is 26 years. She is married and has one child. She sells rice and cooking oil, and has spent 3 years in the business. She wants to use this loan to buy more rice and cooking oil to sell. The profits from the business will be used to buy a house she dreams to live in in the future

loans.use: To buy more rice and cooking oil to sell.

loans.name: Shazia

texts.en: It is said that behind every man’s success is a woman. And rightly so, as can be seen from the case of Ms Shazia. Her husband sells burgers in the market, but all the makings are prepared by the wife at home. She prepares ground meat (cutlas), chops the cabbage, and prepares the mixture to be used in making burgers. They have 6 children, and Shazia, with her husband's help, is striving to provide a better future for their children. In her free time, Shazia also does stitching, and the extra income helps her to provided much needed money for their family. Currently she needs 25,000 Rs to buy ingredients such as cabbage, tomato ketchup, buns, etc., so that they can continue the business without interruption.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for burgers, such as cabbage, tomato ketchup, buns, etc.

loans.name: Mohammad

texts.en:
Mohammad is 18 years old and from Gaza. He has asked Ryada for this start-up loan in order to start his own new business, a shop in which he sells cosmetics and perfumes to women. He hopes this loan will help him start his project, which will provide him with a good income to build his future.

Ryada's Startup Loan is exclusively for borrowers who are beginning new enterprises, not for existing projects. To qualify, a borrower must show a clear business plan and realistic potential for success. The borrower must also invest their own money and resources into at least 50 percent of the start-up enterprise. Ryada believes strongly in the potential of these borrowers and grants them a three-month grace period to help them get their business off the ground.

loans.use: to start a business selling cosmetics and perfumes.

loans.name: Hussein

texts.en:
Hussein is 21 years old and from Gaza. He owns an internet cafe in an area of Gaza where there is no other internet cafe.

Hussein has asked Ryada for this youth loan in order to buy more computers and display screens and to install shelves in the internet cafe. He hopes this loan will help him improve his income and thus his living conditions.

loans.use: buy more computer and display screens and to install shelves in his internet cafe.

loans.name: Twaha

texts.en:
Twaha is 49 years old and lives in the town of Bombo in the Luwero region of Uganda. He is married and has 4 children. For the past 12 years, Twaha has been working hard to manage his boutique, which sells clothes. 

To help expand his business, Twaha has requested a loan of 2,500,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy shoes, shirts and trousers for resale and will help Twaha to generate greater profits and provide for family needs like buying food and paying medical expenses. Twaha hopes that in the future he will be able to expand his business by adding diverse items that will attract more customers and earn more profits. 

Twaha is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Twaha who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy shoes, shirts and trousers for resale.

loans.name: Francisco

texts.es: Francisco de 49 años de edad, vive junto a su esposa Carmen de 37 años de edad; viven en casa propia junto a sus 02 hijos, a quienes desea brindarles un buen futuro. Francisco,  aun cuando era adolescente trabajaba en las tierras de sus padres y a la vez trabajaba como jornalero en distintas chacras, con sus ahorros acumulados compró su propio terreno donde viene trabajando 26 años de manera independiente y cuenta con cultivos de cacao y café.  Su producto más rentable es el cultivo de cacao, porque los vende a un buen precio. Los meses de Junio hasta Agosto; son tiempos donde mayormente se siembra todo tipo de plantas, razón por la cual Francisco, acude a la entidad Financiera para tramitar sus prestamos y llevar consigo uno de sus propósitos sembrar mas plantas de cacao. Los planes que tiene en mente es seguir sembrando y adquiriendo mas espacios de terreno para así sobresalir de la pobreza; por ahora su prioridad es terminar el acabado de su vivienda. Este es su crédito número 06, se siente alegre al saber que tendrá el apoyo financiero para seguir con sus planes de trabajo, asimismo, se compromete a pagar puntual sus cuotas. Agradece a su banco comunal por permitirle ser parte de ello. Con los 1,000 nuevos soles, comprará calamina para el techado de su casa.
texts.en:
Francisco, 49, lives with his wife Carmen, 37, in their own home.  They live together with their 2 children, for whom they want to provide a good future.  Even when he was an adolescent, Francisco was working on his parents' land, and he also used to work as a farmhand on various farms.  With the savings he accumulated, he bought his own land where he has been working independently for 26 years.  He cultivates cocoa and coffee.  His most profitable crop is cocoa, because he can sell it at a good price.  The months of June through August are when he plants all of his crops.  This is the reason why Francisco comes to this financial institution to apply for his loans, taking with him his goal of planting more cocoa plants.  

What Francisco has in mind is to continue to cultivate and also acquire more land so that he can lift himself out of poverty.  For now, his priority is to finish building his house.  This is his 6th loan, and he feels happy to know that he will have the financial support to continue with his work plans.  Also, he is committed to making his payments on time.  He thanks his communal bank for allowing him to become a part of their group.  With the 1,000 Peruvian soles he requests, he will buy sheets of corrugated metal roofing material for the roof of his house.

loans.use: to buy sheets of corrugated metal roofing material for the roof of his house

loans.name: Juana

texts.es:
Juana de 45 años de edad, esta casada con Jorge de 49 años de edad; viven en casa propia junto a sus 05 queridos hijos,  a quienes brindan lo mejor y desean un buen futuro. Con mucho esfuerzo Juana a logrado trabajar sus tierras y volverlas muy productivas, ella siembra plantas de cacao y café, productos un a vez cosechados los lleva a vender a los centros de acopio, donde las vende al por mayor. Sus cultivos le han dado los ingresos necesarios para mantenerse y ayudar con los gastos familiares, es por eso que desea poner todas sus ganas en sacar adelante este negocio.
Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es cuidar sus cultivos, ya que se siente muy feliz haciéndolo, lleva 24 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es transportar sus productos, en su faena rutinaria cuenta con el apoyo incondicional de su pareja quien es su brazo derecho. Juana con el crédito que obtuvo lo necesita para comprar varios sacos de abono para fertilizar sus tierras y volverlas productivas con el transcurso del tiempo. Más adelante, desea comprar nuevas tierras para incrementar sus cultivos. Este es su crédito número 04, se siente alegre por la colaboración de los financistas ya que así podrá seguir con sus planes de trabajo. En su banco comunal agradece a sus compañeros por permitirles trabajar con ellos.
Con los 1,000, nuevos soles comprará sacos de abono.
texts.en:
Juana, 45, is married to Jorge, 49. They live together in their own house with their 5 children, to whom they try to give the best lives and futures. 

With a lot of hard work, Juana has achieved success working on her lands and making them productive. She cultivates cacao and coffee plants, products which, once harvested, she sells to distributors at wholesale pricing. 

Her work has given her the necessary income to sustain herself and help with the family expenses. For this reason, she hopes to put all of her earnings towards her business' progress. 

Her favorite part of her job is looking after the plants because she is very happy doing it. 

She has 24 years of experience in this kind of work. She considers the hardest part of her job transporting the products. She has the unconditional support of her husband, whom she considers her right hand. 

With the credit she received, she needs to purchase numerous sacks of fertilizer to fertilize her lands and return them to productivity over the course of time. 

Much later, she hopes to buy more land to increase her cultivation. 

This is her fourth credit, and she feels happy because of the collaboration of her financiers, since she is now able to carryout her business plans. At her communal bank, she appreciates her associates for allowing her to work with them. 

With the 1,000 nuevos soles, she will purchase sacks of fertilizer.

loans.use: to buy sacks of fertilizer.

loans.name: Benta

texts.en:
Benta is 37 years single with three children. She has been in the grocery business for the last seven years, earning approximately KES.12,900 monthly. This is her fourth loan with KADET LTD, after successfully repaying her previous loans. 

She borrowed KES.80,000 and plans to use it to purchase vegetables and fruits for resale. She plans to plough the anticipated profits back into the grocery business. 

She hopes to expand her business, so as to earn more income.

loans.use: to purchase fruits and vegetables for resale.

loans.name: Bilal

texts.en: Bilal is 29 years old from Gaza. He owns a farm and plants seasonal vegetables such as radishes, arugula, etc. He asked Ryada for this youth loan in order to buy and install a greenhouse for the farm. This loan will help him improve his production of vegetables and thus improve his income.

loans.use: to buy and install a greenhouse for the farm

loans.name: Mujeres Unidas Dos Group

texts.es:
La señora Eusebia es casada, tiene 48 años de edad, cursó los 6 años de educación primaria, tiene 9 hijos 4 de los cuales estudian, se dedica a la crianza de animales y también a la elaboración de copal, inicio este negocio con una mínima cantidad de capital y hasta el momento lleva 12 años de elaborar copal y venderlo, cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo quien se dedica a la agricultura.

Organiza un grupo para solicitar un préstamo que le servirá para la compra de insumos para ampliar la cantidad de su producción y mejorar su ganancia, espera tener capital propio y amplio. Las demás integrantes se dedican a la crianza de animales y a la producción agrícola. Una de las integrantes de la foto no calificó para el préstamo.
texts.en:
Sra. Eusebia is 48 years old, married, and completed six years of her primary school education.  She has nine children, four of whom are in school.  Eusebia raises animals, but she also makes incense from the resin of the copal tree.  She started her business with a minimal amount of capital and has now been producing and selling copal incense for 12 years.  Eusebia has the support of her husband, who is a farmer.

She organized a group so that she could request a loan.  The money will be used to buy supplies so that she can increase her production and improve her earnings.  As a result, she hopes to have more capital of her own.  

The other members engage in raising livestock and farming.

loans.use: to buy supplies to make incense.

loans.name: Shahnaz

texts.en:
Ms Shahnaz is 40 years old, a vigorous married woman. She has doing business in the clothing trade for many years.  She is passionate about her work, and client demand is strong, but the business challenges, combined with the family expenditures she faces, frustrate her nearly every day. Her husband is employed in a factory and unable to provide for the needs of the family members by himself. He does not earn enough to support his family well, and Shahnaz is the best earnings resource in her household, as her embroidery patterns are very popular in her street.

She is a mother of three children. She wants to make her business grow, so she requested a loan of Rs 30000 to buy various designs of clothes in different colors to meet increasing demand. She is hoping to earn more profits through increased sales. She is also interested in opening her own shop in the market to display her work.

loans.use: to buy various designs of clothes in different colors.

loans.name: Manuel De Jesús

texts.es:
Don Manuel tiene 59 años de edad, es casado y tiene tres hijos. Desde muy pequeño se dedica a la agricultura, actividad que la aprendió de sus padres; pero también se desempeña como comerciante vende y compra cerdos, destaza cerdos los días sábados; actividad que realiza con su esposa y sus tres hijos. Sus dos hijos mayores venden pan de manera ambulante en bicicletas.  

Él viaja en autobús hasta la ciudad para comprar los fertilizantes para su cultivo de maíz y a buscar los cerdos para destazarlos. El préstamo que esta solicitando una parte será destinada a la compra de abono, pesticidas para su cultivo de maíz y la otra para comercializar con cerdos. Con la inversión su cultivo será más productivo; por lo que espera recibir mejores ganancias, a fin de mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia. Así como destinara buena parte de ella para comercializar con los cerdos. Con las ganancias, podrá brindar a su familia una buena alimentación y salud. Él planea comprar un vehiculo para transportar los cerdos que adquiere en los diferentes tiangues.
texts.en:
Manuel is 59 years old, married, and has 3 children.  Ever since he was very young, he has worked as a farmer, an occupation he learned from his parents.  However, he also works as a trader who buys and sells pigs, and slaughters pigs on Saturdays.  He carries out this work with his wife and their 3 children.  His 2 oldest children sell bread from place to place on their bicycles.

Manuel travels by bus to the city to buy fertilizers for his corn crops, and to look for pigs to slaughter.   He will use the loan that he is requesting to buy fertilizers and pesticides for his corn crops, and also to buy pigs to sell.  With this investment in his crops he will get a greater yield, and so he expects to increase his earnings so that he can improve his family's quality of life.  He will also benefit from the part of the loan that will be invested in buying pigs.  With these earnings, he will be able to feed his family well and provide for their good health.  He plans to buy a vehicle to transport the pigs that he acquires from the various markets.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and pesticides for his corn crops, and also to buy pigs to sell

loans.name: Emerance

texts.en: Emerance is 33 years old. She is married and has two children, ages 4 months and 10 years old. She sells clothes for ladies and has spent four years in the business. She wants this loan to buy more ladies clothes for sale. The profits from the business will be used to make more savings for a better future.

loans.use: to buy more trousers and skirts for sale.

loans.name: Gregorio

texts.es:
Gregorio, de 56 años, es un hombre trabajador y muy responsable. Es soltero y vive sin ningún familiar cerca de una localidad, ya que su familia se encuentra en la sierra del país.  Tiene una casa propia, desde donde día a día trabajaba para brindarse una mejor calidad de vida. El trabajo de Gregorio consiste en la agricultura, se dedica a la siembra y cosecha de dos productos fundamentales para la zona en la que vive, el cultivo de palma aceitera y la producción es vendida a una industria muy grande dedicada a la elaboración de aceite.  También se dedica al cultivo de cacao que es vendido a los diversos compradores que vienen de la capital en busca de estos productos ya que en la región se producen de los mejores en este fruto. Ambos cultivos son fomentados como alternativos al cultivo de hoja de coca. Lleva ya 06 años trabajando con el cacao y hace 04 años con la palma aceitera, lo hace solo y cuando hay temporadas de siembra y cosecha contrata a algunos trabajadores que le ayudan a cumplir con los pedidos a tiempo. Considera rentable su negocio por la demanda y las buenas ganancias que le deja.
Le gusta su trabajo pues está en contacto con la naturaleza y es un ambiente en el cual se siente muy cómodo, ama lo que hace, le va bien ya que está vendiendo su producto a un buen precio, espera,  más adelante poner una empresa dedicada a la transformación del cacao de materia prima a producto elaborado. Este es el  préstamo número 04 con la institución MFP, le está yendo bien hasta ahora y espera  seguir de esa manera en adelante, y manifiesta estar muy agradecido con la oportunidad que le dieron para poder introducir más inversión a sus productos. Con el monto solicitado 2000 soles, comprará abono para sus cultivos de palma aceitera y cacao, además contratará algunos trabajadores para que le ayuden en esta función.
texts.en:
Gregorio, who is 56 years old, is a hardworking and very responsible man. He is single and lives by himself near a town; all his family members live in the country's mountains. He has his own house, from which he works day after day to create a better quality of life for himself. Gregorio's work consists of farming; he earns his living planting and harvesting two fundamental crops of the region where he lives. He grows oil palms, and that yield is sold to a very big oil-producing company. He also grows cacao, which he sells to various buyers who come from the capital looking for cacao, since the region produces the best of that fruit. Both crops are encouraged as alternatives to growing coca leaves. Gregorio has been working with cacao for six years and oil palm for four years. He does this alone, and when it is planting or harvesting season, he contracts workers who help him fill his orders on time. He considers his business profitable because of the demand and the good earnings he is left with.

Gregorio likes his work because he is in contact with nature and it is an environment in which he feels very comfortable. He loves what he does and it's going well since he is selling his yield at a good price. He hopes in the future to set up a business processing the raw cacao.

This is Gregorio's fourth loan with the MFP institution, and it's going well so far. He hopes to continue progressing in this way, and he says he is very grateful for the opportunity that they have given him to be able to invest more in his crops. With the amount requested, 2000 soles (PEN), he will buy fertilizer for his oil palm and cacao crops, and he will contract some workers to help him with the work.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and contract day laborers.

loans.name: Anisia

texts.en: Anisia is 44 years old. She is married and has two children, ages 15 and 19 years old. She sells bedsheets and bedcovers. She has spent five years in the business. She wants this loan to buy more bedsheets and bedcovers for sale. The profits from the business will be used to renovate the house.

loans.use: to buy more bedsheets and bedcovers to sell.

loans.name: Berne

texts.en: Berne is 32 years old. She is married and has two children who are 6 and 10. They both go to school. Berne sells stoves and brooms. She has spent 13 years in the business. She wants this loan to buy more brooms for resale. The profits from the business will be used to buy a house.

loans.use: To buy more brooms for resale.

loans.name: Marie Rose

texts.en: Marie Rose is age 35. She is married and has two children, ages 5 and 7 years old. She sells trousers and has spent six years in the business. She wants this loan to buy more men's trousers for sale. The profits from the business will be used to renovate the house.

loans.use: to buy more trousers and shirts for sale

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en: Fatuma is lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married with four children, three of whom go to school. She has no additional family members. She operates a retail shop at the market. She has been in this business for the last two years.  She works six days a week.  She has requested a loan of Uganda shillings 200,000 from MCDT – SACCO to buy 50 kg of sugar, a jerycan of cooking oil, a bag of rice and 50 kg of beans. Her major business challenges are transportation and seasonality. Her goals and aspirations are to own a wholesale shop, educate her children up to university level and buy a plot of land. She lives in a rented house and the family has no access to electricity or piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees, rent and food.

loans.use: To buy sugar,cooking oil, rice and beans

loans.name: Sheriff's Group

texts.en:
Salone Microfinance Trust (SMT), a partner of Kiva.org in Makeni, Northern Sierra Leone, is pleased to present to you this group of borrowers from a primary school in Kenema city, Eastern Sierra Leone. Staff of this institution have come to SMT for a loan of 8,400,000 SLL for the second time in order to improve on their standards of living. Some of them will use this loan to buy house-building materials, some to buy pieces of furniture, others to pay school fees for their children, and so on. At the end of each month, their school’s bursar is directly responsible for deducting their repayment amount from their salaries in order to pay SMT/Kiva lenders.  

This is the second loan that this institution has applied for from SMT/Kiva lenders. Roston is the leader of this group. The 48-year-old man was born in a place call Kpuwabu, in Eastern Sierra Leone. He is a teacher and has been in the teaching profession for 21 years now. Roston is married and has five children: three in primary school and two in secondary school. Roston has requested this loan in order to buy house-building materials--bags of cement and iron-corrugated zincs--for the completion of a family house he began building with his first Kiva loan.

loans.use: to buy house-building materials

loans.name: Yohana Yasmin

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Portoviejo, capital de Manabí conocida desde hace muchos años  como la ciudad de los reales tamarindos, se reúnen cada quince días  las socias del Banco Comunal Av. Del Ejército.

La señora Yohana tiene 31 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene dos hijos de 10 y 8  años los mismos que estudian en escuela. El marido es comerciante.
 
Ella trabaja para un programa del Estado pero realiza el crédito para el esposo el cual lo utiliza en su negocio, él tiene un puesto en el centro de la ciudad en el cual se dedica a la venta de CD de toda clase tanto de música como de películas en todo formato, adema allí también realiza recargas y vende tarjetas telefónicas, él trabaja todos los días desde las 8h00 hasta las 18h00 y es así como él siempre se ha ganado el sustento de toda la familia durante los 8 años que lleva con este negocio.

Este crédito es para comprar tarjetas telefónicas y CD. Está en el Banco Comunal hace 4 ciclos, es la secretaria del grupo y le gusta porque los créditos son de gran ayuda a sus esposo.
 
Su sueño es tener un carro para poder trasladarse a su trabajo.
texts.en:
In the city of Portoviejo, the capital of Manabí Province, known for many years as the "City of the Royal Tamarind Trees," the partners of the Avenida del Ejército Communal Bank meet every fifteen days. Yohana is 31 years old and lives with her common-law husband with whom she has two children, a 10-year-old and an 8-year-old. Both her children go to school, and her husband is a retailer.

Yohana works for a government program, but is applying for a loan on behalf of her husband who will use it for his business. He has a stall in the centre of the city where he sells all different types of CDs, both music and films and in many formats. He also sells phone cards and offers top ups. He works everyday from 8am to 6pm, and has earned a living for his family this way since he set up the business 8 years ago.

The loan will buy phone cards and CDs. Yohana has been with the communal bank for 4 cycles, and she is the secretary of the group. She likes it because the loans she can get as a partner are very helpful for her husband. Her dream is to have a car to drive to work.

loans.use: to buy phone cards and CDs

loans.name: Abu Bakar S.'s Group

texts.en:
Salone Microfinance Trust (SMT), a partner of Kiva.org in Makeni, Northern Sierra Leone, is pleased to present to you this group of teachers from one of the primary schools in Kenema, a city in Eastern Sierra Leone. Teachers from this school have come to SMT for a loan of 13,000,000  Sierra Leonean leones in order to improve their standard of living. Some of them will use this loan to buy house building materials; some to buy pieces of furniture; others to pay school fees for their children and so on. At the end of each month, the school’s bursar is directly responsible to deduct their repayment amount and pays SMT/Kiva.  

Sahr is the leader of this group of teachers. Sahr, age 35, was born in Kailahun town in Eastern Sierra Leone. He is a teacher and has been in the teaching profession for 35 years now. Sahr is married to a teacher and they have four children: two in primary school, one in secondary school, and one not of school-going age. Sahr has requested this loan in order to pay school fees for his children.

loans.use: to pay school fees for his children

loans.name: Rose

texts.en: Rose is lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married with four children, three of whom go to school. She also takes care of two additional family members (Mother and Father). She sells second hand shoes at the market. She sells her products on a retail basis. She has been in business for the last 10 years. She also earns additional income from selling fried cassava and chapatti at a school. She works six days a week. She has requested a loan of Uganda shillings 200,000 from MCDT – SACCO to buy a bale of second hand shoes. Her major business challenges are transportation and seasonality. Her goals and aspirations are to become a wholesaler and to educate her children up to university level. She lives in her own house and the family has access to electricity but not to piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees and rent.

loans.use: To buy a bale of used shoes

loans.name: Jacqueline

texts.en: Jacqueline is 36 years old. She is married and has four children between 7 and 12 years old. She sells fresh milk and sodas and has spent four years in the business. She wants this loan to buy more fresh milk to sell. The profits from the business will be used to renovate her house.

loans.use: To buy more fresh milk and sodas for sale.

loans.name: Ibrahim's Group

texts.en:
Pictured here are primary school teachers from Kenema, a city in Eastern Sierra Leone. This group of teachers, like their counterparts in other SMT operational areas, has come to SMT to apply for a loan of 11,500,000 Sierra Leonean Leones in order to meet their immediate financial challenges. At the end of each month, they will repay the loan using their monthly salaries. 

Vandi is the featured leader of this group of teachers. Born in Bombohun, the 51-year-old is married to a businesswoman and the couple has six children attending primary, secondary and tertiary institutions. Vandi is a teacher and has been in the teaching profession for 40 years now. He is requesting this loan in order to pay school fees for his children.

loans.use: to pay school fees for his children

loans.name: Gs Unidos En La Fe Group

texts.es:
La Señora Gonzalina, se dedica al comercio su actividad principal es la venta de abarroteria (pulpería) desde hace mas de 9 años, Doña Gonzalina. Es una persona muy trabajadora,  ella cuenta con  la clientela de la zona, a través de su negocio a salido adelante, ya que ha sido una de las principales fuentes de ingresos, ella se a sabido ganar la clientela porque  su  manera de atenderlos es muy especial, Doña Gonzalina comenzó su negocio con una pequeña venta en su casa con no mas de cuatro productos pero ahora con la buena administración del misma a logrado un crecimiento grande.
Doña Gonzalina con el préstamo que reciba comprara maíz, frijoles, pollo, carnes, huevos, pan, azúcar, lácteos, embutidos, arroz, etc. esto le contribuirá a tener un mejor negocio, para cubrir los gastos en el hogar y  una mejor calidad de vida.
Doña Gonzalina sueña con surtir su negocio y poder cubrir la demanda de sus clientes. Ella esta solicitando el apoyo del préstamo de manera grupal con las siguientes personas, Don Juan su actividad principal es el transporte de pasajeros, en el taxi desde hace mas de 10 años y La señora Dinorah que tiene 8 años de dedicarse al comercio su actividad principal es la venta de achinería, ropa de dama de varón y de niño, mochilas, fajas, negocio que emprendió con el crédito que se le otorgo anteriormente.
Danli El Paraíso, Honduras - Agosto 2012
texts.en:
Gonzalina is dedicated to commerce and her main activity is the sale of groceries (grocery store) for over nine years. Gonzalina is very hard-working, she has customers in the area and thanks to her business she gets ahead, because it has been one of her main sources of income. She managed to gain customers because her way to serve them is very special. 

Gonzalina started her business with a small sale at home with no more than four products, but now, with a good administration for her business, she achieved large growth. With the loan she will receive, Gonzalina will buy corn, beans, chicken, meat, eggs, bread, sugar, dairy, cold meats, rice, etc. This will contribute to have a better business to cover the household expenses and a better quality of life. Gonzalina expects to stock better her business and meet the demand of her customers. 

She is requesting the support of this loan as a group with the following people. Juan's main activity is the transportation of passengers, he has a taxi for over ten years. Dinorah has eight years of experience in commerce, her main activity is the sale of trinkets, women, men, and children clothes, backpacks, belts, business that she launched with the previous loan they had granted. 

Danli El Paraíso, Honduras - August 2012

loans.use: to buy corn, beans, chicken, meat, eggs, bread, sugar, dairy, cold meats, rice, etc. for her business.

loans.name: Juan

texts.es:
Juan, de 48años de edad, es un hombre trabajador y empeñoso con muchas ganas de progresar.  Es conviviente Juana quien es la madre de sus 02 hijos y también se dedica a la agricultura.  Vive en compañía de su pareja, 01 hijo, 01 nuera, 01 nieto, habitando su propia casa, la cual compró con mucho esfuerzo. La actividad que realiza Juan es el  cultivo de palma aceitera contando para eso con un terreno propio de 27 hectáreas  en total que  adquirió hace años, donde tiene 03 hectáreas de cultivos de palma aceitera y 03 hectáreas de cultivos de cacao, siendo cultivos alternativos a la hoja de coca. Lleva 04 años ejerciendo éste oficio y  contando con la ayuda de sus hijos en las cosechas  compartiendo las ganancias, además de contratar  peones ocasionales. Considera rentable su actividad por la demanda que tiene y las buenas ganancias que le deja.
Le gusta su negocio pues lo conoce muy bien ya que leva muchos años dedicándose a ese oficio, y dicha experiencia la está pasando a sus hijos, además de las ganancias que le deja con la cual a sabido mantener a su familiar y procurar que no les falte lo necesario. 
Por lo contrario lo que no le gusta es que la lejanía de su ubicación ha demorado en llegar los servicios básicos como la luz eléctrica, pero con los nuevos programas sociales se está logrando mejorar, ahora tiene los deseos de ampliar su negocio y dejar a sus hijos con algo seguro para su futuro. Este es el préstamo número 08 con la institución MFP, por tanto espera de su colaboración, para continuar con sus objetivos. Además de estar bien con banco comunal pues conoce a la mayoría de sus integrantes y los considera buenas personas. Con el monto solicitado de 2500 nuevos soles, lo invertirá en la compra de abono para la producción de palma así como el pago de personal para la cosecha de sus productos.
texts.en:
Juan, 48, is a hardworking and dedicated man who has a strong desire to make progress.  He lives with Juana, who is the mother of his 2 children, and who is also a farmer.  He lives with his partner, one of his children, a daughter-in-law, and a grandchild. They live in a house that he bought with a lot of effort.  Juan cultivates palm oil on 27 hectares of land that he acquired years ago.  He has 3 hectares of land where he cultivates palm oil, and another 3 hectares where he cultivates cocoa; these being alternatives to growing coca leaves.  He has been doing this work for 4 years, and he relies on the help of his children during the harvests, with whom he shares the earnings.  In addition, he hires temporary dayworkers.  He considers his work to be profitable because of the demand that he has, and also the good earnings that he gets.

Juan likes his business because he knows it very well, having spent many years in this line of work.  He is passing this experience down to his children.  Also, with the earnings he generates he has known how to support his family and provide for all of their needs.

On the other hand, what he dislikes is that living so far in the country they have been delayed in getting basic services such as electricity.  But with the new social programs this is getting better.  Juan now wants to expand his business so that he can leave his children with something to make their future more secure.  

This is Juan's 8th loan with MFP, and he awaits your cooperation so that he can continue with his objectives.  In addition to being on good terms with his communal bank, he knows most of the members and considers them to be good people.  With the 2,500 Peruvian soles he requests, he will invest in the purchase of manure for his palm oil production, and he will also pay for labor to harvest his products.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and to pay for dayworkers

loans.name: Georgia

texts.en: Georgia lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married with four children and all her children go to school. She has no additional family members. She sells juice, soda and water in a shop that she rents. She sells her products on a retail basis. She has been in business for the last four years. She works seven days a week.  She has requested a loan of Uganda shillings 200,000 from MCDT – SACCO to buy more crates of soda, passion fruits, pineapple and watermelon to make juice. Her major business challenges are transportation and seasonality. Her goals and aspirations are to buy a big fridge and a plot of land. She lives in a rented house and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees and rent.

loans.use: to buy passion fruit, pineapples and watermelon to make juice

loans.name: Bethsalem Baco Group

texts.en:
Bethsalem is a Community Bank of 17 owners of small businesses who selected Léontine as chairwoman. Its members are jointly liable for loans granted by Kiva through the MFI HOPE DRCongo to grow their businesses. They organized themselves by affinity and proximity.

Léontine is 52 years old, married, and the mother of eight children between the ages of 12 and 32. She earns a living by selling chickens in her neighborhood southwest of Lubumbashi. She has a lot of customers. She started her business in 2002 with $150. She has already received eight loans from Microfinance Institution HOPE DRC and has repaid them correctly. Her business brings in a profit of $100 each week. 

Léontine is planning with the next loan to purchase more chickens to resell at a profit. Her ambition is to provide more chickens to more than a thousand customers in the medium term.

loans.use: to buy more chickens to resell at a profit

loans.name: Manal

texts.en: Manal, a 41-year-old married woman with eight family members from Ashrafia, Amman, Jordan, is requesting a loan of 400 JOD to buy clothes to resell to her friends and neighbors. In the future, she wants to increase her income.

loans.use: to buy clothes to resell.

loans.name: María Laura

texts.es:
La Señora. María es una de las socias fundadoras del banco comunal 10 de Agosto, vive por los alrededores de la parroquia Santa Ana, lugar que está rodeado por hermosos paisajes, desde el centro de esta parroquia se puede observar gran parte de la ciudad de Cuenca, su gente se dedica a la agricultura, al comercio y a la cría de animales, los jóvenes en especial trabajan en la ciudad ejerciendo diferentes actividades económicas, su gente en especial la mayor mantienen su vestimenta y todos conservan su cultura y tradiciones.
 
Doña María tiene 58 años de edad, está casada y en su unión conyugal ha concebido 4 hijos que ya son mayores de edad, tres de ellos son casados y viven independientes, su hijo soltero trabaja para solventar sus gastos personales. Su esposo presta sus servicios como guardia de seguridad, la casa en la que vive es  propia.

Ella pasa la mayor parte de su tiempo realizando los quehaceres de su hogar y para aportar a la economía de su casa se dedica a la cría de ganado, cuyes, aves y cerdos, vende sus animales en su comunidad, también trabaja en la agricultura y lo que cosecha  es solo para el consumo de su hogar.
 
Su nuevo crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de una vaca.

Su sueño es tener más animales.
texts.en:
María is one of the founding members of the communal bank 10 de Agosto (August 10th). She lives close to the Santa Ana parish, in an area surrounded by beautiful landscapes. A large part of the city of Cuenca can be observed from the center of the parish.  The local people work in agriculture, trade and raising livestock. Young people in particular work in the city, carrying out different economic activities. The people, especially the elderly, maintain their culture, traditions and clothing.  

Maria is 58 years old, is married and has four children with her spouse. All of her children are adults: three of them are married and live independently, and her single son works to cover his personal expenses. Her husband works as a security guard, and she owns her own house.

Maria spends most of her time doing chores in her home, and in order to contribute financially to her household, she breeds cows, guinea pigs, birds and pigs, which she later sells in her community. She also works in agriculture, and everything she grows is consumed by her household. 

Maria will invest her new loan in the purchase of a cow. Her dream is to own more animals.

loans.use: to buy a cow.

loans.name: Samuka J.'s Group

texts.en:
Pictured above are teachers from one of the primary schools in Kenema, a city in Eastern Sierra Leone. This group of teachers have come to SMT, a partner of Kiva in Makeni, Northern Sierra Leone, to seek a loan of 9,200,000 Sierra Leonean Leones to be able to solve their immediate financial challenges. At the end of each month, they will repay the loan, using their monthly salaries. 

Boima is the leader of this group of teachers. Born in Foindu Nongowa village, in Eastern Sierra Leone, the 39 year old has been in the teaching profession for six years now. He is married and has four children attending primary school. Boima has requested this loan to pay school fees for his children.

loans.use: to pay school fees for his children

loans.name: Rolando

texts.es:
El socio es el señor Rolando, él es soltero, tiene 49 años de edad y 2 hijos mayores, él se dedica a prestar servicio de taxi, y es con esta actividad que ha sabido sacar profesionales a sus hijos.  Rolando está solicitando el préstamo para dar mantenimiento a su herramienta de trabajo que es su taxi y comprar algunos accesorios para su vehículo.
Rolando está muy agradecido con KIVA por ayudarlo en su actividad y permitirle mantener operativo su carro. Rolando pertenece al banco comunal “GRAN RENOVACION”; de la ciudad del Cusco – Perú.
texts.en:
This member is Sr. Rolando. He is 49 years old, single, and has two grown children. Rolando provides taxi services. Through this business, he has been able to help his children become professionals.

Rolando is requesting a loan to pay for vehicle maintenance for his taxi. He will also buy a few accessories. Rolando is very grateful to Kiva for assisting him with his business and keeping his taxi in operation. He is a member of the Communal Bank “Gran Renovación” (Great Awakening) which is located in the city of Cusco, Peru.

loans.use: to buy accessories and pay for vehicle maintenance.

loans.name: Augusta

texts.en:
Meet 44-year-old Augusta from Kandeh, Southern Bo, Sierra Leone. She is widowed with four children between the ages of 12 and 28. Her children are currently attending school. In 1995, Augusta established her food stand business at her house. She began her business because she needs to raise money to support her family and give her children a good education. She works at the business throughout the week. She says that the main challenges to her business are competition and transportation costs.

Augusta requires a loan to buy cooking items like tomato paste, salt, onions and oil. She hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow her to increase her business and educate her children. In the future, Augusta plans to open a big shop. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy cooking items like tomato paste, salt, onions and oil.

loans.name: Ruben

texts.es:
El señor Rubén tiene 39 años de edad vive en la zona sur de Honduras junto con el vive su esposa y sus hijos quien le apoya en cada una de sus actividades, su negocio es servicio de taxi actividad que realiza desde hace 23 años en su comunidad donde vive. Don Rubén su negocio lo  hace de manera ambulante ya que es rubro  de transporte.
El crédito lo necesita para la compra de materiales de construcción como cemento, arena, ladrillo, varillas de hierro para reconstruir una pared de su casa, para mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
El impacto esperado con el financiamiento, es mejorar su vivienda y al mismo tiempo dar un mejor servicio a cada uno de sus clientes los cuales transporta a diario.
Don Rubén los planes a futuro es seguir creciendo cada día en su actividad de igual manera generarse mejores ingresos para tener una mejor calidad de vida para el y su familia.
Choluteca, Honduras - Septiembre del 2012
texts.en:
Sr. Rubén is 39 years old and lives in southern Honduras with his wife and children. He supports them in each of their activities. Rubén has been providing taxi services in the community where he lives for 23 years. His business requires him to travel since he works in the transportation sector.

The loan he is requesting will be used to buy construction materials such as cement, sand, bricks, and iron rods so that he can rebuild a wall in his house. This will improve his quality of life and that of his family. He expects the impact of his loan will improve his home. At the same time, he hopes to improve service to each of his customers who require transportation every day.

The future plans of Don Rubén include continuing to grow each day in his business and generating more income so that he and his family can have a better quality of life.

Choluteca, Honduras – September 2012

loans.use: to buy cement, sand, bricks, and iron rods for rebuilding a wall in his home.

loans.name: Las Princesas Group

texts.es:
Josefina es una mujer madura de 50 años, es integrante del grupo las princesas y vive en unión libre, tiene 2 hijos de 17 y 15 años de edad y ambos cursan la preparatoria. Ella tiene una tiendita de abarrotes la cual atiende junto con su esposo y sus hijos. El crédito la ayudara a resurtir su negocio, ya que estaba batallando porque tenia muchos pedidos pendientes. Su sueño es tener a sus hijos convertidos en profesionistas, ya que todo lo que hace lo hace por ellos y ampliar su tienda.

Las princesas es un grupo muy responsable es uno de los grupos mas viejos de la institución y todas sus integrantes se llevan muy bien.
texts.en:
Josefina is a mature, fifty-year-old woman and is a member of the group las princesas [the princesses].  She is in a civil union and has two children (ages 17 and 15) who are both in high school. She has a small grocery store that she looks after with her husband and children.  

The loan will help her restock her business as she was struggling because she had many outstanding orders.  Her dream is to have her children become professionals.  Everything that she does, she does for them and to advance her store.  

Las princesas is a very responsible group and is one of the oldest groups at the institution.  All of its members get along very well.

loans.use: to restock her business.

loans.name: Asmatu

texts.en:
Greetings from Sierra Leone! This is 37-year-old Asmatu from Moriba town in the southern area of the Bo District. She is married with four children between the ages of 5 and 17. Three of her children attend school. 

Asmatu runs a food business; she sells palm oil, ground nuts and pepper. She as been doing this for three years. She works from 7am until 6 pm, seven days per week. This is the only source of income she has. Asmatu says her business is doing well.  

Asmatu as requested a loan to purchase more food like palm oil, ground nuts and pepper. The extra income from this loan will allow her to educate her children and improve her living. In the future, she wants to expand her business. Thanks to you for your support!

loans.use: to purchase more food like palm oil, ground nuts and pepper.

loans.name: Dúo Lleno De Gracia 2 Group

texts.es:
Dúo Lleno de Gracia 2
Este Dúo está integrado por la señora Silvia originaria de Sumpango Sacatepéquez ella es madre de familia  es muy trabajadora ya que vive luchando para sacar adelante a sus hijos ya que la situación cada día es más difícil, ella se dedica a la elaboración y venta de refacciones en una escuela de la comunidad donde vive , está solicitando este crédito para la compra de mercadería para la elaboración de refacciones, el sueño de ella es tener un negocio más grande y generar más ganancias para ayudar a sus hijos a salir adelante y para que tengan un futuro de mas oportunidades de trabajo.
texts.en:
“Lleno de Gracia” (Gracious) 2 Group

This group includes Sra. Silvia, who is originally from Sumpango Sacatepéquez. She is a hardworking mother who strives to move her children forward even though her situation is more difficult each day. Silvia prepares and sell snacks at a school in the community where she lives.

She is requesting a loan in order to buy supplies for making snacks. Her dream is to have a larger business so that she can generate more income to help her children get ahead. This will also help them have more job opportunities in the future.

loans.use: to buy supplies for making snacks.

loans.name: Nora Cleofe

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Portoviejo, capital de Manabí conocida desde hace muchos años  como la ciudad de los reales tamarindos, se reúnen cada quince días  las socias del Banco Comunal Av. Del Ejército.

La señora Nora es nacida en la Provincia de Esmeraldas pero hace 8 años se vino a vivir a esta ciudad, tiene 41 años y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene cuatro hijos de 23, 21, 18 y 16 años, todos viven en su casa y estudian dos en Universidad y el menor esta en colegio. El marido es comerciante.

Ella para poder ganar algo por su cuenta y con esto ayudar a sus esposo con los gastos del hogar y más aun para los estudios de sus hijos se dedica a vender alimentos, tiene un puesto en una calle de la ciudad donde vende empanadas, corviches y colas, trabaja de lunes a sábado desde las 15h00 hasta las 19h00, ella también  elabora adornos y manualidades que entrega en ciertos bazares y locales de la ciudad, lleva más de 10 años con este negocio el cual le ha permitido ayudara a sus hijos a seguir adelante en sus estudios.

Este crédito es para comprar colas, plátano, maní aceite y otros víveres para la elaboración de sus platos. Está en el Banco Comunal hace 8 años  y le gusta porque los pagos son fáciles de hacer.

Sus sueños son tener una casa propia y un bazar para poder vender sus manualidades.
texts.en:
In the city of Portoviejo, the capital of Manabí, known for many years as the City of the Royal Tamarind Trees, the members of the Av. Del Ejército communal bank meet every 15 days. 

Nora was born in Esmeraldas Province, but 8 years ago she came to live in Portoviejo. She is 41 years old and is in a a civil union. She lives with her husband and their four children aged 23, 21, 18 and 16. Two of her children are college students and the youngest is in high school. Her husband is a shopkeeper.

In order to earn her own money, and to be able to help her husband with the household expenses as well as pay for her children's studies, Nora sells prepared foods. She has a food stand in a city street where she sells empanadas, "corviches" [a dish made from green bananas and fish], and sodas. She works Monday through Saturday from 3 p.m. until 7 p.m. Nora also makes ornaments and handicrafts that she delivers to bazaars and shops in the city. She has been in this business for more than 10 years, which has enabled her to help her children to continue with their studies.

This loan is for buying sodas, bananas, peanuts, oil and other provisions to make the food she sells. She has worked with the communal bank for 8 years, and she likes that the payments are easy to make. 

Nora's dreams are to own her own house as well as a store to be able to sell her handicrafts.

loans.use: To buy sodas, bananas, peanuts, oil, and other supplies.

loans.name: Amy Belinda

texts.es:
Amy de 27 años es una mujer trabajadora y emprendedora quien tiene una pulpería. Este negocio lo inicio con ayuda de su tía, además que como estaba cansada de vender de manera ambulante ropa, prendas y calzado decidió poner una pulpería.
La meta de Amy es lograr que su negocio sea una miscelánea es por ello que los crédito lo invierte en productos para el negocio
texts.en:
Amy is 27 years old, and is a hardworking, entrepreneurial woman who operates a small convenience store. Amy was motivated to open a store of her own, since she was tired of traveling around trying to sell clothing and shoes door to door. With support from her aunt, she decided to launch her small business.

Amy's goal is to grow her business into a general store with a wider variety of products offered to her customers. She plans to use the support from this loan to purchase merchandise to stock her store.

loans.use: to purchase staple grains and other products for her store, such as: rice, oil, beans, sugar, beef, chicken, vegetables, canned food, etc.

loans.name: Martha

texts.es: Martha, de 46 años de edad, es una mujer empeñosa y trabajadora, además de ser amable y muy colaboradora. Está casada con Muaro con quien tiene un negocio familiar  y es padre de sus 3 hijos a quienes quiere mucho.  Viven juntos cómodamente instalados en su propia casa. La actividad que realiza Martha es el transporte de pasajeros, contando para eso con una camioneta  que compró inicialmente para el transporte de carga como ganados de los fundos vecinos con una capacidad para 2 toneladas el cual compró con su propio capital, pero  por la demanda de pasajeros decidió empezar a transportar personas, haciendo su ruta por las carreteras de la región, uniendo varios pueblos y caseríos, contando con el apoyo de su pareja para el manejo del vehiculo. Vienen realizando desde hace más de 4 años años. Considera a su negocio bastante rentable por la demanda que tiene y la pocas personas que brindan éste servicio. Le gusta su negocio pues le permite viajar y conocer diversos lugares y zonas de la amazonía peruana, además de los ingresos económicos que le genera para solventar los gastos de su familia, ahora viendo la rentabilidad de su negocio ya cuenta con demanda desea seguir creciendo y ampliar su negocio. Deseando en un futuro ampliar la cantidad de su ganadería. Este será el préstamo número 5 con la institución MFP. Por ello cuenta con su colaboración para que pueda concretar sus planes. Además de sentirse cómoda con su banco comunal ya considera que es un grupo unido y solidario. Con el monto solicitado de 2000 nuevos soles, desea invertir en la compra de 4 llantas vehiculares para su camioneta a un costo promedio de 500 nuevos soles cada uno, el capital faltante lo pondrá de su propio capital, de esa manera seguirá trabajando con normalidad y teniendo más ingresos.
texts.en:
Martha is 46 years old and is a hardworking enterprising woman.  She is also friendly and very cooperative.  She’s married to Muaro, with whom she also has a family business.  The have three children whom they love very much and live together comfortably in their own home.

Martha transports passengers and has a van that she initially bought to move freight, such as her neighbors’ livestock.  She bought the van with her own money and it has a two-ton capacity.  She decided to begin transporting passengers because of the demand, and has a route along the regional roads that link the various towns and settlements.  Her husband helps her do the driving.

They’ve been doing this for more than four years and she considers it to be a very profitable business because of the high demand and the fact that there are only a few people providing this service.  She enjoys her business because it allows her to travel and learn about different areas and zones within the Peruvian Amazon.  It also provides her income that she uses to pay the household expenses.

Now that she’s seen the profitability of the business, and since she has a high demand, she is asking for this loan so that she can expand her business and increase her profits.  This will be her fifth loan through MFP and she is asking for your help in solidifying her plans.  Besides feeling comfortable with her communal bank, she considers her group to be very united and supporting.  She will use the 2,000 PEN to buy four tires for her van, for 500 PEN each.  She will make up the difference with her own capital, allowing her to continue working normally and increasing her income.

loans.use: to buy tires.

loans.name: Flor De Papa Group

texts.es:
El señor Teofilo esta soltero, tiene 30 años de edad, cursó los 4 años de educacion primaria, se dedica a la agricultura, específicamente a la siembra de papas, inicio este negocio gracias al apoyo de sus padres y hasta çel momento lleva 12 años de experiencia.

Organiza un grupo para poder solicitar un prestamos que lo utilizara para la compra de insumos, como semillas, abono, insecticida, etc. Para aumentar producción de papas, sus ventas y sus ingresos. Los demás integrantes del grupo se dedican al mismo  trabajo, la siembra de papas.
texts.en:
Teofilo is 30 years old and single, and has completed four years of primary schooling. He makes a living as a potato farmer, and started his farming business with support from his parents. He now has 12 years of experience in the field.

The group pictured above has come together and organized themselves well. They are presently requesting a loan which they plan to put towards the purchase of input products for planting their potato crops. With this investment, they plan to buy seeds, manure, insecticides, and other items, which they hope will help them to increase their potato production, sales and overall income. All of the group members make a living farming potatoes.

loans.use: to purchase input items for planting potatoes.

loans.name: Alicia

texts.es:
La socia Alicia tiene 22 años de edad es conviviente y tiene 1 hijo,la socia se dedica al negocio de venta de carne y quinua,ella lleva a lugares como Machupicchu,la socia lleva estos productos y luego los vende en forma ambulatoria,la socia se dedica a este negocio 4 años anteriormente se dedicaba al negocio de venta de ropa pero no le fue muy bien,el sueño de la socia es tener una tienda de abarrotes.La socia solicita el credito para comprar carne y quinua al por mayor.

La socia esta feliz con el credito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Alicia, 22, lives with her partner and has one child.  She makes a living selling meat and quinoa, taking the products to places like Machu Picchu and selling them on foot.  She has had this business for four years.  Previously she sold clothing but it didn't go very well for her.  Her dream is to have a grocery store.

She's requesting the loan to buy meat and quinoa wholesale.  She's happy about her loan and promises to make her payments on time.

loans.use: to buy meat and quinoa wholesale

loans.name: Bendu

texts.en: Bendu is 34 years old and married with four children, ages 6 to 18 years. She runs a palm oil business store in Kandeh Town, Southern Area, Bo District, Sierra Leone. She's been in this business for seven years. She sells palm oil by the gallon at a market store. She also receives income from her husband to help support the home; however, there are challenges to her business – the main one is transportation costs. Bendu requested this loan through BRAC Sierra Leone to purchase palm oil by the gallon and gari [cassava flakes]. She says that the extra income from this loan will help her to educate her children. In the future, she would like to see herself own a local palm oil industry. She is grateful for your support.

loans.use: to purchase palm oil by the gallon and gari.

loans.name: Andrés

texts.es:
El señor Andrés se dedica a la venta de especies y comida típica del estado de Veracruz, desde hace más de cuatro años. Este negocio ha sido fuente de ingreso para su familia.
Esta solicitando un préstamo para poder invertir en el negocio ya que le esta haciendo falta mercancía y a su local mas espacio donde trabajar y donde almacenar la mercancía. 
Desea mejorar el local y tener más variedad de mercancía para sus clientes quien le está solicitando más producto ya que se acerca la temporada de invierno y la gente consume más los alimentos. 
 El señor Andrés anterior mente ya ha tenido créditos y los a pagado puntual mente y han sido para el mejoramiento de su negocio.
texts.en:
Andrés makes a living selling spices and traditional food dishes from the state of Veracruz. He has operated his food business for more than four years, and it is his family's main source of income.

Andrés is requesting this loan in hopes of investing in his business by increasing his stock of merchandise, as well as by making improvements to his work space and storage space. He hopes that he can increase his inventory and offer a wider variety of products to customers before the winter season comes, since people tend to consume more food in the colder season.

With previous loans, Andrés has a great track record of leveraging financial support to the benefit and growth of his business, as well as a good record of making punctual repayments.

loans.use: to invest in his food sales business.

loans.name: Gs Gran Comision Group

texts.es:
La señora Merlín de 26 años de edad, vive con sus dos hijos y su conyugue en la comunidad de Nacaome, al sur de Honduras, se dedica desde hace 2 años al negocio de la elaboración y venta de tortillas, su venta es con los vecinos y amigos que todos los días de lunes a domingo llegan a comprar sus tortillas.
Merlín es la líder del grupo y es la que anima y coordina al grupo en sus pagos y para las nuevas solicitudes de los préstamos, ella es una persona seria y muy trabajadora.
Merlín esta solicitando el préstamo para comprarse leña y maíz que son la materia prima que necesita para elaborar las tortillas.
Merlín con el apoyo de este préstamo ella pretende mejorar sus ingresos al igual que Don Dumas que vende hamacas y Don Roberto, que se dedica a la venta de materiales de construcción y los fines de semana vende camarones.
El sueño de Merlín es tener su propia casa.
Al igual que sus demás compañeros de grupo que desean hacer sus casas.
SAN LORENZO, HONDURAS - Agosto del 2012.
texts.en:
Merlín, 26, lives with her two children and her husband in the community of Nacaome, in the south of Honduras.  For two years she has made a living making and selling tortillas.  Her sales are to her neighbors and friends who come to buy her tortillas every day of the week.

Merlín is the leader of the group and the one who encourages the group and coordinates their payments and loan requests.  She's a serious and very hardworking person.

Merlín is requesting the loan to buy herself firewood and corn, the raw materials she needs to make the tortillas.

With the support of the loan she hopes to improve her income, as do Dumas, who sells hammocks, and Roberto, who sells construction materials and, on the weekend, shrimp.

Merlín's dream is to have her own house, the same as the other members of her group.

San Lorenzo, Honduras, August 2012.

loans.use: to buy firewood and corn

loans.name: Hekima Baco Group

texts.en:
Bijoux, age 42 and married, was elected as the president of the community bank named “Hekima BACO”. This group consists of 19 members united in solidarity to receive loans from Kiva through IMF HOPE RDC with the goal of developing their businesses. 

Bijoux sells agricultural inputs at the market located southwest of Lubumbashi. He started his business in 1996. Bijoux is happy right now, as he is going to be able to to increase his stock of goods by buying more agricultural inputs with this loan. He will have a greater range of stock and be able to meet his customers' demands. He makes a profit of US $50 per week. With the money he earns, he hopes to provide financial support for his family. His dream is to someday start a farm. Bijoux is the father of six children between the ages of 5 and 11 years old. Four of them go to school.

loans.use: to increase his stock of goods by buying more agricultural inputs to resell at profit.

loans.name: Mohamed M.'s Group

texts.en:
Salone Microfinance Trust (SMT) is very pleased to present to you this group of teachers from Kenema, a city in Eastern, Sierra Leone. They have applied for a loan of 8,400,000 leones from SMT/Kiva lenders in order to meet their immediate financial needs. Some of these teachers will use their share of the loan to buy house building materials; some will use it to pay school fees for their children and so on. Using their monthly salaries, they will gradually repay the loan. Their school’s bursar is directly responsible for making the repayments on their behalf. 

Fatmata is the leader of this group of teachers. She is 44 year old, a native of the village of Gorahun in Eastern, Sierra Leone. She is married and has one child who is in college. Fatmata has been a teacher for 20 years now. She will use her share of the loan to pay college fees for her child.

loans.use: to pay college fees for her child

loans.name: Cécile Elvire

texts.fr: Cécile est une jeune femme de 25 ans vivant dans la capilatle. Elle tient une épicerie dans un coin de la place depuis 02 ans. Grâce à son dynamisme et sa détermination elle s'est faite une vaste clientèle qu'elle aimerait continuer de satisfaire. Pour cela, elle sollicite un prêt qui lui permettrait d'acquérir les biens suivants: pâquets de légumes verts, un sac de macabo, divers régimes de banane, des cajots de tomates et divers. Les bénéfices obtenus grâce à ce financement lui permettront de passer de détaillant à grossiste tout en subvenant aux besoins de sa famille.
texts.en: Cecile is a young woman of 25 who lives in the capital. She has run a grocery in a corner of the square for two years. Thanks to her energy and her determination, she has developed a vast clientele that she hopes to continue to satisfy. To do this she requests a loan which will enable her to purchase the following goods: packets of green vegetables, a bag of macabo cocoyam, various sorts of banana, crates of tomatoes, and various other products. The profit obtained due to this loan will allow her to progress from retailer to wholesaler at the same time as providing for the needs of her family.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of green vegetables, a bag of macabos...

loans.name: Andres Avelino Caceres Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “ANDRES AVELINO CACERES”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Rosamaria ella es conviviente y tiene 36 años y tiene 2 hijos; La socia trabaja en su negocio de tienda de abarrotes,la socia vende productos d eprimera necesidad como arroz,azucar,leche,aceite,galletas y dulces,la socia tambien tiene un motataxi que hace servicio de taxi en la ciudad de Calca,su esposo es el que maneja el mototaxi y los dos sacan adelante a sus hijos,la socia en su negocio de tienda de abarrotes tiene 4 años y el va muy bien y en sus tiempos libres a la socia le gusta salir a pasear con sus hijos,el sueño de la socia es ampliar el negocio de tienda de abarrotes. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar productos para su tienda de abarrotes como arroz,azucar,leche,aceite y galletas.
La socia que esta pegada a la foto grupal se le tomo despues la foto porque pidio permiso por motivos de trabajo.
 Los otros socios  se dedican al negocio de venta de tienda de abarrotes, negocio de venta de animales, negocio de venta de golosinas y negocio de restaurant.

La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
These members belong to the “ANDRES AVELINO CACERES” communal bank, located in the Cusco district, province, and department.

Rosamaria is 36 years old, married, and has two children.  She has a grocery store business and sells primary needs products, such as rice, sugar, milk, cooking oil, and candy.  She also has a moto-taxi that provides services throughout the city of Calca.  Her husband drives the moto-taxi and they both move their children ahead in these ways.  She’s had her grocery business for four years and things are going well for her.  She likes to go for walks with her children in her spare time and her dream is to expand her grocery store.  She is asking for this loan in order to stock her store with things like rice, sugar, milk, cooking oil, and cookies.

The small picture added to the photograph is of a member who was not able to attend because of work commitments.

The other members are involved in other businesses, such as selling groceries, animals, snacks, and are in the restaurant business.

[Rosamaria] appreciates those who are part of this dream and she promises to make her payments on time.

loans.use: to stock her store.

loans.name: Ana Isabel

texts.es:
La socia es la señorita Ana, soltera con 33 años de edad y 3 hijos en edad escolar, ella se dedica  la administración de su restaurante pollería, actividad que viene realizando para desde hace algunos años y que le ha permitido sacar adelante a sus 3 hijos.
Ana está solicitando el préstamo para comprar insumos como pollos para la producción de su pollería. Ana está muy agradecida con la ayuda de KIVA, por ayudarla a fortalecer su actividad económica la cual le permitirá ofrecer  una mejor educación a sus hijos. La socia pertenece al banco comunal “El Templo del Inca”; de la ciudad del Cusco – Perú.
texts.en:
Ana is 33 years old, she is single and she has 3 children who go to school. She runs a restaurant with a poultry shop, and activity she has been engaging in for a few years and thanks to which she has succeeded in providing for her 3 children.
Ana is requesting a loan to buy ingredients such as chickens to sell them in her poultry shop. Ana is deeply grateful to KIVA’s help, as this helps her strengthening her economic activity, thus allowing her to provide a better education to her children. She is a member of “El Templo del Inca” (The Inca Temple), a Communal Bank of the city of Cusco, Peru.

loans.use: To buy chickens.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To repair the ceiling inside her home.

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.en:
Cecilia is 40 years old and married with five children, ages 5 years to 22 years old. She runs a general merchandise business in Kandeh town Southern area Bo District in Sierra Leone. She began this business in order to generate income to support the home. 

She's been in this business for five years and sells mayonnaise, sugar, milk, cigarettes and bread.     She also receives income from one of her relatives.  At present she is faced with price inflation.

She requested this loan through BRAC Sierra Leone to buy assorted goods to expand her business such as mayonnaise, sugar, milk, cigarettes and bread.  She says that the extra income from this loan will help her to educate her children and start up a current account. In the future, she would like to see her business expanded to a higher level. She is grateful for your support.

loans.use: to buy assorted goods like mayonnaise, sugar, milk, cigarettes and bread.

loans.name: Felipe

texts.es:
El señor Felipe anterior mente ha tenido crédito con KIVA los cuales han sido para el mejoramiento de su negocio y los a pagado puntual mente.
Esta solicitando nuevamente un crédito para invertir en comprar mercancía para su tienda de abarrotes que tiene en su domicilio,  sus clientes le están solicitando que tenga más variedad de marcación.  
El señor Felipe también cuenta con un ingreso extra que es de su trabajo en una fabrica, como supervisor de producción este ingreso será para solventar los gastos familiares y escolares de sus cuatro hijos, tiene dos que actualmente estudian la secundaria y dos están cursando el siclo escolar de la primaria. 
Las ganancias del negocio serán para el pago del crédito, su esposa es quien el ayuda atender la tiendo cuando el tiene que salir a trabajar.
texts.en:
Felipe has had Kiva loans in the past, which have helped him to improve his business.  He repaid them on time.

He is requesting a new loan in order to invest in merchandise for his grocery store, which he runs out of his home.  His customers have requested that he offer a greater variety of brands.

Felipe also has an income from his work as a production supervisor in a factory.  He uses this income to pay for the household expenses and his children’s education.  He has two children who attend junior high school and two who attend elementary school.

The profits from the business will go toward repaying the loan.  His wife helps him tend the store when he is at work.

loans.use: to stock his store.

loans.name: José Juan

texts.es:
El señor José Juan y su esposa desean realizare una mejora a su vivienda, le esta haciendo falta la pintura del exterior y interior de su casa, ya que por el paso de los años se ha ido desgastando ya da una mala imagen.
Solicitan el crédito para poder realizar la mejora ya que no cuentan con el dinero necesario para comprar la pintura especial para el exterior y para el interior y así también pagarle a la persona que se encargara de realizar la mejora.
El señor José Juan es empleado de una compañía de aires acondicionados
texts.en:
Jose and his wife would like to make improvements to their home.  It needs to be painted both inside and out, since it has deteriorated over the years and has become an eyesore.

They are asking for this loan so that they can make the improvements, since they don’t have the money to buy the paint or pay the painter.

Jose works for an air conditioning firm.

loans.use: to repaint his home.

loans.name: Mamie

texts.en:
Mamie, age 32, resides with her husband and two children in Jacob Town. Her children are 7 and 12 years old. Her husband is a businessman. He gave her the initial capital to start in her business. She has a table adjacent to the supermarket, where she sells pineapples, oranges, plums and cucumbers. She has been in the business for the past five years. Because of the location of her business, she makes profit and, with the profit, she buys more goods and helps her husband with the expenses of the family. 

Mamie has requested a loan to purchase more pineapples, plums, oranges and cucumbers for the business. Her future plans are to educate her children and build a house.

loans.use: to purchase more pineapples, plums, oranges and cucumbers for her business.

loans.name: Favour

texts.en:
Greetings from Sierra Leone! This is 35-year-old Favour from Moriba Town Branch, Southern Area, Bo District. She is married with two children, ages 6 and 15 years old. Both of her children attend school. Favour runs a clothing and textiles store. She sells blouses, jeans, skirts and African dress. She has been running this business for five years. She works at the business from 7 a.m. until 6 p.m., 7 days per week. The business is the only source of income she has. At present, she is challenged with transportation costs. 

Favour requested a loan in order to buy more clothes such as blouses, jeans, skirts and African dress. The extra income from this loan will allow her to educate her children and improve her status. In the future, she wants to expand her business. She thanks you for your support!

loans.use: to buy more clothes such as blouses, jeans, skirts and African dress.

loans.name: Fatmata's Group

texts.en:
These are teachers of a primary school based in Kenema city. This school was founded in 1973. Teachers of the school have come to SMT, a partner of Kiva.org in Makeni, Northern Sierra Leone, to seek a loan. They are requesting a loan of 13,700,000 Sierra Leonean Leones for the entire group. With the help of this loan, these teachers will be in a better position to buy or invest in something that their mere salaries cannot let them do.
 
Massah is the leader of the group. She is age 36. She was born in Kalaihun, in Eastern Sierra Leone. She is married to a teacher and has two children who are attending primary school. Massah has been in the teaching profession for 13 years now.
