She has requested this loan in order to buy house-building materials like cement, iron corrugated zinc, rods, etc. for the construction of a family dwelling house.

loans.use: to buy house-building materials like cement, iron corrugated zinc, rods, etc. for the construction of a family dwelling house

loans.name: Christina

texts.en:
Greetings from Sierra Leone! This is 38-year-old Christina from Kandeh town, Southern area, Bo District. She is married with five children between the ages of 5 years and 20 years old. Two of her children are attending school. 

Christina runs a meat business within a busy market area. She sells pork, cow meat, and goat meat. She has been running this business for over six years. She works at the business from 7am until 6 pm, 7 days per week. She also raises chickens and ducks at home as another source of income. Christina says that her business is doing well; she has more customers and she has more sales on occasion.   
 
Christina has requested a loan in order to expand her meat business. The extra income from this loan will allow her to send her children to university and improve her living standard. In the future, she wants to expand her business. She thanks you for your support!

loans.use: to buy more pork for sale.

loans.name: Ushuuda Baco Group

texts.en:
Jolie is the leader of the Community Bank named “Ushuuda BACO” which means “Testimony” in English. It is composed of 10 members united in solidarity for receiving Kiva loans with the goal of developing their businesses.

Jolie has been part of the micro-enterprise world since 2003. He sells construction materials in the city of Lubumbashi. He has acquired solid experience in this area and works hard with good management skills in order to realize his dream of one day opening a hardware shop in his environment. He would also like to achieve financial independence through his business that earns him US$100 per week. He works to the best of his abilities and uses his contacts so that he might achieve his goals. 

Jolie is a trustworthy client of the MFI HOPE RDC, having twelve times obtained and correctly repaid loans. He will increase his stock of materials with his next loan by buying iron water pipes, etc., and reselling them at a profit. 32 years old, Jolie is married and the father of a son who is 5 years old. His son goes to school.

loans.use: to increase his inventory of construction materials

loans.name: Rey De Reyes Group

texts.es:
El grupo Rey de Reyes lo conforman tres personas trabajadoras y emprendedoras una de ellas es María del Carmen quien tiene una pulpería desde hace 18 años y tiene un molino. Su meta es llegar a tener un minisúper y el crédito lo invertirá para surtir el negocio.
Las otras integrantes son María quien tiene una tortillería con su suegra y Luz quien vende hielo, helados y sopa los domingos.
texts.en:
The “Rey the Reyes” group is made up of three hardworking and enterprising people.  Maria del Carmen is one of the members and she has had a general store for 18 years.  She also has a mill.  Her goal is to have a small supermarket and this loan will help her to stock her business.

The other members include Maria, who has a tortilla factory with her mother in law, and Luz who sells ice, frozen treats, and soup on Sundays.

loans.use: to stock her store.

loans.name: Eugenia Betzabeth

texts.es:
La socia es la señorita Eugenia, con 35 años de edad, casada y con 2 hijos en edad escolar, ella se dedica  al  comercio de granos como maíz, garbanzos, menestras etc. y los comercializa de forma directa a sus clientes, además de esta actividad, ella también realiza manualidades y elabora elementos para el hogar como mantelería y cortinas. Eugenia desea poder ofrecer una mejor educación a sus hijos, por ello se sacrifica y trabaja en cuanta cosa pueda, para poder mejorar sus ingresos económicos.
Eugenia está solicitando el préstamo para comprar mercadería como maíz y menestras. La Socia está muy agradecida con la ayuda de KIVA, por ayudarla a fortalecer  y hacer crecer su actividad económica la cual le permitirá ofrecer  una mejor vida a su familia. La socia pertenece al banco comunal “El Templo del Inca”; de la ciudad del Cusco – Perú.
texts.en:
Eugenia is 35 years old, she is married and she has 2 children who go to school. She engages in selling products such as corn, chickpeas, vegetable stews, selling them directly to her customers. On top of this activity, she also creates handicrafts and home products such as table linens and curtains. Eugenia wants to provide her children with a better education, and for this reason she sacrifices herself engaging in as many activities as she can in order to increase her earnings.
Eugenia is requesting a loan to buy products such as corn and vegetable stews. She is deeply grateful to KIVA’s help, as this helps her strengthening her economic activity and making it grow, thus allowing her to provide a standard of living to her family. She is a member of “El Templo del Inca” (The Inca Temple), a Communal Bank of the city of Cusco, Peru.

loans.use: To buy corn and vegetable stews.

loans.name: Fatmata

texts.en:
Fatmata is 25 years old and married, the mother of one child, age 5 years. 

She runs a palm oil business at Kandeh town, Southern area, in Bo, Sierra Leone. She started this business to raise income to support her home.  Her husband is a village teacher, but his income is not enough for them. Business is the only thing her parents taught her.  

She's been in this business for six years.  She sells palm oil within her environment; she does not have any source of income except her business. She says her business is doing well because she moves door to door to introduce her product, so by that, more customers are coming. 

She requested this loan through BRAC Sierra Leone to buy more palm oil. She says the extra income from this loan will help her improve her business and send her child to school. 

In the future, she would like to open a palm oil store. She is grateful for your support.

loans.use: to buy more palm oil.

loans.name: Betty

texts.en:
Greetings from Sierra Leone!  This is Betty, 50 years old and from Kandeh town, Southern area Bo District. She is married, with four children between the ages of 20 and 32 years. One of her children is attending school. 

Betty runs a gari business, in Kandeh town.  She sells garie. She has been running this business for more than ten years. She works at the business from 7 a.m. until 6 p.m., 7 days a week.  Betty says the main challenges to her business are competition in the market and lack of enough capital to take care of her home. She also receives income from her husband, who also helps her to take care of the home. 

Betty has requested a loan to buy more product of gari and palm oil. The extra income from this loan will allow her to increase her business and pay her installment. In the future, she wants to expand her business. 

She thanks you for your support!

loans.use: to buy more product of gari and palm oil.
